loans.name: Gorreth

texts.en:
Gorreth is a 45-year-old single mother of three children aged between 5 and 17 years. None of her children goes to school because she couldn’t raise school fees. She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. Gorreth takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

She incurs transportation costs to and from Kawala. She works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Gorreth works seven days a week, receiving an average of twenty-five customers a day. She sells to all categories of people, at both retail and wholesale prices.

Gorreth owns a canteen at the Nakulabye Church of Uganda primary school. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of cooking oil, baking powder, charcoal and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works from an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and medication.

She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for four years, now servicing her seventh loan. Gorreth joined MCDT because it was near her home and the group was easy to work with. She wants to use this loan to buy more baking powder and cooking oil. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger, and she would like to start distributing samosas, chapatti and pan cakes to different nearby schools.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, flour and baking powder

loans.name: Lilieth

texts.en: Lilieth T. is from the village of Bungad San Pablo, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Lilieth is married and has 6 school-aged children. Lilieth owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lilieth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised pigs. In 2008, Lilieth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilieth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Lilieth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lilieth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica al engorde de animales.
Gloria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a member of the Lupakas communal bank for three years, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno state. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed secondary school. She fattens animals for a living. With her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300 soles she was able to increase her capital and purchase sheep. She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles which she will used to purchase a cow. Her dream for the future is to have a house in Ilave and for her children to be professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Thy Prum, 36, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have no children yet.  

Ny has been in the oyster business for more than two years and her husband is a motor taxi driver. She hopes to supplement her income with another business: raising chickens. She will be able to earn extra income from the business.  

Hence, Ny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has been married to Reynaldo for seventeen years now. She is 41 years old and has seven children with the oldest being fourteen years old.

Lucy farms for a living, growing rice crops on her farm. When not busy farming, she spends her time raising pigs to add to her family’s income.

Lucy joined CEVI to expand her business opportunities. She requested a loan of Php 7,000 which she will use to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will also use some to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 36 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas; Juana de 11 años y Yasmin de 5 años. Su casa es pequeña y hecha a base de esteras.   
Desde hace muchos años atrás trabaja como ama de llaves, por lo que recibe una remuneración mensual. Paralelamente, por las tardes vende anticuchos (brochetas) en un puesto que acondiciona a 3 cuadras de su casa. A inicios se quedaban con algunos anticuchos, lo cual significaba pérdida para ella, pues no tenía refrigeradora y la carne se malograba.
Pero su perseverancia, la llevó a incrementar sus ventas y estabilizar su negocio, hoy los días de mayor demanda son lo fines de semana, cuando reúne mayor cantidad de dinero.
Ella está muy contenta con lo que hace, por eso todas las noches se esmera en preparar el aderezo de los anticuchos, para que estén sabrosos y no se quede con ninguno.
A Guadalupe no le importa pasar el frío de la noche, solo tiene como meta construir su casa de material noble, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar arduamente, y asegura que hará realidad sus sueños.

Este es su tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y está comprometida a pagar puntualmente, como en sus anteriores créditos. Asimismo, está conforme con el trabajo de su grupo, puesto que todas son sus vecinas, y son muy responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la renovación de su parrilla para poder cocinar más porciones del platillo que vende.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 36, lives with her partner and their two daughters: Juana, 11 and Yasmin, 5. Their house is small and made of straw matting. For many years now she has worked as a housekeeper, for which she gets a monthly salary. At the same time, though, in the afternoons, she sells anticuchos (various grilled meats on skewers) in a stand that she sets up 3 blocks from home. Sometimes, she had some anticuchos left over, which meant a loss for her, because she did not have a refrigerator and the meat would spoil. However, she persevered, increased her sales and stableized her business. Today, her greatest demand is on weekends and this is when her earnings are highest. She is very happy with her work so she puts her best effort every night into preparing the seasoning for the meat so that it will be delicious and she won't have any left over at the end of the day. Guadalupe isn't affected by the cold of night; her only goal in sight is to build her house with more substantial materials. In order to do so, she knows that she must work very hard and she assures us that she will see her dreams come true. This is her third loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Aslo, she is satisfied with the work her group is doing because all the members are her neighbors and all are very responsible. The funds requested will be used to refurbish her grill so that she can cook more of the items she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte A. sells cooked rice and a variety of yams with sauces like garden eggs (small eggplants) and greens known locally as 'kotommere'. She runs her business at Elmina.  Charlotte has no educational background.  She is married and has six dependents.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

Charlotte has been selling rice for some time now. She helps her husband with the general up-keep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy rice and yams and other ingredients to prepare the food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a small shop she can sell out of.

loans.use: to buy rice and yams and other ingredients to prepare the food for sal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is into fashion designing. She makes clothes in different styles for her customers and also sells sarongs to earn a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. The creative nature of the fashion business makes it more interesting to her and she has been in the business for over six years.                               

She hopes to improve and expand her business; she is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

Esther is 35 years old, happily married with four children who are doing well. From the proceeds, she could assist her husband in keeping the home financially. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Abdel-Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel-Rahman has owned a fishing boat since 2000. He is an experienced fisherman; he has been working for over forty years.

With his first loan of US $1,000 from Kiva lenders, Abdel-Rahman was able to repair his boat. He’s pleased with his decision to take a loan from Ameen. He has been very reliable with his repayments and has actually repaid his loan in full severA. months early.

Today, Abdel-Rahman is requesting a larger loan of $2,000 to carry out maintenance work on his boat to increase its safety features. In the future, he would like to purchase a bigger and more technically advanced boat so that he can expand his business even more.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba D. is married to her wonderful husband who is a farmer. She has no educational background. Aba sells plastic bowls, containers and also fries doughnuts at Abura. She has been selling containers and bowls for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  

Aba uses her income to help her husband with the general welfare of the home.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers as demand for them is continuously increasing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to build a shop where she can store her plastics for customers to come and buy.

loans.use: purchase more plastic containers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Video Discs and DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Dara Group

texts.en:
Mahro Gul is the group leader of Dara group. She lives in the 8th District of Kabul, Afghanistan and she supports all her family members through her monthly income. She is a carpet weaver and would like to expand her business. She is confident that, with this loan, she can buy good quality weaving materials and a new carpet frame and can weave carpets according to the demand of her customers. 
She hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase carpet weaving materials to expand her business

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children. One of her children has a business and the other six are in school. Two of her children graduated from high school and are entering college, two are in secondary school, and two are in primary school. 

Julienne is an industrious lady who sells sweet potatoes and local sorghum beer wholesale. She has been in this business since she was 18 years old. Also, when it’s time to harvest a particular crop, Julienne and her husband buy the produce locally and sell it in the city. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sacks of sorghum for her inventory, because she expects the sorghum season to end soon and the prices to rise.

loans.use: Buying sorghum to stock for the next season when it's scarce

loans.name: Vignon Justin

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, L. Vignon Justin est marié à GBEMENOUChristine, une ménagère. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Depuis cinq ans, Justin s'est installé au quartier Tchonvi, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il habite avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Justin n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'il exerce depuis une dizaine d'année. Justin s'approvisionne en matériels de coiffure à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'acquérir des matériels plus adaptés et nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son atelier de coiffure, Justin sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Justin Vignon L. is married to Christine Gbemenou, a housewife. The couple cares for five children, of which four are their own. Only some of the children attend school. Five years ago, Justin moved to the Tchonvi neighborhood, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, where he lives with his wife and children. Together, the couple supports the many needs of their family. Justin did not go to school, but learned hairstyling, his occupation for a dozen years. Justin obtains his hairstyling supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. With the goal of strengthening his business and acquiring materials that are better adapted to and necessary for the successful operation of his hair salon, Justin is requesting his first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clippers and hairstyling products.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has seventeen people who have selected Mrs. Touch S. as a village bank president. Mrs. S. was born in 1963 and is located in Chrouy village, Takeo province. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan in various ways to increase their income for this current year. Mrs. Touch S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a Khmer cake seller, door-to-door. She is a widow with a child who is a laborer. She tries to work a lot but she earns very little to support her family's living costs. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Touch S. is seeking for a loan to buy three piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Kun Chhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan is for eleven people who live in Kampong Luong village, Takeo province. All group members will use a portion of the loan in different ways to support their businesses. Mrs. Kun C., who was born in 1962, has been selected by the other members as the group leader. She and her husband, Mr. Lan Nai, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land where they grows crops, which they sell to support their family. Mrs. Kun C.'s problem is that her fields needs to be prepared to grow crops, but she does not have enough money. To improve production, she is applying for a loan for her farming expenses this current year. She is the mother of four children: three are farmers, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: Farming expenses

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Azucena A. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 25 años de laborar. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos para mejora de vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de zinc y medicamento.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena A. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher in the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has worked for 25 years. She has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and they have granted her four loans for housing improvements. The loan requested is for the purchase of zinc and medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, and to purchase medicine

loans.name: Kokovi

texts.fr: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme Kokovi M. est née en 1960 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement constitue une opportunité pour elle d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu et lui permettra de disposer de ressources nécessaires pour s’occuper des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme Kokovi M. est née en 1960 à Aného dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge deux (02) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement constitue une opportunité pour elle d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu et lui permettra de disposer de ressources nécessaires pour s’occuper des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable

loans.name: Reynan

texts.en:
Reynan M. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 28 years old. Reynan is single. To make a living, Reynan owns & operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Reynan has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Reynan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Reynan is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve and maintain his business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Reynan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve and maintain the business

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 1-Zzana, Kampala

texts.en: 51-year-old Harriet N. was previously in the poultry business. With time, however, her priorities changed. About three years ago she began selling charcoal, bananas, tomatoes and onions in Zzana, Kampala. To reach where she is today, she had to summon a lot of diligence to face both trying and flourishing times. Harriet comes across as a happy-go-lucky woman who speaks very highly of her four kids, who she cares for very much. Harriet says that she owes it to herself to see that her kids get a good education. In a week her cash inflows are approximately 50,000 shillings. Harriet is requesting this loan to buy more lucrative cash crops like pineapples and cabbages to resell primarily to restaurant owners. She is affiliated with the Wofunira group-Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase more lucrative cash crops like pineapples and cabbages to resell

loans.name: Gerardo Ramón

texts.es: El señor Gerardo V. A. labora para UPONIC como guarda de seguridad es casado con dos personas a su cargo y solicita C$ 2,500 córdobas para hacerse unos exámenes de la vista y comprar sus lentes. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su beligerancia.
texts.en:
Gerardo works for UPONIC as a security guard.  He is married and has two dependents.  

Gerardo is requesting 2,500 Córdobas to pay for eye exams and to buy his lenses.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for its determined help.

loans.use: FOR EYE EXAM COSTS AND EYE GLASSES

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una comerciante de Ropa, verduras y helados, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el Cantón el Rosario de San Francisco Gotera, vive con su esposo don Walter y sus hijos Eugenia de 14 años de edad y Walter de 8 años de edad, ella vende helados en su casa y en el mercado de San Miguel vende ropa y verduras.
Lucia y su esposo está en proceso de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda es por lo cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro a la orilla de su casa, esto le ayudara a tener en mejores condiciones su hogar y con más seguridad por cualquier problema que puedan tener estarán más seguros. 
Ella aspira una casa grande en buenas condiciones muy cómoda donde puedan desarrollarse sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia sells clothes, vegetables and ice-cream.  She is 36 years old and lives in Rosario de San Francisco Gotera canton with her husband, Walter, and their children, Eugenia, 14, and Walter, 8.  She sells ice-cream from home and sells clothes and vegetables in the San Miguel market.

Lucia and her husband are in the process of making some home improvements so they are asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall along the perimeter of their house which will improve their home’s conditions and provide more security so that they will be more secure if any problem should arise.

She aspires to a larger, more comfortable house with better conditions where her children can grow up.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
la joven Lidia B. tiene 28 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fredys Alberto García y viven en el barrio Las Brisas de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Lidia se dedica a la venta de calzado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome ademas de la venta de zapatos tambien vende sillas plasticas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de zapatos  y de esta manera tener mas variedad de los mismos ya que para la epoca de navidad las ventas son muy buenas y desea estar preparada para dicha epoca.
texts.en:
Lidia B. is 28 years old.  She is married to Fredys Alberto García and they live in Las Brisas neighborhood, in the city of Nacaome.

Lidia sells footwear in Nacaome city market.  As well as shoes, she also sells plastic chairs.

She will use her loan to buy shoes so that she has a greater variety to sell because sales are very good during the Christmas period and she would like to be prepared.

loans.use: To buy general footwear

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 41 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con ciertos ahorros que y arduo trabajo pues siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer muy independiente. En donde la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos, por lo que se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos que se le han otorgado. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan y detergentes ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en: Mercedes is 41.  She has had a general store for the last nine years.  She started this business with some savings and lots of hard graft, since she has always liked to be a very independent woman.  Her clients ask for a wide range of products, which is why she feels very grateful for the funding she has received.  She will use this loan to buy basic goods, sweets, soft drinks, bread, and detergents to have more stock for this good time of year for sales.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zakayo Erot

texts.en:
Zakayo Erot E. is 26 years old and married to Juddy Lotoom, a housewife. They have one school-going child aged 10. They live in Lodwar, Kenya. Zakayo operates a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. He earns a monthly profit of 12,000 KES.
Zakayo learnt about Kiva partner, KADET, through a credit officer. He is applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES, which he intends to use to buy three bags of sugar, five boxes of cooking oil and three boxes of washing powder. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his shop business. In the future, Zakayo wishes to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and washing powder

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the last six years, Ama Y. has made a living selling toiletries in the traditional way -- from a bowl she carries on top of her head. She lives in Abrafo, which is located near the larger town of Abura. She supplements her income by selling palm oil. Ama has received middle school education, is divorced and has six children. She is responsible all by herself for paying her children's school fees, and providing them with the materials they need to go to school. She will use her loan to boost her business by buying more goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her small business by buying more goods to sell

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda B. is from the village of Brgy. Bagahabag, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Yolanda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de útiles escolares, la socia atiende desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros y borradores.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the communal bank, “SUMAC AYLLU”, which is located in the Cusco District and Province, in the Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old and has 2 children.  She alternates her time between working in her grocery business and selling school supplies.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  She has been able to provide for her children through these businesses.  She would like to expand and improve her grocery shop and school supplies business.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as notebooks, pens, books, and erasers.

Luz Marina is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies, such as notebooks, pens, books, and erasers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of potatoes, beans, rice and more

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Shanti nagar for the past six years. She is married to K.. K. is an electrician by profession and offers electrical repair services to his clients. He is an expert in his field and satisfies his clients with his work. He has been operating this business for the past five years. 
Jameela has three children. All of them are below 10 years old and do not attend school because Jameela can’t afford their school fee. She is very active and supportive in nature. She operates a business selling animals. She buys young animals from the animal market, raises them and sells them to butchers and other people. She operates her business from her home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the latest repair tools to provide better quality services to his clients and to earn better profits. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring good profits to her husband.  Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jameela”.

loans.use: to buy the latest repair tools

loans.name: Agbegnidor

texts.fr: Monsieur  Agbegnidor  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de matériaux de constructions.  Il a commencé depuis 1997 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite il revend en détail dans un magasin à Nukafu. Il est très accueillant ce qui lui permet d’avoir plus de clients tous les jours. La demande est énorme et son stock ne pourrait couvrir toutes ces demandes, raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour se réapprovisionner. Il a 38 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il habite Djidjolé un quartier périphérique de Lomé.
texts.en:
Mr. Agbegnidor has a revenue-generating business selling construction supplies and equipment. He started it in 1997 and gets his supplies wholesale at the main market of Lomé. He then sells them retail in a store in Nukafu. He is very accommodating, and this enables him to have more customers all the time. The demand is enormous, and his stock of goods would not be able to meet the demand. This is why he is requesting a loan to stock up again. 

He is 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives in Djidjolé, an outlying district of Lomé.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and supplies

loans.name: Maricela Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos Maricela, tiene 24 de edad, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia fisioterapia en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya tres ciclos y le gusta la facilidad de pago de los créditos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo de distintas marcas nacionales y extranjeras, entre las marcas que ella vende están Unimoda, Nivi, Nuestra piel, entre otras, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, trabaja todos los días ya que ella aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de clases que también son sus clientes. Nos cuenta que deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Ella empezó este negocio hace un año y fue con el primer crédito que hizo en el banco comunal,  esto le ha ayudado para seguir con sus estudios que gracias a Dios este año culmina.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Sus sueños son seguir incrementando su negocio y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi. This place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have been recognized on a national and international level. It is also where the famous Panama hats are made.

One can meet Sra. Maricela in this place. She is 24 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents. She is studying physical therapy at Laica Eloy Alfaro University in Manta. Maricela has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the convenient repayment options.

She sells clothing through catalogs of various domestic and foreign brands. The brands that she sells include Unimoda, Nivi, Nuestra Piel, and others. Maricela sells door-to-door and through orders. She works every day and takes advantage of selling to her classmates as well as her customers. Maricela says she offers her products on credit and collects payment on the weekends. She started this business a year ago with the first loan she received from the Communal Bank. As a result, her business has helped her continue her studies. She thanks God that she will finish this year.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dreams are to continue growing her business and pursue her profession.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
42 year-old Olivia A. is married, with 2 school-aged children. Her family lives in Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. Olivia is engaged in selling dried fish. She sells her dried fish at the market, where she earns 3,000 PHP a month.

Olivia is now in her 5th loan cycle at ASKI amounting to 12,000 PHP. According to her, she will use her loan to purchase fish for her dried fish business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Rapiya's Group

texts.en:
Rapiya O. is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and is married. Together with her husband who is now a pensioner, she raised three daughters and two sons. Their youngest son studies at school, and their other children are married and live separately with their families. 

In 1992, Rapiya's family started to breed cattle. They resell farm animals at a higher price after fattening them.  From this business, the family earns 8000 soms per month. Rapiya has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase three livestock animals for breeding. She hopes to obtain this loan, which will help her to realize the plans. In the future, Rapiya wants to provide her younger son a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is 39 years old, married, and has one child.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Manju plans to raise the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con 
sólo servicio de luz, ubicado  en el distrito de Monsefú que peretenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

María se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas son apropiados y espaciosos están a unos minutos de su casa, a sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo las ofrece en los
diferentes mercados de Chiclayo, con el dinero que ahorrado por la venta de sus ovjeas a comprado una mototaxi de segunda para que le facilite en movilizarse a los sitios que tiene que ir y de paso también la trabaja y puede tener otro ingreso para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y cambiarle algunos repuestos que le hacen falta para su buen funcionamiento, además desea realizar algunos  arreglos en su casa.   María es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, dispuesta ayudar a otros, pero quiere que su familia se supere en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a mother and she is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and  three children. They live in their own house with electricity as the only utility. The house is located in the Monsefú district which is in the Chiclayo province. This area is known for having lots agricultural activity.

María has been raising sheep for several years. The farmyard where the sheep are kept is suitable and spacious. It is only a few minutes from her house. She raises the animals with a balanced diet of natural fodder. Once they are the optimal weight and size, they are taken to the different markets in Chiclayo. With the money she has earned from selling her sheep, she has bought a second-hand moto-taxi. The vehicle helps her reach the places she needs to go and also, it gives her another source of income to pay her household expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 Nuevos Soles for maintenance of her moto-taxi and to change some of the spare parts that are not working well.  In addition, she wants to make a few renovations in her house. María is known in her neighborhood for being a hard-working woman, willing to help others but she wants her family to better itself, especially her children.

loans.use: to maintain her taxi in order to continue working

loans.name: Afag

texts.ru:
Afag zamujem imeyet 3 detey. Ona jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Afag 43 qoda. Ona uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya shveynim businessom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Afag ona ochen blagodarna Kive i lenderam za ssudu. V perviy raz ona brala US$1,200 i yejemesachno vovrema oplachivala svoyu ssudu.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit shveynuyu mashinu dlya razvitiya svoyego businessa. 
Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoraya s detstva uchila yeyo shit snachalo odejdu dlya yeyo kukol a potom dlya Afag samoy.
texts.en: Afag is married and has three children.  She lives in the Baku region together with her husband and children.  She is 43 years old.  Afag has been involved in the sewing business for 13 years.  This is her second loan, and Afag is very grateful to Kiva and the lenders for it.  She previously borrowed $1,200 and repaid her loan monthly in a timely manner.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a sewing machine, needed to develop her business.  She learned this business from her mother, who taught her since childhood how to sew clothing for her dolls and then for Afag herself.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias is currently in the business of selling fruits such as tomato, mango and pineapple. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lilias is 32 years old and married to a business man. She has 3 children, 1 of whom goes to school. With the extra profits generated from this loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her fruit business

loans.name: Poetas Group

texts.es:
La señora Irma es parte del grupo Poetas, ellos comentan que le pusieron así a su grupo por que la colonia donde se reunirán se llama así, y por eso decidieron ponerle ese nombre. Dona Irma tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, comenta que tiene una refaccionaría desde hace 19 años, su esposo y ella la atienden dice que ese negocio su suegro se los heredo. Esta pidiendo un crédito para invertirle a su negocio, ella vende refacciones para carro, aceites, un poco de llantas, bujías, partes de vehículos etc. Ella y su esposo llamado Noe salen cada mes a la cuidades de Querétaro y México a surtir las refacciones que le hacen falta y tienen varios distribuidores que les  surten de lo que necesitan en el negocio. La meta de la señora Irma es darles una carrera a sus hijos y poner otra refaccionaría en otra población para así tener un poco mas de ganancias. Doña Irma esta muy contenta por que dice que gracias a los préstamos que le ha hecho la financiera su negocio a crecido.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Petra, Ernesto, Guadalupe, Maria Luisa, Celia, Teresa, Maria del Rosario, Eduardo, Maria Remedios y Beatriz ellos usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios de venta de colchas por catalogo, panadería, jugos y licuados, antojitos mexicanos, zapatos y cosméticos por catalogo, refaccionaría, frutas y legumbres, abarrotes y en una peluquería.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Poetas group.  The members of the group tell us that they chose this name because it is the name of the area where they meet.

Irma is 42 years old and has three dependent children.  She tells us that she has owned an auto parts store for 19 years.  She and her husband both work there.  She says that they inherited the business from her father-in-law.

Irma is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She sells car parts, oil, some tires, spark plugs, spare parts, etc.  She and her husband Noe visit the the city of Querétaro and Mexico City every month to stock up with the spare parts that they lack.  They have several suppliers who provide them with what they need for their business.  Irma's goal is to provide her children with a career and to open another auto parts store in another town so that she can make a little more profit.  Irma is very happy because she says that her business has grown thanks to loans from our financial institution.

The other members of the group are Petra, Ernesto, Guadalupe, María Luisa, Celia, Teresa, María del Rosario, Eduardo, María Remedios and Beatriz.  They will use their loans to invest in their businesses selling bedspreads through a catalog, running a bakery, selling juices and smoothies, selling Mexican snacks, selling shoes and cosmetics through catalogs, selling car parts, selling fruit and vegetables, selling groceries and running a hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy car parts

loans.name: Hafizakhon

texts.ru: Хафизахон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Хафизахон не имеет высшего образования. Она у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Hafizahon lives in the Rudaki district. She is 35 years old. She is married. She has five children. Hafizahon does not have a higher education. She works at home sewing traditional clothes. She has been doing this for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages, and canned goods for her store.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods.

loans.name: Andrew J.'s Group

texts.en: Meet with members of a primary school in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,500,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges like paying school fees, investing in a business, buying house building material, etc. At the end of each month, these teachers will repay SMT out of their monthly salaries. Andrew is the leader of this group. Born in a village called Fandu 54 years ago, he is married and has nine children. Two of the children are in primary school, two are in secondary school and four are in college. Andrew has requested a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees in his children

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a widow and has four children. She sells food items such as maize, salted fish, garden eggs, plantain and others. The items she sells are displayed in this photo, on Araba's right-hand side. She has been in this business for seven years.
 Araba is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food items to sell.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bassirou est un célibataire sans enfants ayant 33 ans et qui vit chez ses parents dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Bassirou n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, s’est vite initié aux activités de commerce d’achat-vente d’articles de quincaillerie ( ciment, peinture, chaux vive, file, colles , etc). Il dispose d’une  quincaillerie dans le grand marché de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et avec qui il est à son premier prêt pour relancer son activité en vu de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, quelques tonnes de ciments, 12 boîtes de colles, 15 paquets de peintures et 70 mètres de file. Il s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Bassirou is a single man with no children; he lives with his parents in a large traditional family in the town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative district).  Since he did not have the opportunity to advance at school for social reasons, Bassirou rapidly launched himself into buying and selling hardware products (cement, paint, quicklime, wire, glues, etc.). He has a hardware store in Sikasso's Grand Market and is in great demand from his customers for the quality of his products.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first loan from the institution, so that he can boost his activity and respond better to customer demand. With this first loan he is planning to buy several tons of cement, 12 boxes of glues, 15 packets of paints and 70 meters of wire. He gets his supplies from wholesaler traders in Bamako before reselling them on a retail basis to a customer base makde up generally of house building professionals (architects, entrepreneurs, masons, etc..). 

Thanks to this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which will be used primarily to expand his business, contribute to family expenses and to pay off the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware products

loans.name: Philipp

texts.en: Philipp, a 29-year-old single father of one child, lives in the Philippines where he has had shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for three years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for his store. In the future, Philipp hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Paraiso Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité “PARAISO POTY” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Actualmente esta integrado por 14 mujeres, las cuales trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Una de las miembros es la señora Hipolita, la cual es una señora trabajadora, luchadora, sacrificada y muy emprendedora. Comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, lo cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo, por lo que ella junto al comité acuden a la fundación.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso Poty" committee was created through the union of several neighbors from the city of Santaní.  All the members of the committee carry out their own independent business activities such as selling products.  The members created a very united group.  They are capable of carrying out activities together to strengthen their camaraderie.  The group currently has 14 female members who work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual help.

One of the members of this group is Hipolita, who is a hard-working, tenacious, self-sacrificing and very entrepreneurial lady.  She says that she raises and sells animals which makes her the income she needs to support her family.  She would like to be able to continue in her work and so she and her committee are approaching Fundación Paraguaya.  She is requesting her loan to buy animals and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme âgée de 56 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. L’ainé a 32 ans et benjamin 24 ans 
Ayaba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale genre laits, sucres, savons et autres à toutes personnes à son domicile. Elle achète ses produits au grand marché de Lomé 
Ayaba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de nouveaux produits destinés à la vente. Elle dit vouloir diversifier sa marchandise en réinvestissant ces profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait élargir sa clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 56 year-old woman. She is widowed and a mother of two children; one of them goes to school. Her oldest is 32 years old and her youngest 24.
Ayaba has been working as a retailer since 2009. She buys and sells groceries such as milk, sugar, and other products; she sells from her home to various people. She purchases her products from the Grand Market in Lomé.
Ayaba requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase new groceries intended for resale. She says that she wants to diversify her products by investing this extra income in her business.
In the coming years, Ayaba would like to develop her clientele. She says that with the profits, she is planning on providing for her family’s primary needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Deoagracia

texts.en: Deoagracia, a 57-year-old widowed mother of six, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food production business in the Philippines for five years. Deoagracia has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en: Ulziisaihan is 34 and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife runs a small garment retail business. His elder two children are school students, and his younger one goes to kindergarten. He started his taxi service in 2010 with his own car. His business was fine, and the income was enough for him to support his family until his car's engine broke. He wants to replace it with a new one and replace a few additional parts, as well. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "It has been horrible since my car broke down. My family is having crises. I have to make it right." He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase winter coat and to rent one more stall to expand his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase a winter coat and to rent one more stall

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. He’s the one responsible for himself, enjoying his life and doing the best he can to enrich his way of living. Despite his young age, he decided to open his own business, a cattle farm, in 2007. He likes his job and knows very well that with a little more carefulness his business will grow faster. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fodder in order to feed his animals. He notes that this will enhance his business and boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business and purchase added animals.

loans.use: to purchase fodder in order to feed his animals

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
MAHAWA, la première à gauche, fait le commerce de fagot, il y’a environ 3 ans et compte augmenter son capital commerce afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  trois chargements de charrettes d’âne en fagot ( bois de chauffe) .Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle les revend en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of Danaya Group are mostly married women. They average 41 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

The members of the group are seeking their eighth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand.

Mahawa, the first woman on the left in the photograph, has been selling firewood for approximately three years. She intends to bolster her business in order to meet customer demand.

She intends to use her loan to buy three donkey cartloads of firewood. She gets her supplies in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She resells for cash, at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 22'500 (ca US$ 45), to be used in part to repay the loan and its interests, and in part to be put away.

She ambitions to increase her revenue to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy three cartloads of firewood

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 50-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife, one parent, and four children. Two of the children are still studying, and the other two are working. Despite all the difficulties and pressures of life that he faces, Afif is devoting his life to his children and sacrifices greatly for their education. He has been working in security for a local company for the past five years. Today, he needs to borrow $2600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children's educational fees. He’s sure that being knowledgeable will help them to achieve better job positions. In the future, he plans to collect much more money to enhance their life.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational fees

loans.name: Diosa

texts.es: Diosa de 18 años el una emprendedora natural, que inició su negocio de la mano de su madre quien lo inició en la sala de su casa y posteriormente enseñó a su hija para que lo administrara y generara sus propios ingresos. Diosa hoy tiene una sala de belleza, donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional en las líneas femenina, masculina e infantil. Su meta es estudiar cosmetología y está preparándose con sus ahorros para lograrlo y ofrecer una larga cola de productos afines en su salón. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un aire acondicionado, y realizará adecuaciones a su local para ofrecer condiciones confortables a sus clientes e iniciar el proceso de fidelización y mercadeo de su futura oferta de servicios. El éxito de su inversión actual es que la hará en un momento de gran movimiento comercial, en el que usualmente las ventas se incrementan y su capital de trabajo también, por efecto de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo, donde las familias quieren esperar unidos y bien elegantes al niño Dios y a su nuevo año 2012.
texts.en: Diosa, 18 years old, is a natural entrepreneur. She began her business with the help of her mother, who began it in the living room of her home and subsequently taught her daughter so that she would administer and generate her own income. Today Diosa has a beauty salon where she offers services to females, males, or children to better one's personal and professional image. Her goal is to study cosmetology. She is preparing herself to achieve this and offer a large line of similar products in her salon with her savings. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding that she is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy an air conditioner and carry out renovations to her salon in order to offer comfortable conditions to her customers and begin the loyalty and marketing process of her future service offers. The success of her current investment is that she will make it in a moment of great commercial movement, during which sales usually increase and her work capital will too due to the Christmas holidays and New Year, when families want to wait together elegantly for the child of God and the New Year 2012.

loans.use: will buy an air conditioner and will carry out renovations to her salon to offer comfortable conditions to her customers.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 31 years old; she is married and has a 6-year-old child.  She sells second-hand shoes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business.

Racheal's desire is to expand her business in order to generate more income for her family.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина.  Более 6 лет Сайёра занимается купле- продажей греческих орехов. Она продает товар по оптовым ценам и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Кроме этого она занимается откармливанием скота. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 2500 Сомони для покупки товара для перепродажи, чтобы расширить и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Sayora is married and is a loving mother of three children.  She is a very hardworking and kind woman.  Sayora has been involved in buying and selling walnuts for over six years.  She sells products at wholesale prices and has many regular customers.  Besides this, she is involved in fattening up livestock.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2500 Somoni to purchase products for resale in order to expand and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy walnuts

loans.name: Darío Emiliano

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde muy joven le toco trabajar duro, le ayudaba a sus vecinos desde ahí aprendió la actividad y le ha resultado productiva hasta ahora.  Trabaja solo en las obras que le facilitan.  Está en estado de unión libre y tiene una niña de 3 años que no estudia.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de cerámicas.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Portoviejo.  He’s had to work hard from a very young age.  He used to help his neighbors and learned the activity there which has been productive to date.  He works alone on jobs he gets.  He’s in a common law relationship and has a three-year-old daughter who does not attend school yet.  He needs the loan to buy ceramic tile.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
The village of Pruteni is scenic and beautiful, with a population of 1000 people. Situated on the border with Romania, which will become part of the European Union in 2007, there is no running water, gas or regular public transportation (m  ost villagers do not have cars and must rely on horses and wagons for transportation). It is 45 min by car down a dirt and gravel road from the closest regional center. The majority of residents have small family farms (Gospodarie in Romanian), relying on subsistence farming and generating an income only from selling surplus produce at market.

Tatiana S. is 27 years old with a large family. She is asking for a loan for working capital for her family farm. This past year was a
difficult year. The price of animals fell at the farmer\\\'s market and many small-scale farmers\\\' profits were affected. Meanwhile, the price of machine services (hiring someone to transport her corn harvest from the fields) rose due to the increase of gas prices. Tatiana now needs a loan to fund planting the crops she is planning for sale next year.

loans.use: Seed and supply purchases

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofia comes from a large family where only two people work, but they do not earn enough to supply their growing family with the necessities of life.

She is a skilled fisherman and has decided to put her skills and knowledge to use to provide additional income for her family.

Sofia operates a small fishing business that caters to locals from Faleula as well as local restaurants.

She is applying for a loan of $875 from SPBDF in order to purchase a new net to replace her old one.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing net to replace the old one

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en: Yuli is 21 years old and is married with one child, who is a girl. Her husband, Kosim, is an unskilled temporary worker in a small factory, earning $100 per month. To supplement her husband’s income, Yuli  sells various snacks and chips at her small kiosk. Yuli can earn profit of $3 per day. Yuli has become a member of MBK for almost two years. She needs additional working capital of $100, so that she can buy more good for her kiosk. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ayaovi Séna

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaovi Séna A. is 25 years old and married. She takes care of her parents and one of her younger sisters. She has a successful hair salon. However, she has to buy cosmetic products for the business on a regular basis. Without the sufficient means, she often ends up being out-of-stock and is obliged to purchase the products on credit. To resolve this problem, she is asking for a loan of $600 to stock up her business with cosmetic products in order to be able to reap all of the profits and build a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ayaovi Séna a 25 ans, elle est mariée et a ses parents et une de ses petites sœurs en charge. Elle a comme activité la coiffure qui lui réussit bien. Toutefois, elle est confrontée à l’achat des produits cosmétique. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens, elle se voit très souvent face à la rupture de stock où elle est obligée de faire des achats à crédit. Pour mettre fin à cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour faire un stock de produit cosmétique afin de posséder la totalité de sa marge bénéficiaire, et fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: Buying cosmetic products

loans.name: Loyola Yolanda

texts.es:
Loyola is 41 years old and married. She and her husband have three children ages 7, 12 and 18. Loyola has a business serving food and drinks while her husband drives a minibus. They both work hard to give their children a good education and quality of life. On weekends, the whole family works together to serve traditional Bolivian meat dishes, but during the week Loyola's husband is off driving his minibus and Loyola works by herself, or with the help of her children if they aren't in school. The restaurant is well-situated in the family's home. They have been open for 12 years and Loyola's cooking is very popular. This loan, the family's ninth from Agrocapital, will pay for installation of a new gas tank for the minibus, saving the family money on fuel. The family counts on the vehicle both for shopping and for the passenger fares it brings in. In her relationship with Agrocapital Loyola has demonstrated herself to be a responsible individual with an excellent record of loan repayment.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Loyola es una señora casada de 41 años, la pareja tiene tres hijos de 18, 12 y 7 años respectivamente. La señora Loyola tiene un negocio familiar de venta de comidas y refrescos, y su esposo presta servicios de transporte de pasajeros en rutas locales, ambos se esfuerzan en el trabajo para dar a sus hijos un nivel de vida mejor y una buena educación. La Sra. Loyola trabaja junto a su esposo e hijos los fines de semana en los que ofrece a su variado público platos tradicionales como son el charque, pato, chancho, enrrollado, etc. Después de lunes a viernes el esposo de Loyola trabaja con su trufi y ella se quedan con sus hijos, quienes la ayudan en los tiempos que no tienen que estudiar o ir a la escuela. El negocio familiar se encuentra muy bien ubicado en instalaciones propias de la familia de Loyola, y gracias a su buen trato, 12 años de experiencia, calidad en sus comidas es que cuenta con bastante afluencia de clientela. Con la presente solicitud, que es la novena en la Institución, comprara un equipo de gas para su movilidad y con el saldo pagará al mecanico por su respectiva instalación. Esta transformación permitirá a la familia economizar en combustible ya que este vehículo tiene dos funciones el de transportar pasajeros y también para comprar en el mercado los insumos para el restaurante. Durante el tiempo de relación de Loyola con Agrocapital demostró ser una persona responsable y con excelente pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: To buy a gas system for a minibus.

loans.name: Lily Salimoba

texts.es:
Lily is 42 years old. Several years ago she moved to Lima, but the man with whom she had hoped to form a family left her alone with her young son Jesus and no means of support. She returned to her native village Ayaviri and with the help of her aged parents opened a business making "ekeko" dolls. These small figures are thought to bring joy and properity to the home. She has two other people working for her. Lily's dream is to distribute these clay figures to various markets around the country and some day to export them. To do this she needs to raise capital for raw materials so she is asking for a loan which she promises to repay within seven months. She is counting on your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Lily tiene 42 años de edad y hace algunos años decidió emigrar a la ciudad de Lima, donde sufrió una gran decepción, la persona con la que pensó formar una familia la abandonó, dejándola sola junto a su hijo Jesús sin ningún respaldo económico. Ante este penoso hecho que le causó mucho dolor , Lily y su pequeño niño decidieron volver a su pueblo natal Ayaviri, para dedicarse completamente a las labores artesanas, oficio al que se consagraban sus ancianos y queridos padres; desde entonces trabaja diligentemente para sacar adelante el pequeño taller de fabricación de muñecos ekeko ( pequeño hombrecito denominado en su pueblo natal portador de alegría y abundancia para el hogar) elaborados en arcilla, en el que también ofrece trabajo a otras dos personas El anhelo de Lily es ofrecer sus productos en los diferentes mercados de su país para más adelante exportarlos al exterior. Para hacer realidad sus deseos necesita incrementar su capital de inversión con el objetivo de adquirir más materia prima extendiéndoles el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de siete meses. Lily espera contar con vuestra generosa ayuda para iniciar sus proyectos pronto.

loans.use: To buy clay and raw materials to make dolls.

loans.name: Zinyat

texts.en: Zinyat G. is a mother of 2 children. This 45-year-old woman lives with her family in the Khaladj village in the Salyan region. She has run her own farm for the past 8 years. Zinyat has requested a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sumyati

texts.en: Sumyati is a 34-year-old woman whose husband A. R. has been unemployed for a long time. She has therefore started her own business to support her family by selling crispy chips, snacks, candy, ice, household goods, etc. at her small shop, earning US$10.5 per day. Sumyati is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to expand her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha M.. She rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy more feed. Aisha is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has 4 children ranging from age 8 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to enlarge her business Aisha took a loan of UGX 400,000 from BRAC Uganda previously to invest in her poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Agnes N., Faridah N., Jalian N., and Florence K.. Agnes N. sells stationery and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to rent a bigger stationery shop. Faridah N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to buy more stock. Jalian Nakanwagi runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 100,000 to buy a restaurant. Florence K. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 43 years old and is a widow with a 15-year-old child. Zainabu began her business in 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.
Zainabu now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Akou

texts.en:
Ms. Akou K. is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children. Fish is a staple part of the majority of the population’s diet in this region and many women, like K. Akou, work in the business of preparing fish for consumption. While many women smoke these fish, Akou fries them in oil, making them crispy and tasty.

With this loan, Akou would like to purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil to increase her sales and continue to satisfy her customers. By replenishing her inventory Akou will be able to continue to provide for her family by frying and reselling fish to the local population.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cartons of fish and 5 bottles of oil

loans.name: Siajabu

texts.en:
Siajabu, age 25, is married with a three-year-old. For a living, she makes and sells chapatis from 6am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started in March, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $22.

Siajabu hopes for a loan to purchase more chapati ingredients. She belongs to the loan group, Tuaminiane, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients to make chapatis

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe has a wife and two children, ages 19 and 24. He breeds cattle, whose milk production is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). The family lives in the Igachi Community in the Los Andes province (three and a half hours from the city of La Paz)

He will use this loan to purchase livestock of a better breed. This is his first loan from Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe tiene una esposa y dos hijos de 19 y 24 años respectivamente. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). La familia vive en la comunidad de Igachi, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El monto del crédito será destinado en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase livestock of a better breed.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim was born in 1963. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Khodjali region. He has settled in the Absheron region.

Karim is married and has 4 children. He has run this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 40 years old and is a wife and mother of one child. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like fish and pastries. She produces and supplies the oil to food vendors. However, her production is slow as a result of not being able to afford to pay for a machine for the oil processing. She wants to use the loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and to pay for an electric milling machine to reduce the manual effort, so she produce oil in larger quantities. She believes the loan will also enable her to save more toward her child's education. She belongs to the community group called the St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy seventy bags of palm kernel and electric milling machine.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Raymunda is 66-years-old, is separated from her husband, and lives alone in her small house since she doesn't have children. She is dedicated to selling clothing such as ponchos, sweaters, t-shirts, etc., to support herself. She has done this for 48 years. She has always had to work to support herself.
