She is a native of Juliaca, but she never had the economic means to go to school, so she never learned how to read or write. But that wasn't a problem for Raymunda, who continues working every day with much faith and happiness. She never learned anything else besides business because she likes it a lot and doesn't find it difficult to carry out.

She wants to continue working as long as she is able to secure her retirement.

With the money from this loan, she will buy more ponchos, t-shirts, and clothing in general to increase her sales. In the future, she wants to have more merchandise to increase her sales even more.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Raymunda tiene 66 años, es separada D. su pareja, y al no tener hijos vive sola en su pequeña casa. Se dedica a la venta D. ropa, venD. mantas, chompas, poleras, etc. para mantenerse, esta actividad la ha venido realizando desD. hace 48 años, siempre tuvo que trabajar para mantenerse, ella es natural D. Juliaca, pero nunca tuvo las posibilidades económicas para estudiar, por ello, no aprendió a leer ni a escribir, pero eso no fue problema para Raymunda que sigue trabajando día a día con mucha fe y alegría. Ella no conoció otra cosa mas que el mundo del comercio, así que esta actividad le gusta mucho, y no encuentra dificultad en realizarla.

Quiere seguir trabajando hasta que las fuerzas le den y asegurar su vejez.

Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar más mantas, poleras y ropa en general para mejorar su venta, en el futuro ella quiere tener más mercadería para incrementar sus ventas cada vez más.

loans.use: To supply herself with a larger quantity of the garments that she sells.

loans.name: Afag

texts.en: Afag is 40 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Baku. For the past 10 years she has been running her own tailoring business. Currently, Afag needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy materials for sewing jackets and to be able to provide her clients with better services.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for sewing jackets

loans.name: Julia Adela

texts.es:
Julia tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos y es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Vive y tiene su negocio en la carretera central s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. 
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 2 años y a pesar de tener un pequeño negocio de abarrotes también se dedica a la venta de comidas los días de feria en el campo ferial de la provincia de Yungay. Su esposo es docente y los días de descanso la apoya en la venta de comida.
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará productos de primera necesidad para la venta de comida: 5 paquetes de gaseosa, 2 cajas de aceite y 5 sacos de arroz.
Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, has 5 children, and is a member of the Fighting Women of Yungay Community Bank. She lives and has her business on the main road S/N in the district and province of Yungay, Ancash. She has sold groceries for 2 years, and in spite of having a small grocery store business, she also sells food on fair days on the fairgrounds in the province of Yungay. Her husband is a teacher, and on the weekends, he helps her sell food. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy products that are necessary for the sale of food: 5 packets of soda, 2 boxes of oil, and 5 sacks of rice. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy soda, oil, and rice

loans.name: Bernardo Botão

texts.pt:
Bernardo Botão Mussamira Pamue é natural da Beira  província de sofala, tem 45 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 16, 14, 9 e 4 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Bernardo estudou até 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, em 1982 mudou se da província de Sofala para Maputo para continuação dos estudos no instituto agrário da Namaacha, onde por motivos financeiros não conseguiu tendo sido admitido com trabalhador como ajudante mecânico, hoje trabalha como mecânico motorista neste instituto. Com um horário das 7:30 as 15:30h tem um salário mensal de 2400,00mt.

Para Bernardo este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, onde os primeiros foram dos seguintes montantes 6000,00mt e 10000,00mt respectivamente. Não tem empregado. Assim Brnardo pretende pagar antes do tempo regulamentado para solicitar outro para dar continuidade com a obra.
texts.en:
Bernardo Botão Mussamira Pamue is from Beira, a province of Sofala, is 45 years old and married with 4 children, aged 16, 14, 9 and 4. Apart from supporting his children, he also supports his parents, sending them money every month.

Bernardo was in school until 10th grade and left due to lack of financial means. In 1982 he moved from the province of Sofala to Maputo in order to continue his studies at the Namaacha Agrarian Instiute, which he didn’t manage to do, again due to lack of financial means. He joined instead as a mechanic’s assistant and today he works as a mechanic and driver at the Institute. He works from 7.30 am to 3.30 pm and has a monthly salary of 2400,00 MZN.

For Bernardo, this is his third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva, the first two being for 6000,00 MZN and 10000,00 MZN. Bernardo intends to pay off the loan before it is due in order to request another one to continue the construction of his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material for the contruction of his house

loans.name: Najma M. Akhtar Group

texts.en:
I am Najma and I reside in a city named Borewala, Pakistan.  I am a married woman and my husband's name is M. A. who is a watchman by profession.  

I have six kids: three daughters and three sons.  My elder daughter is in the 3rd standard and my elder son is in kindergarten.  The others are not at a school going age.  I am 29 years old.  

Since I was child I have loved education, but I couldn’t go to study because my parents wouldn’t allow me to go to school.  They suggested I stay at home and make embroidered dresses.  My mother taught me this art.  

When I got married and became a mother, I decided to give my children a good education because it has become essential in every walk of life.  

My husband’s earnings are not so good, but he wants to start a business of clothes selling.  I have successfully repaid my first loan, which I took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying for a loan to buy clothes to resell. 

I am a group leader of a few more members in my community.  Sajida Parveen Baji wants a loan to repair a vehicle named “Shahzore”.  I. A. Baji wants a loan to buy more mobile phones for her mobile phone selling business.  Mahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.  Salma Baji wants a loan to buy materials (sugar, milk and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat selling business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for a clothes selling business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Асоев Мухаммад житель района Вахш. Возраст 38 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже десять лет , как он занимается торговлей. Имеет свой магазин .Торгует продуктами питания . овар привозит из города Душанбе , покупая его у оптовиков. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов , а так же увеличить прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhammad A. lives in the Vahshad region. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. It's been ten years since he started a retail business. He has his own store where he sells food. He brings the merchandise in from Dushanbe where he buys from wholesalers. He plans to get a loan to increase the variety of his inventory. This will help him attract new customers and increase his profits. He will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety of inventory

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó y actualmente tiene dos hijos y espera un tercer bebé.
Su negocio consiste en una bodega donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, también productos de belleza y compra y vende animales menores.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comprar artículos para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en comprar animales menores.
El sueño de María es que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Community bank Jesús Nazareno of the district of Agallpampa in the province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She graduated from high school but did not continue her studies because she got married; she has two children and is expecting a third. Her business is a store where she sells basic goods as well as beauty products. She also buys and sells small livestock. She invested her first loan of 300 soles, repaid over four months, in goods to sell in her store. She will use this 500 soles loan, to be repaid over four months, to buy small animals. María's dream is to see her business grow day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals for her business

loans.name: Edgar Ignacio

texts.es:
Edgar es soltero, tiene 32 años.  
Su familla es confeccionista  de jeans, de niño vivió en ese mundo el aprendió ahora sigue los pasos de su padre, tiene un taller de confecciones de jeans, el cose, traza y vende las prendas, en provincia. 
Desde que esta en Finca agradece los créditos que le dan, por que no conseguía quien le dé crédito y en Finca encontró una oportunidad, paga puntual, y es responsable para mantener invicto.  
Solicita un crédito de 1400 soles, para la compra de dos rollos de tela jeans. 
El sueño de Edgar es  comprar una maquina de bordados y  tener su tienda para vender lo que confecciona.
texts.en:
Edgar is single and he is 32 years old. His family makes jeans. He grew up in a jean-making world. He learned to follow in his father's footsteps. He has a workshop where he makes jeans. He sews, designs, and sells the clothing in provincial areas. Since he's been in the group Finca he has been grateful for all the loans they have given him. Before joining Finca, he was not able to get loans for his business. With Finca he has been given an opportunity to receives loans. He pays on time and he is responsible with his reputation as a borrower. He is requesting a loan of 1,400 Soles so that he can buy large rolls of fabric to make jeans. Edgar's dream is to buy and embroidery machine and to have a store to sell his jeans out of.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He is requesting a loan of 1,400 Soles so that he can buy large rolls of fabric to make jeans.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es madre soltera, tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su único hijo que es estudiante. Se dedica a la venta de productos de pasamanería (adornos personales, aretes, collares, etc.) en un puesto de un mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 3 años y le va muy bien ya que no hay un día que deje de vender. Le gusta su trabajo porque le hace sentir útil y sobre todo se relaciona con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque los artículos que vende son de buena calidad y sus clientes confían mucho en ella. Para el futuro, Lucy quiere implementar su negocio en su casa y adicionar la venta de ropa y zapatos. Este es ya su 12avo préstamo con MFP. Su banco comunal se llama “Mujeres Talentosas”, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque siempre se apoyan entre todas y son solidarias. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de productos, y de sus pasajes, porque ella compra su mercadería en otra ciudad donde puede obtenerla a un precio más barato.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 56 year old single mother, and she lives with her only son, who is a student. She sells jewelry in a stall in a market near her home. She has been doing this for 3 years, and it's going so well for her that there's not a single day she doesn't go to work. She likes her work because it makes her feel useful and, above all, she gets to interact with many people. Besides, it is profitable for her because her articles or of good quality and she has the trust of her customers.

For the future, Lucy wants to move her business to her home and add sales of clothing and shoes. This is her 12th loan with MFP. Her communal bank is called "Mujeres Talentosas" (Talented Women) and she likes to work with her group because they always support each other in solidarity. She will invest the money she's asking for in the purchase of merchandise and her tickets for travel, because she always makes her purchases in another city where she can find better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong K., 59, owns a medium grocery store next to her house, where she sells different kinds of groceries, including cooked ingredients, snacks, and soft drinks. Most of her clients are villagers who live near her house. She is 59 years old and the mother of three children who are single and employed. They are garment workers in the garment industry. Her husband assists her in selling groceries.

Recently, K. sold all her wares from her store. Therefore, she needs to borrow $500 in order to restock her grocery inventory for sale.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Tilovathon

texts.ru: У Тиловатхон 3 детей, замужем, ей 39 лет. муж работает на заработках в России. Тиловатхон нигде не работает и занимается предпринимательством. За счет бизнеса покрываются разные расходы семьи, так как основную часть расходов берет на себя ее муж. Тиловатхон знала о программе микрокредитования МикроИнвест и решила подать заявку на займ для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tilovathon has 3 children, she is marred and is 39 years old; her husband is working in Russia. Tilovathon does not have a job and is an entrepreneur. The business covers various family expenses as her husband covers the main portion of expenditures. Tilovathon knew about the microcredit program MicroInvest and decided to apply for a loan to grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo A. is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She sells bags of charcoal. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 60,000 ($US425) to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is a 28-year-old tailor who lives in Nyalenda slum in Kisumu and also sells ready-made clothes. Simon is married and has one son, Duncan. He purchases his clothing stock from Nairobi and Busia. Simon does not ascribe fixed prices to his clothes, but, in the tradition of most merchants in Kenya’s markets, negotiates for each item.

The challenges, he says, are stiff competition from other sellers and the ups and downs of Kenya’s economy. It is hard to predict when people will have money here. This is Simon’s first loan, and he plans to use it for more clothing stock and, if he can afford it, new sewing machines for tailoring. As an aside, I asked him who his favorite football team is. Breaking with most Kenyans, he said Barcelona FC instead of Manchester United.

In this video, you can hear me greet Simon saying "Idhi Nade" -- which is Luo for "How are you?" Simon responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you" and Erokamano, which in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. To read more about K-MET’s work, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta left her husband five years ago, after a long marriage. She is 42 years old, separated, and lives with her three children, who are independent and have their own businesses. After owning a thriving family business, she had to start her life and business over again. She bought a new house and started a new business, challenging destiny.

With her savings from five years, she has been able to acquire a business in the market in Luque, where she sells garments for women, men, and children. She is requesting a loan to purchase a wide variety of winter garments.

loans.use: Purchase winter garments for resale

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
B. Jalia is a businesswoman, forty-eight years old, and she is blessed with two children; she has a retail shop near to her residence that she has been operating for three years.

B. Jalia is using the loan to purchase retail items such as drinks, that is sodas and so forth, sweets (candies), flour, cooking oil, biscuits (cookies), etc., to meet her customers’ demands. Her dream is to renovate her houses for tenants so that she can earn some money from them for survival.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as drinks, sweets, flour, cooking oil, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Annalis

texts.en:
Annalis E. owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the city of Dapitan. Annalis has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Annalis joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Annalis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Annalis is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a restaurant

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.en:
Rosario is 29 years old and is married with two children.  She sells cold drinks, gelatin, flan and homemade popsicles out of her home.  Her husband owns a small hardware store.  Rosario and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.  

Rosario has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in selling fruits.  Rosario plans to invest part of this loan of 1800 soles in her home-based dessert business.  She will also invest part of it in purchasing fish for sale together with her father.  Rosario’s father buys fish in the small agricultural and fishing communities along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north.  He then resells the fish in Pucallpa’s port.

Rosario’s loans from Manuela Ramos have enabled her to grow her business; she is now able to help her husband with household expenses.  Rosario has also used her loans to help him with his hardware business.  Rosario’s goal is to study pastry-making.  She would like to have her own little shop selling cakes, pies and other sweets.

loans.use: Cold drinks for sale; materials for making gelatin, flan and popsicles; river fish for sale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47 year old married man and father of 5 children.

He has been working in spare parts distribution since 2004.

Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance to his car to be able to distribute the products and continue his work.

loans.use: Perform maintenance to his car.

loans.name: 012 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Soi Lê Thị (31) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the leader of an eight member group offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The name of this group is 12 (12 Đông Sơn).

Soi is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food products in her community. Soi has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Soi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Soi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 6000000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her eigth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Soi plans to use the profit from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

Here are the other borrowers in the Group: 1.

loans.use: Purchase business-related products to sell.

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsour S., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Champey Ngan, age 38, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1989 and have two daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home and other one stays at home.  
 
Kimsour has been selling groceries for 14 years. She buys grocery items from the Phnom Penh market to resell in her village. Her husband has full-time employment. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more grocery items to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal Z. is a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and farming. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed on his property.

His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. He is requesting a second loan from KIVA and AqroInvest. Adigozal successfully repaid his first loan.

loans.use: Purchase four calves to breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Suyapa Ivonne

texts.es: Suyapa Ivonne tiene la edad de 25 años, sus propósitos son superarse en la vida para salir adelante con su negocio ya que es lo que mas importante para seguir generando a su familia el sustento diario. Sus deseos son de construir un lugar para establecer un restaurante en el que ella pueda cocinar ya que es uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos. Su actividad económica es la venta de recargas, venta de de Dvd y discos de audio, por lo que no solo en la calle tiene la venta de estos productos también en su casa. Hace más de  5 años, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un trabajo es que decide establecer un pequeño negocio al principio no poseía la experiencia necesaria para con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo fue adquiriendo la habilidad para hablar con sus clientes. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de suficientes productos.
texts.en:
Suyapa Ivone is 25. Her purpose is to succeed in life by getting ahead with her business. The most important thing is to continue generating her family’s daily sustenance. Her wish is to build a place to set up a restaurant where she would be able to cook. That is one of her favorite pastimes. She sells phone cards, DVDs, and audio discs. She not only sells on the street, but she also sells these products in her house. Over five years ago she started the business because she needed to look for work. She decided to set up a small business. At the beginning she did not have the necessary experience for this business. But, with the passage of time, she acquired the ability to talk with her customers. The loan is for working capital to buy sufficient products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is a LAPO client. She sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Yanet Giovana

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Yanet nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar cereales como: chuño, papa, avena, quinua.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Arequipa y abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yanet has been a member of the communal bank "Gregoria Apaza" for 2 years. She is from the Llave district in the El Collao province of the Puno department. She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She completed her secondary education and buys and sells local cereal grains.

She is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000 ($1,050) with which she will buy cereals and tubers such as: traditional freeze-dried potatoes (chuños), potatoes, oats, and quinoa.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Arequipa and to open a grocery store.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quinoa, another similar grain, traditional freeze-dried potatoes, potatoes, and oats

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia vive, en la calle Integracion de la zona Franz Tamayo, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en el terreno que, con sacrificio adquirieron  mediante un plan de pagos los cuales están cancelando mensualmente.

Ella se dedica a la costura de cubrecamas en calidad de mano de obra, trabajo que realiza en su domicilio; su esposo trabaja también como costurero  en la fábrica ubicada en la misma zona. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción (piedra, cemento, ladrillos) para realizar la ampliación de su vivienda. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Leticia lives in Integracion street in Franz Tamayo, in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her little son in a lot they bought with a great deal of effort thanks to a payment plan that they are repaying every month. She’s a seamstress devoted exclusively to mend and tailor comforters at home. Her husband is also a seamstress, but he works in a factory near their home. The loan will be used to purchase construction material (stone, cement, brick) to expand her home. Although this is her first loan with Impro, her evaluation qualified her to get it.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand her home

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina D. G. is from the village of Kimanait in the Pangantucan municipality of Bukidnon Province. Cerina is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Cerina owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Cerina has been engaged in her business for over nine years, and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cerina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Cerina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Cerina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.ru: Гоибов Саидахмад проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохазяйка. Двое сыновей помогают отцу. Сам Саидахмад более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном продает сельскохозяйственые продукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saidahmad G. lives in the town of Kulyab. He is 36 years old. He is married and has seven children. His wife is a housewife. His two sons help him. Saidahmad himself has been selling on the market for more than fifteen years. He mainly sells vegetables. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales and turnover

loans.name: Helen Group

texts.en: Helen Group is a group of five borrowers led by Helen T.. She is 38 years old and is married with five children aged 8 to 22 years, with educational levels of 1st grade through high school graduate. She also cares for a few siblings. Helen could not continue her education through 8th grade due to poverty. In the photo, Helen is the one holding the sign. Helen and her family live and work in Rock Spring Valley, on the Capital Bypass, near downtown Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. Helen’s business is the sale of provisions such as rice, sugar, and bread. She buys her goods wholesale and sells retail in a shop to residents of her community. Helen has been running this business for twenty years and hopes to improve her business to a higher level. She started selling on a table with little funds but now sells in a shop, which means she has been doing well in business. She sells good products in order to encourage her customers to continue buying from her. Helen needs this loan to purchase additional goods for her business such as sugar, rice, and bread. She dreams of seeing her children in good health and taken care of. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods such as sugar, rice, and bread

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Bassirou D. est une homme de 33 ans, qui est mariée avec deux enfants. Bassirou est la propriétaire d’une atelier mechanique dans la ville de Ziguinchor. Avec 7 autre ouvriers qui sont employé par lui, ils reparent des motos. A cause de (ou grace a) les horrible rues, il a beaucoup de clients. Avec le prêt de Kiva il voudrait acheter les provisions pour les prochaines mois.
texts.en:
Bassirou D., aged 33, is married and the father of two children. He is the owner of a mechanical workshop in the city of Ziguinchor. With the help of seven workers he has hired, he repairs motorcycles. Because of (or thanks to) the roads in dreadful condition, he has many customers. Bassirou will use his Kiva loan to build up his inventory for the months to come.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up his mechanical workshop

loans.name: Raïssa

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Raïssa réside au quartier Koutongbé à Porto-Novo, depuis son jeune âge. C'est une célibataire sans enfant. Raïssa vit donc seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Raïssa n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de 10 ans, afin de  subvenir à ses besoins, Raïssa vend des sachets et des tenues de sport à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Raïssa s'approvisionne. Raïssa a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Raïssa voudrait agrandir son étalage et mieux faire face aux différentes demandes des clients. Pour y arriver, Raïssa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé,afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Raïssa A. lived in the Koutongbé neighborhood of Porto-Novo since an early age. She is unmarried without children, lives alone and is the only provider for her various needs. She attended school at primary level only. For the past ten years Raïssa has supported herself by selling plastic bags and sportswear from her home and also as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Raïssa has already been granted two previous loans from ALIDé, both of which were correctly repaid. She would like to expand her shop display and improve her response to various customer demands. To achieve this she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sportswear and plastc bags

loans.name: Nyame Boa Yen Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Margaret is also a wife and mother of six children from age 3-23 years old who are pursuing an education at various levels. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. She is married to a farmer and together they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Margaret trades in smoked fish. Fish is a common and important protein source in most diets and lot of people prefer fish to meat. She buys assorted smoked fish from fish mongers in fishing areas and sells to households and food vendors in her community. She has operated this trade for the past 20 years. She now sells her fish to a new market of gold miners as well, which has enabled her to grow her customer base and expand her market.

Margaret is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Boa Yen" (translated as 'God help us'), comprised of 11 members. The other members are also engaged in trade such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo B. est un homme marié de 28 ans monogame, qui vit avec ses deux enfants et leur mère dans le quartier Ouest de la  ville de  Kolondièba dans la   troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Modibo est un éleveur qui fait l’achat vente de bétails depuis maintenant 4 ans. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier  prêt individuel. 
Il  envisage acheter quelques bœufs dans certains villages de la préfecture de Kolondièba pour  aller les revendre à Nièna,  Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali), au comptant , aux revendeurs et aux bouchers.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37.500 FCFA. qui servira à payer un terrain  à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr Modibo B. is married and 28 years old. He lives with his two children and their mother in a monogamous household in the western outskirts of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Modibo has been a cattle breeder and trader for the past four years. In order to boost his working capital, he joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. He will buy a few oxen in the neighboring villages in the prefecture of Kolondièba and travel to Nièna, Bougouni and sometimes Bamako (the capital city of Mali) to sell his cattle for cash to resellers and butchers. Modibo expects to make a monthly profit of 37,500 CFA francs, which he will use to buy a plot of land for his future house.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare part for a three-wheeler taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the area of available arable land and buy agricultural products

loans.name: Yasmin Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Yasmin akhtar lives in Multan, a city in Pakistan known for its sweetmeats and clothing. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and Yasmin akhtar runs her boutique at home to help financially support her family. She makes embroidered dresses and displays them in her boutique. Her clothes are famous in her community. 

Her older son couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints, but her younger two sons and a daughter are attending school. Yasmin akhtar has a great desire for her children to complete their education and for that reason she works very hard.
 
She has applied for a loan to invest in her boutique. The loan will help her to purchase items such as material, beads and thread for making more dresses. She is hopeful that the profit will help her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making dresses to display and sell in her boutique

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi  5  est issu de l’Association  de femmes mariées du village de Dah Manakina de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, au moins 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
Fatoumata Konaté compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Dah, San et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 5 group comes from the Married Women's Association of the village of Dah Manakina in the prefecture of San, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members live in traditional families. They have an average age of 37 and on average at least 6 children each, and they grow peanuts. Wishing to make their agricultural enterprises more profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having reimbursed their preceding loans correctly, they are on their third agricultural loan for the growing season. Fatoumata Konaté intends to use her share of the loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds and various small implements and agricultural entrants, purchasing exclusively at the big open-air market of San city. During the off-season, she warehouses her harvest for a certain time so that it grows in value before selling it at the Dan and San markets and in surrounding marketplaces, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to a clientele generally coming from the big cities. After their produce is sold, the members of the group each expect to make a profit of 25,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for on-going family expenses., like the other members of the group, expects to make a profit of 35,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for on-going family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural entrants, seed, etc.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Ofelia es L. presidenta del grupo Sarita Colonia y trabaja con ellos varios meses. ElL. tiene un negocio D. abarrotes en su casa hace 4 años además venD. zapatos y ropa cuando lo solicitan. Los préstamos L. ayudan a invertir en mercadería y así obtener mayores ganancias. Ofelia está contenta con los préstamos D. Edaprospo, uno D. sus objetivos es apoyar a sus hijos para que pueda estudiar gastronomía.
Malvina es soltera y tiene un negocio D. confitería hace 4 años, Comenzó su negocio ambulatoriamente en las calles y desD. el inicio ha trabajado soL.. Ahora está feliz ya que ha podido establecerse y cuenta con mobiliarios en su negocio Los préstamos D. Edaprospo le han ayudado a aumentar su capital D. trabajo. A elL. le gustaría crecer aun más y apoyar a otras personas.
Mery tiene 19 años, y vive con sus padres, estudia computación e informática en un instituto. Aun así tiene que trabajar, Es por eso que invierte en ropa para poder venderL. ambulatoriamente. ElL. espera terminar sus estudios y obtener un local donD. establecerse. L. Alcancía Comunal agradece a todos las personas que hacen posible los créditos.
texts.en:
Ofelia is the president of the Sarita Colonia group and has been working with them for several months. She has had a grocery store in her house for 4 years now, and she also sells shoes and clothing on request. The loans help her to invest in merchandise and earn better profits. Ofelia is happy with the Edaprospo loans. One of her goals is to support her children so they can study culinary arts. Malvina is single and has had a confectioner's shop for 4 years. She started her business on a mobile cart in the streets and since the beginning has worked alone. Right now, she's happy that she has been able to establish herself and furnish her store. The Edaprospo loans have helped her to increase her working capital. She would like to grow it even more and support more people. Mery is 19 years old, and lives with her parents. She is studying computing and information technology at an institute. Even so, she has to work. That's why she invests in clothing to sell as a walking vendor. She hopes to finish her studies and get a location in which to establish herself. The Communal Alliance thanks all the people who make the loans possible.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Rosinie

texts.en:
Rosinie P. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty food products like sugar-coated bananas and sweetened rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $88 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosinie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Rosinie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Marmar

texts.ru:
Marmar S. 51  let. Mermer zamujem i imeyet 4 detey, doch 20 let uchitsya v universitete, doch 18 v etom qodu postupila na dizaynera i xochet tak je kak i eyo mama shit razniye interesniye odejdi, sin 16 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom, i dochka 14 let toje uchitsya v shkole. Marmar  yavlyayetsya IDP personoy, Ona pereselenec iz okupirovannix territoriy Djabraila, seychas ona projivayet v Absheron regione , poselok Biladjari.

Marmar uje 10 let rabotayet partnixoy . Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami .Maryam s detstva lubila shit ona chasto shila odejdi svoim kuklam i mat uvidem chto doch tak lubit shit ona eyo nauchila professionalnomu sshityu  s tex por ona vse vremya shila odejdu i ochen lubit svoyu rabotu. Seychas Maryam nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu shveynuyu mashinu dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Marmar S. is 51 years old. Marmar is married and has four children: her 20-year-old daughter is studying at the university, her 18-year-old daughter enrolled in design school this year and wants to work alongside her mama sewing different interesting clothes, her 16-year-old son is in school and loves sports, and her 14-year-old daughter is also in school. Marmar is an internally-displaced person (IDP), she moved location from the occupied Djabraila territory and now she lives in the Absheron region, district Biladjari. Marmar has already been working for 10 years. She began this business alongside her own mother. In her childhood, Maryam loved to sew. She often sewed clothes for her dolls. The mother saw that her daughter loved to sew so much that she taught her professional sewing, such that she spent all her time sewing clothing and very much loves her work. Now, Maryam needs a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Chenratan

texts.en:
Mr. Chenratana C. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Srey-at An, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. 

Chenratana is a clerk. His wife has been a garment factory worker since 1994. He requested a Kiva loan once before. Now he is asking for another loan of $800 to purchase a computer and pay school fees for his brother, who is in his fourth year of college studying management.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay school fees for his brother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy fresh fruits

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose A. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Mary Rose is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mary Rose runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Mary Rose has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Mary Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Mary Rose from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a widow and lives with her son now a grown up and an independent person. She is a street vendor and sells men and women’s clothing in the surrounding neighborhoods. 

After losing her husband, Josefina struggled with very little merchandise but had to fight hard because she was on her own. Little by little she grew her business and today she offers a wider variety of products and has a much better choice of stock to offer to her clients. 

Josefina is a responsible person and has the entrepreneurial spirit to improve her business. This coupled with a good attitude will surely help achieve her goals.

loans.use: Clothing for sale

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
Esta señora es una clienta que posee 8 años de experiencia en la venta es madre soltera y tiene a su cargo a 2 hijos los cuales dependen meramente de la actividad de negocio. 
Este crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mercadería para así surtir su venta ya que se aproximan los meses buenos que es en el mes de diciembre
texts.en: This woman is a borrower who has eight years of sales experience.  She is a single mother with two children under her care, who rely solely on her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise and to stock up, as she anticipates that December will be a good month for sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: El Sr.  Rafael   se dedica a trabajar por las mañanas en una institución publica después por las noches trabaja como chofer con movilidad propia, esta casado y su esposa se dedica  al tejido de mantas, actividad donde le va muy bien, ambos compraron la movilidad con sus ahorros pero ahora esta presentando algunas fallas razón por la cual esta solicitando el crédito para la refacción y compra de llantas nuevas para la movilidad, es  una persona responsable y trabajadora que tiene muchas ganas de superación, se esfuerza mucho dedicándose a estas dos actividades pero sabe que su esfuerzo será recompensado, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Rafael works mornings for a public institution and at night he drives his own taxi.  He is married and his wife weaves blankets, an activity in which she does well.  Together they used their savings to buy the vehicle.  However, it is starting to have some mechanical problems and this is why he’s asking for a loan: to make repairs and to buy new tires for the vehicle.

He is a responsible, hard working person who very much wants to get ahead in life.  He puts in a lot of effort to both activities knowing that effort will be rewarded.  He is very grateful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: For vehicle repair and to buy tires.

loans.name: Melva Nelly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Melva esta en el Banco Comunal hace mas de 12 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la Fundación Espoir, ella se desempeña como fiscal de pagos y le gusta pertenecer a la directiva del Banco Comunal. Tiene 45 años de edad y está casada, fruto de esta relación tiene cinco hijas de 20 – 19 – 16 – 14 y 10  años, todas sus hijas estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar vende productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios) trabaja todos los días en sus entregas y cobros ya que deja a crédito sus productos. Lo que más vende son  perfumes y bisutería, dice que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren a ella a pesar de haber tanta competencia.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería, y otros productos de ambas marcas. Su sueño es llegar a ser una directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope & Progress) community bank meets twice a month in Montecristi, a region known for its rich precolonial culture and for the traditional that are made here and known around the world.  The famous straw hats are made here, for example.

Sra. Melva has been a member of the bank for 12 rounds and she likes the benefits that Fundacion Espoir provides.  She is the community bank's treasurer and she is pleased to be on its board of directors.  She is 45 years old and married.  She and her husband have five daughters: 20-, 19-, 16- 14- and 10-years old, respectively.  All of her daughters are in school: university, high school or elementary school.  Her husband works in a factory.

Melva is a good housewife and she helps her husband with household expenses by selling Avon and Yanbal beauty products, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.  She works every day, delivering product and collecting money for products sold on credit.  Her biggest sellers are perfumes and jewelry.  She says that, though there is a lot of competition, her customers prefer to buy from her.

Melva will use this loan to buy creams, perfumes, jewelry and other Avon and Yanbal products.  Her goal is to be a Yanbal director.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Maria Sagrario

texts.es: Maria Sagrario tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una mujer responsable y reside en el barrio el rosario, ella se encarga de administrar su negocio. Fue iniciativa propia como una alternativa para tener ingresos y crecer económicamente. Actualmente solicitan un préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Su principal proyecto es que su negocio cuente con la mercadería que demandan los clientes, que sea prospero y que le ayude a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en: Maria Sagrario is 31 years old, she sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for more than 5 years, and is a responsible woman who is in charge of managing it.  She resides in the Rosario neighborhood. She started the business as her own initiative to build an alternative means of income and economic growth.  She is currently seeking a loan to buy merchandise.  Her primary focus is to ensure that her business has the merchandise that clients demand as the high season approaches, so that it will be prosperous and cover her household necessities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal, 34, is married with two children, aged two and a half and four. She also takes care of two relatives aged 12 and 16. Her husband works in the military. Chantal runs a boutique selling bananas and other foodstuffs in the Gasabo district of Rwanda. She has been in this business for one year and her hours of operation are 6am to 6pm daily.  

Chantal has requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to expand her business. The extra income generated from this loan will help her to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N. is a divorced woman who was not formally educated and who does not have any children. To earn a living, Abena sells kenkey, which is a local dish made from fermented corn dough. She also runs a drinking bar at Abrafo near Abura, which she has operated for the past four years. Abena uses her business income to pay for the operating costs of her bar as well as for her home maintenance costs.

Abena is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 to purchase more ingredients needed for the preparation of the kenkey she sells to her customers. With the increase in profits she expects as a result of the loan and from an expanded business, Abena plans to further expand her rather new kenkey business and to establish it in the Abrafo market.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional ingredients for kenkey

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza G. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 45 years old, married and has eight children. Her eldest child is 18 years old while the youngest is only seven. To make a living, Riza plants and harvests rice for sale. Riza has been farming for five years now. She is hoping for a better harvest.

Riza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting her first loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva field partner CEVI, with which she intends to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her enterprise to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rocio Elena

texts.es: La señora Rocío Elena V. M. se dedica a la venta de celulares hace tres años aproximadamente su puesto se encuentra ubicado en el centro comercial Miguel Grau calle Cajamarca Ica el cual es alquilado, La solicitante vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con sus padres y su menor hija quién se encuentra en edad escolar. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Ms. Rocío Elena V. M. has been selling cellular phones for a living for about three years. She rents a stand that is located at the Miguel Grau shopping center on Cajamarca Ica Street. The applicant lives in a home with her parents and her school age daughter. She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase merchandise. She qualifies to receive this loan because she has good personal and work references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.

loans.name: Sar's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Sar, a married woman, was born in 1976 and is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this loan group will use their money to support their different purposes. 

Sar and her husband are farmers who own a 1.80-hectare plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and corn. In order to support this farming activity, Sar would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops. Aside from being farmers, they are also fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children: one is seamstress in a garment factory and the other two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 21 años es una joven muy trabajadora y sencilla, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para forjarse un buen futuro. La tienda de Yovana es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad de Puerto Ipoki, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Yovana, age 21, is a very hard-working and unassuming young woman.  She lives in her parents’ house.  What she wants most of all is to work very hard in order to build a good future.

Yovana’s store is one of the most frequented in the Puerto Ipoki community.  She opens her store very early in the morning as she prepares for her neighbors to come and buy the things they need.  She is a very happy and attentive saleswoman.  She always receives her customers with a smile, and she is ready to help them with their purchases.  

What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors.  She has had this business for one year.  The most difficult part is having to stay all day inside the store and not being able to leave.  In time she hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise.  This is to be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is prepared to make all of her payments on time.  She does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is very well-liked by the rest of the members.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more products to better set up her store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long M. is 40 years old and a married woman from the province of Kompong Cham. In order to fix the needs of the family, Long M. sells a few grocery goods out of her home. She has over ten years' experience in this sector and earns approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband is a local fisherman to help support the family. They have been married for years and have seven single children, none of them yet employed. Some of them are still in school and the others assist Long M. in selling grocery items. Long M. will use her loan to support her husband’s business by the purchase of more fish feed and fishing equipment.

loans.use: to assist her husband purchase fish food and fishing equipment

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Juliet has a business selling milk, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more milk for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more on how to use money wisely.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou H. (pictured here) is 38 years old, and her husband, Mr. Pechh Keang, is 39 years old. The couple has been married since 1994 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two are garment factory workers, three attend school, and another one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Chanthou is a mango farmer, and her husband is a mason. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to renovate and concrete the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate and concrete the house where she lives

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is a housewife as well as a working woman. She works in a factory for a low income. She also does her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to a son who is a rickshaw driver. He drives a rented rickshaw and provides transport services to passengers. Her husband works in a private company for a reasonable income.
  
Sardaran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to buy a rickshaw which will help him provide better transport services to his customers without any time restriction. He will be able to keep the whole earnings from his work without giving to the rickshaw owner. He has been attached to this profession for the past four years, and Sardaran is confident that a new rickshaw will help him improve his profits. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Saint Antoine De Padoue Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe St Antoine de Padoue est créé le 01 juin 2011. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et elles ont le commerce de poissons comme activité principale.

Madame Véronique, située à droite de la photo avec la main gauche levée, est responsable du groupe. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant en charge.

Elle a comme activité le commerce, avec une épicerie au Cap Skiring où elle vend beaucoup d'articles divers. Elle pratique cette activité de commerce depuis plus de 5 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son épicerie en diversifiant ses articles.

Avec les revenus, Mme Véronique veut renforcer son épargner afin d'acheter un terrain à titre d'habitation.
texts.en:
The St. Antoine de Padoue group was set up on 1st June 2011. It is made up of 30 women who live in the same district and their main activity is selling fish.

Véronique, who is on the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is in charge of the group. She is single and mother to one child for whom she is responsible.

She has a trading activity with a grocery store in Cap Skiring where she sells a large number of different products. She has been carrying out this trading business for more than five years.

This loan will enable her to build up her grocery store by diversifying the products she sells. With her income, Véronque wants to boost her savings in order to buy a piece of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy products in order to build up her grocery store

loans.name: Hasifah's Group

texts.en:
Hasifah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hasifah has a tailoring business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hasifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Hasifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her business generate more capital.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Las Gardeñas Group

texts.es:
La señora Fidelia es casada, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos 4 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios  domésticos, y a la prestar servicio de comadrona para lo cual necesita comprar medicamento para atender a sus clientas, lleva 10 años de experiencia es esta labor, el esposo de ella se dedica al comercio.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de  medicamentos para la atención de sus clientas, ya que espera atender a más mujeres y contar con lo necesario. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a: la producción agrícola, servicios de curación por medicina natural, y al comercio.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 55 years old and married. She has 6 children, 4 of whom are in school. She dedicates herself to her domestic chores, and she also provides midwife services, for which she needs to buy medicines to serve her patients. She has 10 years of experience with this work. Her husband works as a merchant. 

She decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan that would allow her to buy medicines to serve her clients, since she hopes to care for more women and have what she needs to do so. The other members of the group work in agricultural production, healing with natural medicines, or commerce.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals and natural medicines.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es socia del Banco comunal Magnolia, tiene 52 años y vive con su hija de 19 años que ha ingresado a la Universidad San Cristóbal para sacar su título de profesora. Cirila es ambulante y vende huevos, helados y gelatina. Ella estará utilizando su préstamo para comprar más mercancía de Lima.  Durante las fiestas de 28 de Julio (Fiestas Patrias de Perú), Cirila también venderá escarapelas de tela y de metal. Cirila recuerda muy bien el día en que se hizo socia de FINCA Perú.  Fue un día 9 de Diciembre, hace más de 20 años, cuando solo habían diez bancos, que “La Morenita” le sugirió que se uniera a FINCA Perú.  “La Morenita” le dijo “no me hagas quedar mal, se puntual” y desde ese día que Cirila siempre ha sido puntual y responsable.  Su primer ahorro lo tenía listo para comprarse un carro, pero su esposo se enfermó y le pago su cirugía.  Luego dice, que su esposo la dejo, pero que eso solo le ha servido para seguir adelante y ser una mujer más fuerte e independiente.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank.  She is 52 years old, and she lives with her 19 year old daughter.  Her daughter has enrolled in the Universidad San Cristóbal in order to get her teaching degree.

Cirila sells eggs, ice cream, and gelatin in an itinerant manner.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise from Lima.  During the July 28th festivities (Peruvian national holiday) Cirila will also sell fabric and metal rosettes. 

Cirila remembers very well the day she became of member of FINCA Perú.  It was the 9th of December over 20 years ago, and there were only ten banks.  “La Morenita” (The Virgen of Guadalupe) suggested joining FINCA Perú.  La Morenita told her “do not disappoint me, be punctual.”  From that day on Cirila has always been punctual and responsible.

She had her first savings ready to buy a car.  However, her husband became ill, and they paid for his surgery.  Then, she says, her husband left her.  Nevertheless, this only served her to get ahead and to be a stronger and more independent woman.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products to sell.

loans.name: Mamadrasul

texts.ru: Мамадрасул проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сыновья находятся в России. Сам он имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более 8 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для покупки конфет, сахара, муки, сливочного масла и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Mamadrasul lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife, and his sons are in Russia. He has a degree in teaching. He has been trading in the market for more than eight years.  He rents a spot where he opened a grocery store. He is taking out a loan to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loans.use: to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a weaver, and her husband is a fisherman and construction worker. They have one son and two daughters. One child is in school and other two are still young. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sim is asking for a loan of $300 to buy new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business because they are old. She will also use part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking 47-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children between 9 and 15 years old who go to school. For the last 29 years, he has been engaged in gas welding to make a living. He wants in the next five years to have opened up another shop. His dream is to expand his business and serve more clients. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy gauge for welding. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access a credit facility easily.

loans.use: to buy gauge for welding

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 34 years old, married and has two children in school. He runs a curio shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has operated the business for two years and has employed two people. He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
His desire is to fully stock his shop so as to meet his customer’s demands.  He needs 15, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Mekhdi

texts.en: Mekhdi is a 44-year-old man who has engaged in poultry breeding for the last 5 years. He is married and has 2 children. He breeds poultry as well as cattle. His wife is a housekeeper and helps Mekhdi in his business. He makes an income of 250 USD per month. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase more chicken and geese. These are quite popular poultry in the country and Mekdhi hopes he will be able to cover market demand.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to increase profit

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Her goal is to improve her hog-raising business to support her family and continue sending her children to school. She has been in this business for almost 26 years, earning profits of P8,000 per head that she uses for their basic necessities and to finance the education of their children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has the strong determination to uplift their living standard and to give her children a better life.

Helen wants to raise more pigs to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her piggery business. She does everything for the benefit of their under-privileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 1º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde este año. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para todas y de esa forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Elena, la cual tiene 3 hijos, está casada con Cristino, su marido trabaja como Sereno y ella tiene hace varios años un Kiosko. Cuenta Elena que tiene buenas ventas siempre, pues los clientes siempre acuden hasta su local, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles y bebidas para su negocio para venderlos a sus clientes. Ve al crédito como una gran ayuda para seguir con su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación was formed when one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya.  The group are in their first loan cycle and this is their first year with Fundación Paraguaya.  They came together with the goal of making more income for each member and thereby improving the living conditions of each of them.

One of the members of this group is Elena.  Elena has three children and is married to Cristino.  Her husband works as a night watchman and she has run a food kiosk for several years.  Elena tells us that she always makes good sales as her customers always come to her business which makes her good income.  She is requesting this loan to buy food and drink to sell to her customers.  She sees the loan as a great help which will enable her to continue running her small business.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks

loans.name: Ayivo Group
