texts.fr: Le groupe AYIVO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Léontine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Léontine est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Léontine a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Léontine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Léontine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Depuis six ans, Léontine exerce comme activité, la vente de boissons et de conserves dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Léontine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Léontine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AYIVO is comprised of three persons who reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Léontine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Léontine is 52 years old and a widow with two children, who are both in school and still in her care. She lives alone with her children and ensures that their different expenses are covered. Léontine has attended middle school. For six years, she has had a business selling beverages and canned foods in her district; this enables her to respond fairly easily to the needs of her family. 

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, Léontine would like to bolster her business. To do so, she and the other members of the group AYIVO are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages and boxes of canned foods

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Rebecca has a farm where she harvests and sells corn and a variety of vegetables by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her corn field and vegetable garden. Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Borin

texts.en: Borin, 49, is a widow living with her daughter in the Kandal province. She grows and sells vegetables and her daughter is a garment factory worker. Borin is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a water pump.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to water vegetables

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités de petit commerce dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de parures (boucles d’oreilles, chaînes, rouge à lèvres et fonds de teint), chaussures, sacs à main, bois de chauffe et  des jus de gingembre et d’oseille de Guinée. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce et de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire. Madame Niamoye (2ème femme habillée en bleu blanc de la gauche vers la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de la matière première pour la préparation des jus locaux (sucre, aromes ou essences, gingembre et d’oseille de Guinée). 
Pour faire des jus, elle fait éplucher le gingembre avec le couteau, le lave proprement, le broie dans un mortier, l’imbibe dans l’eau pendant 2 heures au moins, recueil ce filtrat, le mélange avec les autres ingrédients avant de faire un bon dosage par rajout d’eau naturelle. Le mélange ainsi obtenu est réparti dans des sachets plastiques et mis au frais dans le congélateur prêt à la vente. 
Les jus sont vendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Médine à une clientèle mixte. Madame Niamoye espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être épargné, réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer au quotidien. 
Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un gros congélateur pour pouvoir augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is comprised of five married women, mostly in monogamous households with an average age of 44 and with 5 children per woman. They all live in the 'Darsalam de Ségou' neighbourhood (the fourth largest administrative area of Mali), and came to meet one another as parents, through marriage and through their trading activity in the market at  'Médine de Ségou'.
The group members buy and sell jewelry (ear rings, chains, lipstick and hair colouring materials) shoes, handbags, logs for the fireplace and juices made from ginger and sorrel 'oseille de Guinée'.
With a view to increasing their working capital and available cash, the group members applied to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth collective loan. Madame Niamoye (second on the left, dressed in blue and white) plans to use the loan to buy raw materials to make regional juices (sugar, flavourings/essences, ginger and Guinea sorrel (oseille de Guinée)). In order to prepare the juices, she peels the ginger with a knife, washes it thoroughly, crushes it with a pestle and mortar, soaks it in water for at least two hours, and then mixes the liquid with the other ingredients before topping it up with fresh water to obtain the correct dilution. The resulting blend is placed into plastic sachets and chilled in the freezer ready for sale. 
The juices are sold to a mixed customer base, for cash and credit, both from her home and at Médine market. Madane Niamoye hopes to make an average 40,000 CFA profit monthly with this loan, which will be used for savings, and re-invested in the business, as well as to cover the family's day to day basic needs. Her goal is to purchase a large freezer so she can grow the scale of her business through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of regional juice specialities

loans.name: Henrietta F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the secondary schools in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Henrietta the leader of this group. Fifty-year-old Henrietta was born in Lunsar. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children who are in college. Henrietta has been a teacher for thirty-one years now. She has requested for this loan in order to pay her children's college tuition.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition for her children

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita realizar una nueva inversión a su negocio, comprará ropa de temporada como Blusas, short, vestidos y pantalones para mantener mayor disponibilidad a los clientes, esto le ayudará para mejorar las ventas y ganar nuevos clientes.
Ella considera que el inventario de su negocio ha mejorado a través de la buena administración de los préstamos, ya que le permite mantener las prendas de vestir que son más demandadas en el mercado.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she needs to make a new investment in her business.  She will buy seasonal clothing, such as tops, shorts, dresses, and pants, to have more available to her customers.  This will help her improve her sales and attract new customers.  

She believes her business' inventory has improved through good management of her loans, as it allows her to stock the clothing items that are most in-demand in the market.

loans.use: to buy tops, shorts, dresses, and pants

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old and a sole proprietor who is married with two children aged 25 and 10 years old, respectively.  She has been in business for 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy two sacks of tea leaves as well as for transportation.  The profit she makes would help her educate her children.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: To purchase more tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David continua con sus estudios, es una persona muy dedicada que quier ser un buen profesional y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino para ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus cuotas, y continuar con sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas y continuar con sus estudios.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Hristina

texts.en:
Hristina I. is 45 years old and runs her business for 6 years. He keeps a shop for cosmetics and perfumery. She works alone in her shop but sometimes her daughter who is a third year student in economics gives her some help. The shop is on one of the main streets of the town and has many customers. Hristina’s husband also has a business – he is an auto driving trainer.

Hristina I. needs this $ 2 000 loan for working capital – to supply perfumery and cosmetics for her shop.

loans.use: To supply perfumery and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with two children. He owns a kiosk where he sells men’s clothing, hats and caps at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. His business is in a very convenient location in a busy marketplace that is flooded with customers every day.

Victor keeps a nice arrangement of inventory in his kiosk which helps his clothing sell well and attracts new customers. Victor has good managerial skills and his ability to find common ground with every client makes him pleasant to deal with. He has been in this business for eight years and currently has around $2,000 in inventory. His gross monthly income is about $1,000. His net profit is about $300 per month.

Victor believes that family is his highest priority. He tries to provide financial support for his own family as well as his parents and sister. Victor’s daughter recently got married. There were many expenses connected with the wedding, but Victor made sure this special event in his daughter’s life was unforgettable. He is asking for a loan for $1,200 to increase his working capital and concentrate on business expansion. Victor’s credit history is impeccable. We believe his perseverance and planning will prevail and his business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: Victor would like to buy new inventory for his men's clothing store.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: With the hope of improving her family’s standard of living, Raisa entered the sphere of commerce seven years ago. During the last seven years as an entrepreneur, Raisa has been a client in good standing with Nadiya Ukraine. Nadiya’s loans have provided consistent support to Raisa as she has expanded her business. Currently, Raisa sells women’s garments at a kiosk in the local market of Melitopol, Ukraine. With the profits of her business, Raisa not only supports her family of four, but also her retired parents. She is lively and cheerful, hard-working and committed to the success of her business and the welfare of her family. Currently, Raisa is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase inventory for the summer season. Raisa hopes to thereby continue developing her business and successfully supporting her family.

loans.use: Purchase of more inventory

loans.name: Faaluaumeke

texts.en: Faaluaumeke is a married twenty six year old with two children. She is starting a barbecue as her running business because it is very easy to do and she believes it’s a fast money source. That’s why she will use all of her $300 loan to buy the ingredients needed for her existing business. She is hoping to get another loan to extend it, and use it to build a house for her business so that she can sell her grilled foods and other things such pop-corn, chips and drinks. She is working very hard on her business in order to make money to sustain her family and kids

loans.use: Buying meats for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more ingredients, chairs , and tables.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sopha got married in 2006 and has one son. She runs a business weaving silk at home. She began her silk production in 2003 after she learned to weave silk from her mother. Even though she is married, she lives with her parents in Koh Dach village.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA, her first, for $500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and some will be used to repair her family's house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to repair her house

loans.name: Wonday

texts.en: Wonday is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells food items in the market town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She is one of SMT’s good clients.  She has a healthy repayment history with a wealth of business knowledge.  Her plan is to become one of the most successful businesswomen in Sierra Leone and she would like to expand her business gradually but surely. She is therefore requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business gradually so that she can reach her goal of becoming one of the most successful businesswomen in Sierra Leone.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ritah N.. She is currently in the business of cloth selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more clothes. Ritah is 30 years old and married to her husband, who is a mechanic. She has 3 children ranging from age 6 to 12, all of whom go to school. Each week, Ritah makes approximately UGX 70,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more clothes. Ritah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300,000 in order to help with her business expansion and the loan was paid back on time.

Ritah is joined in her small group by Deborah N., Zamu N., Sylivia N., and Justine N.. Deborah N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy more food.

Zamu N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to stock more items.

Sylivia N. is currently in the business of raising and selling poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to build a poultry house.

Justine N. is currently in the business of running a saloon and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to buy better equipment.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: C.nabuti C(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Norah N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture. Norah is 28 years old and i single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Norah is joined in her small group by Mariam M., Florence N., Maureen N., and Kato M.. Mariam M. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock. Florence N. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to boost business. Maureen N. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to add in stock. Kato M. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To add working capital to restaurant business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia sells various brands of cosmetics. She is divorced, has 4 grown children, and does not receive a pension so she had to begin a business in order to meet her expenses and maintain her house. She began her business 2 years ago with some neighbors and to date has a good number of customers.

She needs a loan of US$475, which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase a display case to show and store her products. With your help Hortencia will be able to continue to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hortencia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diversas marcas su estado civil es divorciada y como sus 4 hijos ya son mayores de edad, ya no recibe pensión, por lo que tuvo que comenzar un negocio para poder sobrellevar sus gastos, y sostener su casa, inicio hace dos años con sus vecinos y a la fecha cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes

Ella requiere un crédito por US $ 475 que pagara en 6 meses el cual será destinado a la compra de una vitrina para exhibir y guardar sus productos. Con tu ayuda doña Hortencia seguirá teniendo un ingreso para subsistir

loans.use: Purchase a display case

loans.name: Fatma's Hatutaki Matatizo Group

texts.en:
Fatma, age 34, is divorced and takes care of her four children (aged 15, 14, 7, and 2). She makes a living by selling food at her small cafe and works there from 6am to 3pm daily. From this business, which she started in April of last year, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $35.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup, as they are members of the loan group, Hatutaki Matatizo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her cafe

loans.name: Vilma Angelica's Group

texts.es:
Damelta, Luz, and Vilma belong to the “Union II” comunal bank.

Damelta is married, is 39 years old and has 3 children. Luz lives with her husband, is 26 years old and has 2 children. Damelta and Luz each sell ice cream as street vendors on two important streets in the city of Ayacucho. Damelta also has a car which her husband uses for a taxi service.

Vilma, meanwhile, is a widow, is 51 years old and has 3 children. She has a small grocery store in her house, which is located in the Santa Ana neighborhood. Additionally, she also makes items on a loom, such as tapestries, and knits sweaters that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Damelta, Luz, and Vilma need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 450.00 soles, and 900.00 soles, which they will use to buy a variety of ice creams, sugar, rice, and wool yarns.

The dreams of Damelta, Luz, and Vilma are to have their own houses, to expand their businesses, to have a restaurant, and that their children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Damelta, Luz y Vilma pertenecen al Banco Comunal Union II.

Damelta es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, por otro lado Luz es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos. Damelta y Luz venden helados por separado, de manera ambulatoria en dos calles importantes de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Damelta tiene un carro con el cual su esposo realiza servicio de taxi.

Mientras que Vilma es viuda, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ubicado en el barrio de Santa Ana. Además Vilma hace artesanía en telar como tapices y también teje chompas que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Damelta, Luz y Vilma necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados variados, azúcar, arroz y lanas.

Los sueños de Damelta, Luz y Vilma son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio, tener un restaurante y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Damelta, Luz, and Vilma need loans of 1,250.00 soles, 450.00 soles, and 900.00 soles, which they will use to buy a variety of ice creams, sugar, rice, and wool yarns.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi O. is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells electronics and household equipment. Nkechi learned this business in 12 months and started her own shop in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Nkechi needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more electronics and household equipment. She says "thank you" to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more electronics inventory

loans.name: Irma Rosa

texts.es:
Irma would like a loan to invest in home improvements by finishing plastering the walls of her house.

She has been in charge of the women's section in the Institute of Farmers for 8 years. She is currently studying for a degree in the University of Martin Lutero. She has 4 kids, all of whom are over 18. Her husband works on a farm, and she helps him with the household costs. She also gets help from her son who is in Costa Rica. Although she has been working for 48 years she wants to overcome in many professional areas of life. Her dream is to have a house with better conditions and professional stability to help her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Irma está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda terminará de repellar las paredes de su vivienda. Trabaja como responsable de la sección de la mujer en una Institución de agricultores y ganaderos desde hace 8 años, actualmente está estudiando una Licenciatura en la Universidad Martin Lutero. Tiene 4 hijos, todos son mayores de edad , su esposo trabaja en una finca y le ayuda a su esposa con los gastos familire, también esta señora recibe ayuda de un hijo que se encuentra en Costa Rica, a pesar que es una clienta de 48 años de edad tiene deseos de superarse tanto en lo laboral como en lo profesional, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To finish plastering the walls of her house/Terminar Repello de las paredes de su vivienda

loans.name: Fruit Sales Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of S. M. A. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a clerk. The next to him is in the 7th standard (grade). Her daughter recently memorized the Quran-e-Pak (Holy Book of Muslims). Her husband belongs to a journalism profession. Kosar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her nephew to expand his fruit business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy computer parts to resell. Khadija baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil and washing powder (detergent) to resell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goat, cows) to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (a chair, a mirror) for her beauty parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruits to resell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo O. is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells ice cream in her house, wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for the past five years. She prepares the ice creams and customers come to buy in bulk from her. She also sells retail to her consumers. 

Titilayo needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase a generator, as there is no constant electricity supply. This, she said, will enable her keep the ice cream frozen at all times as customers like the ice cream chilled. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a generator for her ice cream business

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin M. is a villager in Phdaov Chum Kiet Village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a 39-year-old widow with no children. Mrs. M. is a duck breeder who raises about 100 ducks. Since this business is going well, she want to expand it, is so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to breed. She will use the rest of the loan buy duck food to feed them. 

She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with these new additions.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed and duck food to feed them.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena H. sells charcoal and soft drinks at Adakope near Shama. Lena has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Lena has been selling charcoal since 2000. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees as well as the family's utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale. Charcoal is a popular fuel for those who cannot afford gas, and demand for it is very high. She hopes to reinvest her new profits into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale since demand for it is very high.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia V. sells beef. She has been in this business since 2004. She is a LAPO client. Felicia hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase beef to sell

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hồ Thị T. 23 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề bán thuốc bắc. Công việc của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua thêm một số vị thuốc phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ho Thi T. is 23 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she and her husband sells traditional medical herbs. The family's business is stable and produces an income of VND3,000,000 per month. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy additional herbs to serve the local community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy traditional medical herbs

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es: l grupo " San Expedito" esta representado por la señora Sandra Luz y  cuenta con algunas socias que han trabajado en anteriores grupos con la fundación agrocapital  y se unieron para integrar uno nuevo Banco conformado D. gente responsable y cumplida. En general las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como comida, cosméticos, pan, ropa y actividades como, servicio domestico D. limpieza, confección D. ropa tejida, servicio D. transporte,  construcción y a la elaboración D. artesanías. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es fuerte por la oferta y la demanda D. productos pero la experiencia y la capacidad D. superación D. los socios vence cualquier contingencia. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio. Los miembros del grupo conocen la forma D. trabajo con grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados y responder con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The 'San Expedito' group is represented by Sandra Luz, and includes a number of members who have worked in previous groups with Fundacion Agrocapital. They united to form a new community bank maD. up of responsible and committed people. In general the members work selling products including food, cosmetics, bread and clothing, and in activities including domestic cleaning services, clothing textile manufacturing, transport services, construction and the elaboration of handicrafts. There is strong competition in the commercial sphere driven by the supply and demand for products, but the members' experience and capacity to overcome challenges triumphs over any obstacle. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and materials, as well as to repair work tools in order to offer better service. The group members are familiar with how to work in solidarity groups, and know how to manage funds well and responsibly fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irma Raquel

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Irma vende miel de abeja de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de una tienda. Además Irma junto a su esposo venden artefactos, cubrecamas, en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD, licuadora y cubrecamas.
Los sueños de Irma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda estable de venta de artefactos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Capuli community bank. Irma is in a common-law relationship; she is 33 years old and has two children. Irma is a street vendor selling honey at the doorway of a store. Irma and her husband also sell artifacts, bedspreads at various regional markets. Irma needs a 3,000 soles loan which she will invest in the purchase of DVDs, a blender and bedspreads. Irma's dream is that her sons have careers and to own a stable store to sell artifacts.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy DVDs, a blender and bedspreads.

loans.name: Esoria

texts.en:
Esoria M. is a resident of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zambo. Norte, in the Philippines. She is married, with one child.  Her husband is a postmaster for their municipality.  Mrs. M. is also a barangay, or village, treasurer for Magsaysay. She operates a sari-sari store at her family's residence as another source of income. She started her business with the family's own savings. 
She became a member of Kiva's partner, Paglaum MPC,  under a microfinance program known as PDP-LP last October 2008, without availing herself of its credit services.  A few months later she decided to seek a loan.  She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari store -- Php laundry and bath soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, oil and sesame and many others -- to answer the needs of her customers. 
Mrs. M. is looking forward to the benefits and services of Paglaum MPC.  She is hoping that Paglaum can help her develop and expand her business through its financial services.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery items for sari-sari store

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
This loan is for a group of four members, all of whom live in Kandal Province. The group leader is Phy I., a 36-year-old single woman. Since 2003 Phy I. has made a living by sewing clothes in the garment industry, for which she receives a salary of $100 per month. She currently takes a taxi to work and hopes to reduce her transport costs by using her loan to buy a used motorbike to ride to work. The other three borrowers are:
– D., a seamstress in the garment industry, requesting a loan for her husband to buy vegetables to sell
– S., a garment worker, requesting a loan to run a fruit store
– P., a garment supervisor, asking for a loan to run a tailoring service from her home.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Домуллочонов Фуркат-мужчина 27 лет. Фуркат занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Сомониен 32 микрорайона города Худжанда. Фуркат закупает товар из оптового рынка « Гули Сурх» города Истаравшана. Фуркат дополнительно вечером работает  таксистом. Он решил увеличит товарооборот поэтому решил открыть вторую точку на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда.
texts.en:
Furkat D. is a 27-year-old man. He sells children's clothing at the Somonien market in the 32nd district of the city of Khujand. Furkat purchases his good from the Guli Surkh wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Furkat additionally work evenings as a taxi driver. He decided to increase his turnover, so resolved to open a second sales outlet at the Panchshanbe market, also in Khujand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Муродова  Мухаббат – женщина  49  лет,  замужем,  имеет  4-х  детей. На  протяжении  десяти  лет  Мухаббат  занимается  продажей  одеял,  постельного  белья,  полотенец  и  скатертей  на  вещевом  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  С  2003  года  она  является  одной  из  наших  активных  клиентов.  Один  раз  в  месяц  Мухаббат  ездит  за  товаром  в  г. Бишкек  Республики  Кыргизстан.  Её  муж  мастер  строительных  работ.  Вместе  со  своим  старшим  сыном  он  недавно  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации.  Мухаббат  и  её  семья  мечтают  о  том,  чтобы  открыть  в  центре  района  свой  собственный  магазин.
texts.en:
Muhabbat M. is a 49-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. For ten years, Muhabbat has sold blankets, bedding, towels and tablecloths at the Spitamen district clothing market. Since 2003, she has been one of MicroInvest's vital customers. Once a month, Muhabbat goes to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, on a buying trip. Her husband works in construction, and he and their eldest son recently returned from Russia. Muhabbat and her family dream of opening their own shop in the center of the district.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand selection

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a resident of Del Pilar, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is already a widow. She has five children. Now, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan for the educational expenses of her child. She is so happy with Paglaum knowing it can provide financial assistance for the education of her children.  Now she is so hopeful that if her daughter will seriously do her part, with hard work and dedication she can finish her studies.

loans.use: For tuition fees

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi L. is a 53-year-old divorced woman and is the mother of four children. Three of them are married and live independently, while the youngest one is a daughter who works selling used goods for a profit. Yi L. currently sells a few items in her own store next to her home. She sells them to villagers who live near her house. Yi L. is a fantastic mother who has tried to earn money to feed her kids from the time they were still babies until they married. Currently, because of her investment, the fact that her business is still running well, and an increasing number of customers' needs, she would like a loan of $1000 to order buy more grocery inventory to sell. Yi L. was not available at that time for photographing, so her daughter is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To order buy more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Wisdom

texts.en:
Wisdom D. is a fitter and an auto mechanic who repairs cars and sells spare parts at Konda in Kpando. Wisdom did not receive any form of formal education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a petty trader who earns little for a living.

Wisdom has been in the fitter and auto mechanic professions since 1990. He is responsible for the paying of school fees and other financial responsibilities in his home. His loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is 47 years old, single and a resident of Zone IV, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occiental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and is member No. 01 of Group 236, Center No. 37 of the Hinigaran Branch of NWTF-PD.

She started a General Store business 13 years ago to support herself and a niece. The General store is commonly known as a "sari-sari" store in the local dialect because it offers a wide variety of goods for sale from groceries to even hardware products. The variety store nets an average of PHP 6,500 or about $136 per month. Alma supplements her income by raising and fattening pigs which earns her an additional PHP 3,000 or $62.50/month.

She wants to use the PHP 17,000.00 loan to purchase more goods to resell in her Variety Store and for additional working capital. She is working hard and hopes to expand her business so that she can continue supporting and save enough for the education of her young niece.

She has previously paid up a loan of PHP 15,000.00 during her last loan cycle. This new loan is her 17th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Inventory and working capital for the borrower's business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet P. is from the village of Macalibre. She is 23 years old. Janet is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Janet is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Janet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 40 years old. She is married and has no child. She lives with her husband and some step children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family.  

Theresa is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. Theresa buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell.

loans.name: Qadseya Group

texts.en:
Qadseya is the group leader of Qadseya group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to borrow money for their businesses.

Rona and Qadseya want to take out a loan for their tailoring business because they want to buy a new sewing machine.

Masoda needs a loan so that her husband can buy necessary materials for his business of selling fruit from his cart.

Bibi Monesa would like to enable her husband to buy what he needs for his business as a mechanic.

They are requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Afghani. With this loan they can make their businesses larger, support their families, and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Narandeger

texts.en: D. Narandeger lives with his wife in a house in Ulaanbaater, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, who is pregnant with their first child, is currently taking a break from her work as a hairdresser. Narandeger operates a cell-phone retail and repair business out of a rented room at Narantuul, the largest market in the city. The market is always very crowded and is a very profitable place to operate. He currently shares the room with a jeweler. Narandeger started his cell-phone business in 2004. He learned about cell-phone operation and repair from a close friend, and has gained much experience and skill since starting his business. Due to his successful location and increasing demand from his many customers, Narandeger feels it is time to expand his business. In the near future, he hopes to enlarge the room that he rents to allow him more selling space. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan to purchase more phones and supplies for his cell-phone business.

loans.use: to purchase more phones and supplies

loans.name: Marla Maria

texts.es: La señora Marla R. de 38 años de edad, vende refrescos y ropa de segunda mano desde hace cinco años, anteriormente tenia una pulpería pero por las ventas baja quebró y solo se quedo vendiendo refrescos, procreo tres hijos de 13,16 y18 años dos estudian y el mayor hace sus trabajo como albañil para apoyar  a sus hermanos que estudien, su papa no esta con ellos pero les ayuda económicamente con los gastos mensuales, lo que mas desea es poder a comenzar con su pulpería es por eso que invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, productos lácteos, y otros para comenzar con su venta. Es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic y agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de financiar con 24,500 a un plazo de doce meses que será de gran beneficio para comenzar a trabajar en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Marla R. is 38 years old and for the past five years has sold soft drinks and used clothing. Prior to this she had a grocery store but, due to poor sales, it went bankrupt and she only kept the soft drink sales activity. She has three children, ages 13, 16 and 18; two are still students and the eldest works as a laborer to help his siblings who are still in school. Their father does not live with them but he does help financially with monthly expenses. What she would like most is to start up her grocery store again so this loan will be used to purchase inventory: basic grains, snacks, dairy products and other supplies to start her sales. This is her fifth cycle with Afodenic and she is grateful to the institution for the opportunity to borrow 24,500 over a 12 month period which will be of great help for her to start her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase staples, snacks and dairy products.

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
N. Robinah is a 42-year-old lady, very friendly, hard working and determined, with a business selling fish at Butale trading centre. She is a married lady with eight children aged 29 to 12 years of whom four are in school.

Robinah buys her fish from the landing sites in Mukono, Lugazi and Jinja and she is faced with the challenge of the poor and costly transport network that affects her business.

This is Robinah’s first loan with her group and she hopes to be able to obtain quality fish from it, grow her business, earn more profits for paying school fees for her children, and also improve on the construction of her house.

Robinah needs a loan to help buy more fish for resale and this will enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en:
Marichelle L.'s main source of income comes from her carenderia (mini restaurant) selling a variety of foods for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. She is 28 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the city of Sto. Nino Aguada, Ozamiz City. Marichelle has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marichelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marichelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for her carenderia. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her "carenderia"

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en:
O. Baasan is 51 years old and lives with his wife and 22-year-old son in an apartment in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. His youngest son, Altanshagai, currently attends college and his wife is a retired doctor. Basaan manages a taxi service in his town. He started his business in 2001 by renting a car from his friend. After growing his business, he used his savings and a loan to purchase his own car. After repaying his loan, he took out another loan to make repairs and improve his car. He has used these improvements to further grow his business and has proven himself as a trustworthy borrower. Baasan is working hard to achieve his future goals and provide for his family and son's education. He says, "All of my older children are on their own and live happy and successful lives. All I want is to educate my youngest son so he can achieve the same life as his siblings. I want to expand my business and hope to open a tourism company in the future." Baasan is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (approximately 1050 USD) loan to pay his son's tuition fees.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To pay his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales ha pagado puntual. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su nuevo de negocio le lavado de automóviles, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene a dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, desea darles lo mejor.
Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio planea pagar este préstamo. Ya que con esta inversión su el local estará mucho mejor  y podrá contratar a dos personas más para trabajar.
texts.en:
Magdalena R. has had two previous KIVA loans that she has repaid on time. She is requesting funds now to invest in her new car wash. This business is her family's sole source of income in that she is a single mother of two children who depend on her and she wants to provide them with the best. With part of her profits from the business she plans to repay this loan because this investment in her place will make it much better and she will be able to hire two more people to work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her new business.

loans.name: Octavio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Octavio tiene  50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos todavía menores de edad. El señor tiene un taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa de habitación en el cual elabora puertas, sillas, comedores, etc. Don Octavio dio inicio a su negocio hace 28 años, cabe señalarse el señor se dedicaba a esta actividad desde su niñez ya que su padre fue carpintero y de su padre fue que aprendió el oficio. Cuando dio inicio el señor solamente tenía una cierra circular y un torno, y fue con el tiempo que empezó a hacerse de  su capital para comprar tanto madera como sus artículos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima para cumplir compromisos de pedidos que actualmente tienen pendientes. El sueño es llegar a establecer un taller más grande y poner productos a la exhibición a la venta, sin necesidad de producir solamente por pedidos.
texts.en:
Señor Octavio is 50 years old and is married, with two children who are still minors. He has a carpentry workshop located in his house, where he makes doors, chairs, dining room sets, etc. Don Octavio began his business 28 years ago. It is worth noting that he has worked at this activity since his childhood, since his father was a carpenter and it was from his father that he learned the trade. When he began, he had only a circular saw and a lathe, and with time he began to amass his capital to buy wood as well as his other items. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials to fill promised orders that are now waiting. His dream is to establish a larger workshop and exhibit articles for sale, without needing to produce only for orders.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Gulayon. She is 59 years old. Aida is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling native rattan products to local businesses and community members. Aida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be Aida's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun C., 42, and her husband, Mr. Lay Sok, 46, (pictured together) have been married since 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of the children attend school and the other one assists her parents in the business. The family is living in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thoeun has been growing vegetables and raising pigs for more than fifteen years and her husband assists her in the business. Thoeun hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional piglets and feed for her pigs. She also will use a part of her loan to build a fence around her property.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig feed and to build a fence

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 51-year-old married man. A father of three children, he opened his business in 1990 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. He opened a butcher shop and, over the years, he became well known in the whole region for his good business reputation.

Antoine repaid his first loan successfully and, after developing his business, he is asking for a new loan of $1,000 to purchase a new refrigerator to display his goods.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Miata Group

texts.en: Miata F. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Miata Group. She is 40 years old, single, and has three children who range from 9 months to 18 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go school. For five years, Miata has been selling used clothes at the #7 Community Market in Margibi County, Liberia. She sells high-quality used clothes, which keeps customers returning. Miata plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes. Her goal is to grow her business to a store and to give her children higher education so that they can have a better future. In the photo, Miata is the one holding the sign. Larry G. is inset at the lower right. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 40 years old and married with two children who go to school. He raises dairy cattle and sells milk to the local community residents to earn a living. He was previously employed by a maize mill company before he ventured into this business. He has been in this business for four years and has many plans for the future. He plans to expand his business and improve his living standards.  He had previously taken out a loan of Kes. 80,000 from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is a widow and has four children. She has no formal educational background. Efua fries fish as well as smoking them for sale at Abura. The smoked fish is often distributed to her customers in large quantity. After the customers have come for their consignment, she stays back home to sell the fried fish. 

Efua uses her income in paying school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase extra fish to smoke and to fry for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase extra fish to smoke and to fry for sale

loans.name: Mary Grace's Group

texts.en:
Mary Grace M. is from the village of Allinguigan 1st. She is 22 years old. Mary Grace is the group leader of an 11-member group taking out a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Grace M.'s Group.

Mary Grace is single. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling generic medicines in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary Grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional generic medicines to sell

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es: Samuel Antonio tiene 48 años, tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo. La actividad económica de Samuel es brindar el servicio de video juegos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esto pues la necesidad de tener un trabajo estable y generar una fuente de ingresos para su familia es muy importante, por lo que la necesidad de tener su propio negocio en su casa tambien el vende bolsitas en su vivienda para su pequeños clientes, fue la mejor idea para Samuel. El financiamiento es para la compra de equipos discos, repuestos y piezas para los videos juegos.
texts.en:
Samuel Antonio is 48 years old and is responsible for 2 children. Samuel owns a video game store. He has been doing this for the past 6 years. It was very important to have stable work and generate a source of income for his family. For this reason, he has his own business in his house. He also sells little bags of frozen sweets out of his home for his young customers. The loan is to buy equipment such as disks, replacements and parts for the video games.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sam Art's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Art S., 36 years old, is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its members, located in Preak Raing village in Kandal province. While each member of this group loan will use their share to support their different purposes, they also hope to increase their income to improve their family's living conditions. 

Mrs. Sam Art S. is a vegetable seller, while her husband, Mr. Rithy Loeung, is a security guard in a private company. With both these positions they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living standard, Mrs. Sam Art S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to change her old motorbike for her husband's new business (motorbike taxi driver).  

This couple has three children; two are attending in the local school while the youngest one is only 3 years old.

loans.use: To add to her savings to change her old motorbike

loans.name: Essi Edzodzinam

texts.fr:
Née en 1976, cette dame est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Pour contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle achète et revend des boissons locales spécialement de l’alcool communément appelé « SODABI ».
Elle s’approvisionne à Kpalimé et revend  sa boisson dans une baraque sise à son domicile.
Avec le crédit sollicité, elle compte acheter 20 bidons de boisson pour relancer son commerce.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, this lady is married with one child. In order to contribute to household costs, she buys and sells local drinks, especially an alcoholic beverage called 'Sodabi'. She sources her wares in Kpalimé and sells it from a shed located at her home. She aims to use the loan to purchase 20 flasks of the beverage in order to boost her business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flasks of drink

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group, Las Reinas 1 (Queens). She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children and, being a single mom, she says that her most difficult challenge was to study. She grew up without her mom, so it was really difficult to study, attend to home activities where she lived, and to work. She started working when she was a child.

Josefina is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying beans to cook and sell every morning to her neighbors. She also want to buy household products and silver jewelry to sell from home and by walking to sell in the afternoons.

Josefina will use the profits to invest in her business. Her dream is to give her children a healthy life full of opportunities. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her work.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

The sixth woman is named Ana (the one sitting below the one standing with the blue shirt)and She is not on this loan, Esperanza has more loans with other group of five and Ana is the leader in the second group, which we couldn't post her group profile.

loans.use: To buy beans, silver jewelry and household products

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Elsie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of ripe and raw bananas in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1995, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita B. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store , an RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothing business and a pig-fattening business. Her husband, Alex B., who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. Rita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, Rita is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future of her family. Rita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Buth

texts.en: Mrs. Buth R. is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Phnom Penh city. Buth R. is married to Heng Hun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have four children. All of them are dependent on the family income. In addition, Buth R.’s husband takes time to work in the construction sector. In view of the coming growing season, Buth R. wants to increase her crops to sell them when they have matured. As she lacks money to use on her field, Buth R. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to be used towards planting rice crops.

loans.use: To be used towards planting rice crops

loans.name: Sebedeo

texts.en:
Seventy-two-year-old Sebedeo is a married father of six children who are all adults. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 50 years and employs two farmhands. His main products are tea and milk, which he sells locally. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same area.

He recently repaid his previous loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 40,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The income from this loan will help him expand his farming and rental businesses. His primary challenges are unpredictable weather conditions, lack of labor and lack of enough finances to expand his business.

He hopes that in five years time, he will have expanded his dairy farming and rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red (palm) oil

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school. Eunice has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Eunice sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Eunice has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of salt and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Eunice include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build her own business premises. Eunice lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Darwin Alí

texts.es: Darwin H. N. es empleado de UPONIC  desempeñandose como conductor, es casado con dos personas a su cargo. El primer desembolso con CEPRODEL solicita para compra de cin y perlin para reparar el techo de su vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su pronta respuesta.
texts.en: Darwin works as a driver from a Nicaraguan university. He is married and has two children under his care. He is requesting his first loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL to purchase zinc roofing and beams to repair the roof of his home. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for its prompt response.

loans.use: Buy zinc roofing and beams to fix his home's roof

loans.name: Hugo Filibeto

texts.es:
Hugo de 40 años, es vendedor informal de ropa. Vive con su esposa e hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

El trabajaba como guardia pero como el sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia decidió comenzar a trabajar como comerciante informal. Poco a poco su trabajo fue incrementando y las ganancias fueron creciendo así que decidió continuar con esa actividad de vendedor informal de ropa y zapatos. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de su esposa. Los pantalones los vende a $ 25.00, los zapatos a $ 30.00 y las blusas a $ 5.00 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y productos de belleza para venderle a sus clientas. En el futuro quiere seguir incrementando su mercadería y tener otra línea de venta como joyería.
texts.en:
Hugo, 40, is an informal clothing merchant.  He lives with his wife and children in an urban zone, called Orquídeas, because when it was discovered there were many flowers there and currently there’s a park with these flowers.

He used to work as a Security Guard but his salary wasn’t enough to support his family so he decided to become an informal merchant.  Gradually his work grew and profits did too so he decided to continue with this informal clothing and shoes sales activity.  He currently works from very early in the morning with his wife’s help.  He sells pants for $25.00, shoes for $30.00 and blouses for $5.00 each.

He will use the loan to buy clothes and beauty products to sell to his customers.  In the future he’d like to continue to add to his stock and include an additional line of products to sell, like jewelry.

loans.use: For clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Agueda N. N. es una futura Microempresaria de la comunidad de Canalete de en Alajuela.
Ella va ser parte de una sociedad de mujeres  que van a conformar la  micro empresa “Creaciones de ensueño” la cual consiste en la confección de ropa de cama, como edredones, sabanas, cobijas, almohadas y cortinas para cuartos. Agueda asegura que podrá aportar toda la experiencia que obtuvo mientras trabajo en una fábrica de textiles.  
Para empezar cada una de ellas debe de aportar su cuota, es por eso que Doña Agueda necesita un préstamo de  ₡350 000 (trescientos cincuenta mil) para la compra de materiales, telas y maquinas de coser principalmente.
Ella    es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Agueda N. N. is a future micro-entrepreneur from the community of Canalete in Alajuela.
She is going to be a part of a group of women forming the micro-business, “Dream creations,” which will make bed linen, like quilts, sheets, bedclothes, pillows and bedroom curtains. Agueda assures us that she will be able to bring all her experience from working in a textile factory.
To get started each of them must contribute their share, which is why Agueda needs a 350,000 CRC loan to buy mainly materials, cloth, and sewing machines.
She is a member of the Canalete Communal Credit Company, one of EDESA’s 100 member organisations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Cloth and sewing machines

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara es socia del banco comunal Madre Coraje del distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad.
La señora Sara se desempeña como modista (confecciona ropa), tiene un pequeño taller donde realiza sus confecciones, lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos 3 años aproximadamente, con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos del hogar.
Este préstamo de  S/. 1000.00 soles lo invertirá en la compra de una remalladora de segunda mano, que mucha falta le hace, para que pueda dar mejor acabado a sus prendas de vestir.
La señora Sara agradece que Manuela Ramos le otorgue préstamos y sin más requisitos que su documento de identidad.
texts.en: Sara is a member of the community bank named Madre Coraje which is located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 65 years old, she is a widow, and she has 3 grown children. Sara is a seamstress (makes clothing). She has a small shop from where she makes her products. She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 3 years approximately. She is able to cover her household expenses with her business. This loan is in the amount of 1000 soles and it will be invested in the purchase of a second-hand over locker machine. She will use this machine to give a better finish to her products. Sara is very grateful to Manuela Ramos who gives her access to loans with only those id requirements.

loans.use: To purchase an over locker.

loans.name: Rosa Mística Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inició la Señora Rosa Ruíz  quién vive en la Zona del Km 7 CiuD. del Este quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona 
En este comité la presidenta es la Sra. Rosa quien se dedica a la venta de ropas se encuentra muy contenta con sus socias del comité y desea continuar trabajando.

Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de ropas como remeras, vestidos, shorts y otros para contar con mercaderías variadas para cliente.
texts.en:
This committee was founded by Rosa Ruíz D. who lives in Km 7 area of Ciudad Nueva.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in her area. 

The president of this committee sells clothes.  She is very happy with the other members of her committee and would like to continue working.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as t-shirts, dresses, shorts, etc. so that she can have a variety of merchandise to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 30 años, es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, vive junto a su pareja con el que tienen 4 hijos. La casa que habitan es propia y está ubicada en el distrito de Samugari, selva de Ayacucho.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas; cultiva cacao, café y hoja de coca, productos que lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que invierte todas sus fuerzas para sacar adelante este negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos,  pero cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su pareja, quien es su brazo derecho. Para más adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anterior crédito y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 30 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working person who lives together with her partner and their four children.  She lives in her own home which is located in Samugari district, in the jungle of Ayacucho.

Through a lot of hard work, Florencia has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows cacao, coffee and coca leaf and then takes these products to the city of San Francisco to sell wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself and help with her family's expenses.  For this reason, she invests all her effort into her business in order to make progress in it.

What Florencia most likes about her work is caring for her crops since she feels very happy doing it.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products.  However, she has the unconditional support of her partner who is her right-hand man.  In the future, she would like to buy new land so that she can increase her crops.

This is Florencia's third loan with MFP.  She was very punctual in paying back her previous loan and she hopes to continue to be punctual in paying back this loan too.  Florencia plays an active role in her community bank and she is always up to date on the agreements that have been reached within the group.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros F., 44 years old is engaged into rice production business. She started her business in 2001. She hopes that she will be able to own a bigger farm someday and continue to provide her family the things that they need.

Her business challenges is that she doesn’t have enough money to buy the farm inputs.  Also, seeds and fertilizers are quite expensive. Receiving a loan will help her go on with her business. It is her hope that she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

Milagros is 44 years old and a mother of two children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 32-year old single woman who supports her family by operating a grocery store and an electronic loading business.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cristina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks for the grocery store so that she could expand into produce business. Cristina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference  in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable).
