Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team."

loans.use: Purchase more stocks for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Choup

texts.en: Choup S., 51, is a modest villager living in Phnom Penh City, the capital of Cambodia. She currently lives with her niece who is employed as a sewing worker. She was married, but she divorced her husband many years ago and has no children. Since 2008, Choup S. runs a business selling different kinds of Khmer cake. She is able to earn an income of on average $2 each day. Choup S. is applying for this loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Isatu K.. She is married, and has three children, ages 4, 7, and 12 years, who live with her. 

In 2007, Isatu established her plastic slipper business. She began her business because it serves as a means of employment. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Egyptian pounds (L.E.) every month. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 L.E. in order to buy more stock for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 L.E. 

In the future, Isatu  plans to buy in larger quantities to supply to other traders. She also wants to open a shop and hire workers. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to business capital.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 37 years old .She is married. Her one child, who is 8 years old, goes to school.

Clementine sells soft drinks to earn a living. She has done this business for 12 years and it has enabled her to pay her house rent easily with no difficulties. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks and, hence, to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Democrita

texts.en:
Democrita C. is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 63 years old. Democrita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Democrita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling snacks & other delicacies like "puto" or rice cake, "banana cues" & hot cakes in the local community. Democrita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Democrita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Democrita is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like sugar, flour & ripe bananas. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Democrita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like sugar, flour & ripe bananas.

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Rizza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizza owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits like mangoes, watermelon & bananas in the local community. Rizza has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rizza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rizza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rizza is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rizza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of fruit.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Valentín Antonio

texts.es:
A L. vivienda del señor Valentín le está haciendo falta L. barda alrededor D. L. casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilL., arena y para pagarle a L. persona  que se encargara D. realizar L. mejora.
   Don Valentín trabaja en una estación D. radio D. L. ciudad  como locutor, con el ingreso que recibe D. su empleo pagara el crédito, ya que su esposa L. señora Norma se encargara D. los gastos familiares y escolares D. sus dos hijos que tiene con el sueldo D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
The house in which Valentín lives is lacking a wall around it. 
 
He is requesting the loan so that he can buy the materials for it -- blocks, cement, metal bars, and sand -- and he will also pay the person whom he will hire to carry out the work. 

Valentín works in a radio station in the city as an announcer. With the income he receives from his job, he will pay off the loan, since his wife, Norma, will take charge of the family's expenses and the school fees for their two children with the salary she receives for her work.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a resident and farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She has been in farming for three years and employs two farmhands, producing wheat, potatoes, maize and milk and selling to the local market. She runs a boutique shop for additional income.

Regina has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the loan will help her improve her income and help her meet her family's needs. She plans to venture into poultry farming and rent more land to cultivate wheat.

Regina says the high cost of animal feed is the greatest challenge in farming, especially during dry spells.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan male, age 32 years. He is the father of six children whose mother is a housewife. He lives in a semi-permanent house with eight people that he takes care of.

He has operated a retail shop for four years. He acquired his initial capital from selling bananas, which he got from his plantation. 

He needs a loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for resale in the retail shop. He dreams of acquiring land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, realizando este negocio desD. hace 11 años, ella ha logrado cubrir todas sus necesidades D. las ventas que realiza a diario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña, ya que estos son los principales materiales que utiliza para preparar la venta D. tortillas, con esta inversión tendrá una mejor disponibilidad D. materia prima para continuar al frente del negocio.
Su objetivo es mejorar cada día su negocio, ya que D. sus ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar, por lo que espera crecer en sus ventas y aumentar el número D. clientes.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her family and she sells tortillas. She has been in business for 11 years. She has managed to cover all of her needs with the earnings from her daily sales. She requests a loan to purchase corn and firewood. These are the primary products that she uses to make her products for sale. With this investment she will have a better amount of products at her disposal to continue forward with her business. Her objective is to improve her business every day especially because her profits cover the household expenses. She hopes to increase her sales and increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old and married to Penninah. They are blessed with four children, aged seventeen, twelve, nine and seven years. David is a mixed crop farmer and  has been farming for the past seven years. He has a monthly income of KES12,000, which he uses to support his family.
 
David is applying for his third loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, he will venture in to dairy farming. His hopes and dreams are to own a large farm which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is 24 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jecel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Jecel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jecel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Primavera es del Chaco, todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa parte del país. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, con un número de integrantes de 14. Ellas comentan que desean generar mayores ingresos para sus familias, pero además de eso les gustaría seguir creciendo en lo personal. Cuentan que todas trabajan de forma activa, cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de forma responsable.
La señora Dolly se dedica a la venta de perfumes, comenta que hace un buen tiempo que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene una amplia experiencia, además de eso comenta que ya tiene una cantidad de clientes y clientas bien definidas, pues ellos siempre le hacen pedidos de las fragancias que desean. Uno de sus mas anhelados proyectos es tener un local donde pueda vender los perfumes que trae y de esa forma atraer a más clientes y consecuentemente tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, fragancias, tanto para hombres, como para mujeres, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito ñe será de mucha ayuda en su micro empresa.
texts.en:
The Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Business Women's Group], known as Primavera, is in the Chaco and all its members are neighbors and friends from this part of the country. Currently, they're on their fourth group loan with 14 applicants. They tell us that they hope to generate higher incomes for their families, but more so than that they would like to keep up their personal growth. They say that they are all active workers who meet their obligations responsibly. 

Dolly sells perfumes and says that she's been doing this for a while now and so has ample experience. More than that, she says that she already has a lot of customers, some regulars, who frequently make orders for various fragrances of their liking. One of the projects she most looks forward to is having a location where she can sell her perfumes and attract more customers and, consequently, higher revenues. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes and fragrances, for both men and women, so that she can fill the orders she has received. She is very grateful to the Fundación [La Fundación Paraguay; Kiva field partner] for the opportunity this gives her, as this loan will be a great help to her microbusiness.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and fragrances for sale.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 38 year-old married man with four children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family. He has been operating a food store for ten years and he has been able to pay school fees for his children with his proceeds. His major constraint has been seasonal variations that lead to inadequate supplies to meet the demands of customers. Abdallah needs the loan to buy maize, cassava and millet flour for resale

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been in the transportation business for the last four years. He is 30 years old and single. He supports his younger brother in paying for his education.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to add to his savings and buy another pick-up for the transport business.

In the future, he hopes to become a successful businessman in the transportation sector.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy another pick-up for his transport business.

loans.name: Jogoo Group

texts.en:
Furaha is in her late 20s, married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She earns a living running two businesses, a beauty salon and cafe where she has sold food for the last three years. She works from 6 a.m to 11 p.m daily and makes a good monthly profit. Furaha is applying for her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to open the cafe, pay school fees, pay bills and buy more equipment for her salon. She has repaid all of those loans successfully, and plans to use this new one to expand both her beauty salon and her cafe. Her dream is to one day own a large restaurant. 

She will share the loan with members of her group, "Jogo," which has 15 members, all of whom hold each other accountable for paying back the entire sum.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses..

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Sugey sigue laborando en zona franca, como foliadora, trabajo que hace desde hace varios años, la encargada de pegar las etiquetas, enumerar piezas, el cual se esfuerza por hacer mas de un mil piezas, ya que se gana por paquetes. Tambien su esposo labora como mecanico industrial, ahí mismo en zona franca, sus hijos siguen estudiando ya por terminar el año escolar.
Contenta por que ha logrado las mejora a su casa, con los prestamos que la institucion ha dado en tres ciclos de los cuales, ya pudo hacer mas grande los cuarto de los niños para una mejor privacidad y comidad de todos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo podra continuar un muro que tiene comenzado en la parte de atrás, el cual seguira levantando paredes de concreto, hasta terminarlo, y asi asegurar mas su propiedad, y a sus hijos que pasan solos despues que vienen del colegio, el cual dara mas tranquilidad como madre, y mayor sastifaccion el poder lograr la obra atraves de estos financiamiento que vienen ha dar oportunidad para una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Sugey is still working in the tax-free zone as a document processor, a job she has done for several years. She is responsible for putting on stamps and numbering the pieces, and she makes an effort to finish more than a thousand pieces because she is paid per packet. Her husband also works as an industrial mechanic, also in the tax-free zone. Their children study and are about to finish the school year.

Sugey is happy because she has been able to make improvements to her house. With the loans the institution has given her for three loan cycles, she was able to make the children's bedroom larger for better privacy and comfort for everyone.

Now, with this new loan she can continue building a wall that she has started behind the house. She will continue building the concrete wall until she finishes this one to make her property safer, as well as her children who are alone after they come home from school. This will make her calmer as a mother, and she will have greater satisfaction from being able to complete the work with these loans that have given her the chance to have decent housing.

loans.use: to continue construction of a wall which she has already begun, until she finishes it to make her property and her family safer.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Maria quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundación, ya que vio que el mismo les sería de mucha ayuda en el progreso de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico sino también en lo personal.
La sra. Maria está en pareja hace 8 años con el señor Salín quien se dedica a la venta de caramelos,  tienen dos hijos menores de edad. Maria Trabaja en la venta de ropas de todo tipo, trabajo el cual le ayuda mucho para cubrir los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene como meta tener un local propio en  el mercado de Luque donde poder  vender ropas y  así ir mejorando el ingreso de su familia y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá aumentar su variedad y de esa forma atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
It was Sra. Maria who started this group when she invited and organized her friends to become part of the Foundation’s Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. She saw that it would help each of them very much, not only economically but also personally.

Sra. Maria has lived with her partner Sr. Salín for eight years. He sells candy.  They have two young children. Maria sells all types of clothing, a job that brings in much needed money to pay for household expenses. Her goal is to have her own stall in the Luque market one day and sell clothing there. This would bring in more money for the family and pay for basic needs.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Shok

texts.en:
Shok is a 19-year-old bachelorette from Kfar Kanaaa. In June, she opened a centrally located clothing boutique. The boutique serves Kfar Kanaa, Nazareth and the surrounding villages. Shok has focused her stock on the 15 to 45-year-old age group providing up-to-date styles. She has already gained a strong clientele.

Shok needs this loan to purchase additional stock and specialty wear for the holiday season.

Shok wants to continue to expand her store, gain business experience and one day have staff who assist her in creating an exclusive clothing boutique.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock and specialty wear for the holiday season.

loans.name: Sanini

texts.en:
Sanini is 35 years old, married to Neema and they have four children. He has been farming for the last three years, with an income of KES 15,000. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI. He is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy pesticides and seedlings for the farm.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a dairy cow. He desires to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30 year old married man. He has been selling used hardware spare parts for 13 years.
His business is unique and improving these days. That is why he applied for a loan with Kiva partner Al Majmoua--in order to increase his business capital through buying new used spare parts. These products are highly requested by those who deal with electronics maintenance.
Ibrahim is a hardworking man and liked by most of his customers.
He hopes to improve his business in a very organized way and to expand it through opening a big warehouse capable of storing the huge number of stocks he's going to be trading with.

loans.use: To increase his business capital through buying new used spare parts.

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr:
Kadidja est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un tapissier. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Kadidja travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2006. Elle vend seule à ses clients à la maison et au marché. Elle n’a pas de difficulté principale.
Kadidja a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut diversifier la marchandise
Dans les prochaines années, Kadidja voudrait agrandir l’activité Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les besoins en alimentation et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Kadidja is a 35-year-old woman.  She is married to an upholsterer.  She has two children, but only one goes to school.  The oldest is six years old and the youngest is three.  Kadidja has been reselling cereals since 2006.  She works alone and sells to her customers from her house and at the market.  She has no particular difficulty.  This is the first time Kadidja has requested a loan from WAGES, in order to buy cereals.  She would like to diversify her products.  In the coming years, Kadidja would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's nutritional and healthcare needs.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a resident of Malindi and has a poultry farming business which has been in operation for the last year. She started the business from a stock of 100 chicks.

Dorine is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to pay for poultry feed and to purchase more chicks. She looks forward to opening a nursery school in the future. The main challenge she faces is the high cost of feed and transportation. Dorine will use the extra income to restock her retail shop.

loans.use: to pay for poultry feed and to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Nacira

texts.es: Nacira  residente en el corregimiento de Campeche, ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico, es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha apoyado el bienestar de su hogar con sus propios  ingresos provenientes de su trabajo forzado.  Ella tiene 3 hijos, hoy en las edades de 21 a 24 años y vive con su hija, su yerno y sus dos nietos.  Nacira se desempeña en varias actividades entre ellas la venta de mercancías, la elaboración de pasteles y de mochilas.  Las ventas de mercancías y mochilas,  las realiza entre sus vecinos y en algunos corregimientos cercanos, los pasteles los envía a Piojo, otro municipio del Departamento del Atlántico, de donde es oriunda y tiene un gran número de familiares allí residenciados, que forman parte de su clientela.  En su negocio,  Nacira con sus ventas cubre sus gastos operativos y familiares, su hija,  quien le colabora en todas las actividades que realiza, es su mayor apoyo, y a ambas  se les nota el interés por lograr el crecimiento de sus negocios y el desarrollo de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía principalmente, porque tiene muchos pedidos para la navidad y la noche buena y quiere complacer a sus clientes, respondiéndole de manera oportuna, así como ellos se lo merecen. Con el credikiva comprará ropa elegante, calzado, accesorios y regalos navideños, con los que impactará su mercado en una temporada de mayor rotación de dinero y muy comercial y esto hará de la inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Nacira lives in the department division of Campeche, in Atlántico department.   She is a hardworking woman who has supported her family's welfare with her own income coming from her hard work.  She has 3 children, 21-24 and she lives with her daughter, her son-in-law and her two grandchildren.  Nacira has various businesses such as selling merchandise, making cakes and backpacks.  She sells the merchandise and backpacks to her neighbors and in some nearby neighborhoods, and she sends the cakes to Piojo, her native town in Atlántico department where she has many relatives residing and they make up part of her customer base.  The sales cover her operating and family expenses in the business.   Her daughter works with her in all of the businesses and she is her biggest help, and you can see the interest both of them have in the business so that it will grow.  They are also very interested in the development of their family.

 She is applying for her first loan with Kiva, and it will be the first financing that she has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation as well.  She will use it principally to buy merchandise because she has many orders for Christmas and Christmas eve, and she wants to please her customers by reponding in the way they deserve.  She will use the loan to buy dressy clothing, shoes, accessories and Christmas presents which will be important for her business in a season of high activity.

loans.use: to buy dressy clothes, shoes, accessories and Christmas presents

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es:
La  joven Maribel de Jesus de 32 años de edad, labora en docente, su esposo con su trabajo le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ambos son muy responsables, reconocido en el municipio de buen vivir, profesan la religion catolica, son bien abnegados a su trabajo y le gusta compartir con el que lo necesita siempre y cuando tengan.  

Está solicitando su crédito para hecharle la ceramica a su vivienda y repello de la cocina  y asi tener mejores condiciones.  Su sueño es que familia goze de salud, amor y sobre todo que tengan un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maribel de Jesus is a 32 year old young woman.  She works in education.  Her husband works to help her with the household expenses.  Both of them are very responsible and are known in their town for their good living.  They are Catholic, dedicated to their jobs and always like to share with those in need if they can.  

She is requesting loan to install ceramic tile in her home and plaster her kitchen to improve her living conditions.  Her dream is for her family to enjoy good health, love and above all, to have a decent job.

loans.use: to install ceramic tile and plaster her kitchen.

loans.name: Nonvignon 1 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Monique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain Denis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Monique a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Depuis dix ans, Monique vend des tissus, maïs par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Monique vend des glacières et des bassines. Monique achète ses produits au Ghana, Lomé et au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Monique et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, maïs, glacières et bassines.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is 41 years old, married and has four children, all of them are schooling. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from cultivation and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.en:
Sandra was born 59 years ago and her husband died when she was very young and she had to take care her four children, for this reason she passed for a very hard situation and she had to maintain, educate and support her little children, so her uncle when he saw her situation and knowing her niece that she was a very entrepreneur and hard working girl, decided to help her given her a little place where she started selling hanging pots (piñatas in Mexico), bedroom clothes and clothes for children.

Today with 27 years of daily efforts, she produces and makes her owns merchandise with the support of her children, transforming her necessity in a example personal growing and also familiar success.

Sandra is requesting for a loan of USD $ 925 to purchase raw materials and some Christmas merchandise like Christmas images, lights, etc., to offers her clients this season, she promises to repay this loan in a term of 6 to 12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Sandra nació hace 59 años, quedando viuda a muy temprana edad y quedo a cargo de sus cuatro hijos, por ello la necesidad que ella estaba atravesando era inminente en lo que respecta a criar, educar, alimentos y vestido para sus hijos pequeños, sus tíos al verla en esa situación y conociendo a su sobrina que era una persona emprendedora y muy trabajadora, decidieron apoyarla dándole un pequeño local en donde empezó revendiendo piñatas, sábanas, y vestidos de niño.

Hoy tras 27 años de esfuerzo diario, ella produce y fabrica sus propias mercancías con el apoyo de sus hijos, habiendo convertido su necesidad en un ejemplo de superación personal y familiar.

Sandra necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de USD $ 925 para comprar mercancía navideña como imágenes, misterios, luces, adornos, etc., para ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada, además frece pagar el crédito en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and some Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his clothes selling business

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a mother of seven children. The death of her group member after a protracted illness coupled with her poor health and that of her husband is a motivation for her to earn money for medications and the education of their children. Dorothy is a seven-time borrower. With her six previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with fast food, manure, and meat. Her good business earned her the name “grand-soeur” in her community.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to continue in her same previous line of businesses. The quality of services and the location of her businesses are additional advantages for the success of her business.

loans.use: Selling of roasted fish, pig farming, and frying of gateau

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou S., 34, is married and mother of 8 children. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi and can barely support the family, so she is obliged to help him earn a large part of their living expenses. After primary school, she was a servant for two years in a close relative's household. Now she has started a business making palm oil, an undertaking that demands lots of courage, patience, and also capital.

A generous and trustworthy woman, Mrs. S. has already received a first loan which she was able to repay without difficulty. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 so that she can buy palm nuts where they are grown at a lower cost and thus greatly improve her profit margin. This will allow her to meet the financial needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 34 ans, Madame S. Akou est mariée et est mère de huit (08) enfants. Son mari conducteur de taxi moto arrive péniblement à supporter les charges de la famille. Donc, elle est obligée d’en contribuer en grande partie. Niveau primaire, elle fut domestique pendant deux ans chez un proche parent. Et aujourd’hui elle s’est initiée à la préparation de l’huile de palme qui nécessite beaucoup de courage, de patience et de moyens.

Femme généreuse et de bonne foi, elle avait bénéficié d’un premier crédit, qu’elle a remboursé sans difficulté. Encore une fois, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner des noix de palme dans les zones de production à moindre coût afin d’en tirer d’énormes profits. Ainsi elle pourra s’occuper financièrement de sa famille.

loans.use: manufacture and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im R. is a 49-year-old mother of five children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, she and three of her children work in their plot of farmland growing and selling sugar cane plants and cucumber which enables them to generate about $5.80 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a construction worker and the rest of her children attend school. Mrs. Im R. has recently applied for a loan to purchase another plot of land to expand her crop that she expects to make additional profits for her household.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of land to expand her crop that she expects to make additional profits for her household.

loans.name: Telma De Jesus

texts.es:
My name is Telama de Jesús. I sell snack foods (enchiladas, chicken and beef tacos, and fried green plantains). I have had this business for one year, and it is located in the corner of my house. I have a lot of customers, since they my food. I sell from the afternoon until evening. I have 4 children, all of whom are in grade school. With my earnings from the food sales, I help my husband pay for the family expenses. I use the money to buy supplies and achieve good sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Telama de Jesus, yo ne dedico a la venta de golosinas (enchiladas, tacos de carne pollo y res, y tajas de patano fritos) este negocio lo tengo hace un año imedio y esta hubicado en la esquina de mi casa. Tengo bastantes clientes ya que les encanta mis golosinas, mis ventas las hago en la tarde hsta la noche. Tengo 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela. Con las ganancias de las ventas le ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos que tenemos con nuestra familia. El dinero lo ocupo para hacer las comprar y tener buenas ventas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, cooking oil, cooking gas, and meats

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Vorn (age 57) was married in 1967 and has five children, four sons and one daughter. She is currently in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1985 and began her silk production in the same year. Her daughter is also weaving silk with her at home. Vorn has not finished primary school. Her husband, Mr. Ou Kot is a farmer. He grows rice, plants vegetables, and raises cows. He never attends school.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Selepa Elisapeta

texts.en: Selepa is 46 years old and has three children. She is a very hard-working mother who is committed to care for her family, and ensure that her children never go hungry or become beggars. She has applied for a loan to buy farm equipment and fertilizer. She sells her produce at the local town market three days a week with the help of her husband, and together they earn $84 a  day --a very good income in this part of the world. Their income helps to meet their family's needs and pay their children's school fees. If all goes well, Selepa plans to apply for another loan in the future that she will use to repair her house and provide even better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: Buy chemicals and tools for her farm

loans.name: Naureen's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Naureen L.. She is currently in the business of selling timber and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand the business.

Naureen is 30 years old and married. Her husband sells timber. She has 2 children; both go to school. Each week, Naureen makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to begin another business.

Naureen is joined in her small group by Nastar N., Jane N., Rose K., and Irene N.. Nastar N. is currently in the business of tending bar and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to expand her business. Jane N. is currently in the business of tending bar and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to expand her business. Rose K. is currently in the business of carpentry and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to expand her business. Irene N. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 20 years old, and he works and lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Ali works in a bakery and makes what is called in Lebanon "manakish." This is the first time Ali has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy tools for the oven.

loans.use: To buy tools for his baking oven

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha M. R. is 37 years old, and studied up to the fifth grade. She has four children but they solely depend upon her. She lives in the minor central neighborhood Bellavista, in the district of Salpo, province of Otuzco, in the area La Libertad - Peru. Mrs. Martha has renovated a place in her house to place a shop in which she sells items of necessity, sodas, sweets and beer. What's more she offers board to some inhabitants of the area and to the doctors from the local health clinic. In her remaining time she also breeds small animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, etc. Her shop began with few products; with time it has grown. She is a member of the Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (communal bank, "Working Women") from which she obtained her first loan of S/.300.00; with this money she bought everything necessary to start up her shop. With the poan of S/.600.00; the one that will be settled in four months, she will travel to Otuzco to buy a dozen molinos, marmalade, yogurt, tuna, noodles and other products. She is secretary of the cup of milk program, "Maria Parado de Bellido." Her greatest dream is to implement and increase her shop with the sale of clothes and shoes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Pax Bobrow

La señora Martha M. R. tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria. Tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive el centro poblado menor Bellavista en el distrito de Salpo provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Martha ha ambientado un lugar en su casa para colocar una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, golosinas y cerveza, además, brinda pensión a algunos pobladores de la zona y a los doctores del puesto de salud de su localidad. En el tiempo que le sobra se dedica también a la crianza de animales menores tales como: chanchos, carneros, cuyes, etc. Su bodega inicio con pocos productos, con el tiempo ha ido incrementando. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro todo lo necesario para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/.600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses viajará a Otuzco para comprar una docena de molinos, mermelada, yogurt, atún, fideo y otros productos. Es secretaria del programa vaso de leche “Maria Parado de Bellido”. Su mayor sueño es implementar y ampliar su bodega con la venta de ropa y zapatos.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more merchandise for her shop. - Con el prestamo comprara mas mercaderia para su bodega

loans.name: Dulex Antonio

texts.es:
Dulex is a gentleman from the Villanueva municipality in the beautiful city of Chinandega. Currently, he places great effort into his general store, which he operates in his home, and sells all types of products to the customers in his sector. His wife supports him at all times in the sale of these products, and together they have managed to offer their children the well-being they need through their schooling.

The necessity Dulex is facing is the immediate need to invest in the purchase of more products. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to receive the necessary funds to purchase these products. Through this loan, it will be possible for him to purchase his merchandise, and in this way, obtain income to continue maintaining his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Dulex es un caballero del municipio de Villanueva en la hermosa ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de pulpera el que atiende en su casa de habitación vendiendo todo tipo de productos a sus clientes en su sector. Su cónyuge es una dama que en todo momento lo apoya en la venta de los productos y ambos han logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos el bienestar que ellos necesitan por medio de sus estudios.

Hoy en día la necesidad atravesada por el negocio del caballero Dulex es la pronta inversión en los productos. Es por ello que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de estos productos. Por medio de este crédito se permite que él compre su mercadería y de esta manera percibe ingresos para continuar manteniendo a sus hijos y esposa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in his store.

loans.name: Bayim

texts.en: Bayim was born in 1974 and is married with 3 children.  The Israfilov family lives in Khachmaz region. Bayim started a cattle breeding business 5 years ago. Now she reqeusts a loan of $750 to buy a calf.  She promises to repay the loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Ifoma

texts.en:
Ifoma I. is 27 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks. She learned this business from her elder sister in 6 years and she started her own business in 2003.

Ifoma needs a loan of $450 to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small business of selling new and used clothing.

loans.name: Minabadji

texts.en: Minabadji was born in 1954. She lives in Khachmaz region. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is the mother of 5 children. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Junior High Level. Agnes operates a small restaurant where she sells a variety of local dishes like fufu which is made out of cassava and plantains pounded together and others at Kissi station near Elmina; she has been doing this since 2003. Her husband is an environmental health worker.

Agnes uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Agnes will use the loan to purchase more ingredients, spices and food items for the food preparation at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to continue work on an abandonned house she started building for the children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, spices and food items for food preparation

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Van's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people in Boeng Tranh Village in Takeo Province make up this village bank loan group and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Mach V. is the village bank president who has selected by the members. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more silk to weave to meet her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Suong Sokheng, is a construction worker, who can onL. make very little income to meet his famiL.'s expenses. Mrs. Mach V. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is at the age of two.

Mr. Som S. did not come to accept the loan but his wife did and is present in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to weave to reach her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Kwamena

texts.en: Kwamena A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Kwamena sells wood; he buys the raw timber and then cuts them into pieces for sale. He also uses some of the wood in making furniture at Atabatsi junction near Abura, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a trader. Kwamena uses his income to pay for his childrens' school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Kwamena will use the loan to purchase more wood logs for processing and also to buy tools and other implements to enhance the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamena plans to save towards building a house for the family. The machines at the background are the cutting and planing machines he uses.

loans.use: Kwamena will use the loan to purchase more wood logs to process and sell.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is a commercial motorcyclist and sells spare parts for motorcycles. He needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase one motorcycle to enable him to meet the demands of his customers. He is 42 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị M.  năm nay 37  tuổi Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 2 năm. Hiện tại chị là chủ cửa hàng nhỏ chuyên kinh doanh nước uống giải khát tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An với  thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán .
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., aged 37, has been a member of TYM Fund for two years. She currently owns a small cafe shop in Nghi Loc town, Nghe An province, which brings about 2000000 VND per month for the family. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 9000000 VND ($525) to improve the quality of her cafe shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Rosalía es cuzqueña, conviviente, tiene 60 años, 5 hijos mayores, todos están casados.
En el Cuzco su mama vendía anticucho de carne y ella de pequeña cada día le acompañaba, así fue aprendiendo; cuando llego a Lima, se caso y empezó a vender en la puerta de su casa anticuchos, ahora tiene dos ayudantes su sobrina y su nieto, su esposo también trabaja es chofer en una empresa. 
Ella cuida a uno de sus nietos que tiene retardo leve, este tiene que aprender una actividad con las manos, y esta aprendiendo panificación. 
Desde que ella esta en Finca, agradece por que los créditos, que le han ayudado a surgir en su negocio, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se distrae y  tiene amigas.  
Ella necesita 1000 soles, para comprar una maquina  surtidora de chicha, para vender junto con los anticuchos.     
El sueño de Rosalía es modificar su casa, por que esta mal construida, para que sus nietos  que están en un internado puedan vivir con ella.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Miraculous Medal Community Bank. Rosalia is cuzqueña, married, is 60 years old, and has 5 children who are all married. In Cuzco, her mother sold beef kabobs and little Rosalia always accompanied her and that is how she learned. When she came to Lima, she married and started to sell in kabobs out of her home. Now she has two helpers, her niece and grandson. Her husband works as a driver of a company. She takes care of one of her grandchildren who is disabled. She has had to learn to do something with her hands and now she is learning to make bread. She greatly appreciates the loans she has recieved because they have helped her build her business. She likes the community bank meetings because they distract her with friends. She needs 1,000 soles in order to purchase a condiment pump in order to accompany her kabobs. Rosalia's dream is to remodel her poorly built home for her grandchildren so that they could live there with her.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1,000 soles to puchase a condiment pump to accompany her kabobs

loans.name: Safia Begum

texts.en:
Safia Begum baji is a 41-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 15 years. She completed her education up to 5th standard. Her husband's name is S. A. and he is a fruit seller by profession. He has been selling fruit for the past 10 years.

Safia baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son helps his father in his fruit-selling business and her younger son is in 2nd standard. Her daughter is in 5th standard.

Safia baji is a very hard-working lady. She knows her responsibilities. She knows that it's difficult for a single person to meet the family's expenses and for this reason she sews clothes and charges US$ 2 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruit for her husband’s fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy fruit for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Mostapha

texts.en: Mostapha K. is a 26-year-old single man living in Katarmaya, in Mount Lebanon.  He started working with his father at the age of 16 in scrap car parts.  Today, Mostapha owns his own business,  He wants to borrow $1,200 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions like noodles, tomato paste, milk, etc. She started this business in the year 2003. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina N., 54, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the food market business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala.  SPBD loans are Sina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan for business improvement and home repairs.

loans.use: Purchase licence, laundry gears, tinned food, freezers, home repairs.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 44 years old Eliza M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 18 and 23. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan.

Eliza has been running a poultry business since 2005. Eliza keeps and sells chickens, working at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Eliza currently earns about 90 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to increase number of chickens in her project. In the future, she plans to move the business to a new location. Eliza thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase number of chickens in her project

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is a native of Cabgan, Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  She is married with eight children.  All of her children are adults. She is now on her 5th loan cycle amounting to 3,000 pesos.  The purpose of her loan is for the acquisition of a new fishing boat. She is always praying that they can harvest more fish so they can have more sales. This gives them more income so they can support the daily needs of the family and set aside enough savings for the future and for emergencies.

loans.use: To acquire a new fishing boat

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en: Kikelomo sells drinks in retail and in bulk. She purchases directly from the company. The larger the quantity, the more discount one gets. Kikelomo needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks for sale. Kikelomo is 41 years old, married to K. and they have three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more juice & drinks

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris D. sells different kind of cosmetics, ranging from body lotions and creams, in Hohoe central market. Doris has received schooling through junior high. She is a single mother of one child. Doris has been selling cosmetics since 1996. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Excequie

texts.en:
Excequie B. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 47 years old. Excequie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Excequie owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Excequie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Excequie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Excequie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Excequie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Excequie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Ngoeun Paok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of thirteen people is located in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngoeun P. is the village bank president and a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this second loan.

Her husband, Mr. Lun Paing, is a laborer in Rubber Planting Company in Takeo province. Mrs. Ngoeun P. is 47 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in the Rubber Planting Company with their father. The others are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is 35 years old, married and has three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are still in school. He works very hard to provide for his family. Yaw makes a living selling secondhand clothing and textiles. He lives in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana, but travels around to make sales to his customers and buy his supplies in the capital of Accra. He has been in business for four years, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing and textiles

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en: Tươi Thị Đinh, born in 1970, lives in Xom Chợ, Uy Nỗ, Đông Anh, Hà Nội, with her husband and four children. Her husband repairs sewing machines at home, while their eldest child is studying in university. Mrs Tuoi makes and sells Gato cakes and betrothal gifts, and her family has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 vnd. She has participated in SEDA for four years, always repaying loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND (about 375 USD) to invest in her Gato cake shop.

loans.use: To invest in her Gato cake shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and three brothers. He has owned a sawmill shop since 2000 to help his father provide good living conditions for their family. Today, Ali is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase more tools in order to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase more tools.

loans.name: Ta Try Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen from the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT for the very first time to seek a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of Le 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and feeding and clothing them. 

Baromi B. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. She was born in Matotoka Village in northern Sierra Leone, about twenty-seven years ago. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. Baromi sells market food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), salt, pepper, onions, and so on. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Baromi will invest this loan in her business by buying more of the same goods to add to her current stock of goods.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcyle taxi

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta C. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Crisanta is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business making & selling banana cue. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline T. is from the village of Ibung Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Evangeline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paula  Marlene

texts.es: La señora Paola T. tiene 57 años de edad, procreo tres hijos ahora ya mayores de edad, que junto con su esposo han apoyado, su esposo de profesión ingeniero y por gracia a Dios lograron hacer su casa, y ahora doña Paola ha logrado tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada pues compra la paca y viene variedad de ropa bonita, el cual da a precio favorables, cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero propio y con la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para seguir apoyando  a sus hijos en lo que pueda aunque ellos sean independiente están los nietos, el cual espera ayudar a darle una buena educación, ha venido obteniendo mas clientes, es por eso desea comprar mas pacas de ropa donde venga zapatos, colchas, juguetes y ropa para  ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes como captar la atención de nuevos clientes. Contenta por financiamiento que espera poder lograr el objetivo de vender más para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paola T. is 57 years old and has three adult children whom she and her husband supported throughout their youth. Her husband is an engineer, and together they were able to build a house for their family. Now, Paola has her own business selling used clothing, which she buys by the bundle. A variety of nice clothing comes in each bundle, and she sells each item for a fair price. She started the business with her own money, with hopes of generating her own income in order to continue to support her children as best she could. Though her children are now independent, she still wants to help provide her grandchildren with an education. She has been able to grow her client base, bit by bit, and so is looking to buy more bundles of clothing in order to catch the eye of more new clients. She is pleased with the opportunity to take out this loan, and hopes to sell more merchandise so that she can earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes in order to offer customers a wider variety of used clothing

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, el cual los ayuda en los gastos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte hacia la parte de la sierra de nuestra ciudad, servicio el cual le brinda a mineros de la zona, ya tiene amplia experiencia brindando dicho servicio, debido al buen servicio y a lo amplio que es su vehiculo se han ido incrementando sus clientes a los cuales les realiza los viajes semanalmente, Jesús obtuvo su vehiculo a través de créditos, el cual lo pago muy bien, de ahí viene cuidando su unidad la cual le proporciona ingresos que le permite ayudar a sus padres. Jesús requiere el crédito para la compra de llantas y realizarle el mantenimiento
texts.en:
Jesús is 22 years of age, single and lives at the home of his parents, who he helps with expenses. He is dedicated to offering transportation services for the mountainous part of our city, a service which he offers to miners of the area. He already has extensive experience offering said service. Due to his good service and to the large size of his vehicle, he has increased the number of his clients who make the the trips weekly. Jesus obtained his vehicle through loans, which he paid very well. He has taken care of his unit, which provides him income that permits him to help his parents. Jesus requires the loan for the purchase of tires and to carry out the maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia H. is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy 1, Poblacion, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living selling dressed chicken and other frozen products.

Cynthia’s husband Ruel helps her run the business. They have four children who are currently going to school and who also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Cynthia Hisona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by selling dressed chicken and frozen products. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000 from her business activities.

Cynthia Hisona is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her dressed chicken and frozen products business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 11th loan, a loan of Php 19,500, which she intends to use to increase the inventory levels of her dressed chickens and frozen products. Cynthia Hisona is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha M., aged 40, and his wife, Mrs. Thouk Chorn, aged 38, live in a small village along National Road Number Three, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have four children. Their two sons repair motorcycles while their two daughters work in a garment factory. Chantha was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead.
Chantha has been selling cows and oxen since he married. He buys them from other districts for resale to a middleman who comes to buy from him at his house. Mrs. Thouk Chorn stays at home and does housework.
Chantha wants to expand his business in order to generate income to support his family as his business is the main source of family income. Therefore, he is applying for his first loan of $1,000 USD in order to buy additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional cows and oxen for resale

loans.name: Elsa Virginia

texts.es:
Elsa Virginia J. M., tiene la edad de 34 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos que es son mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen7 y 5 años de edad.El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos para granja, la idea es criar los pollos para luego venderlos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Elsa Virginia desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elsa Virginia J. M. is 34, married and has two children, 5 and 7 and they are her main priority in life. The loan that she would like is to buy chickens to raise. Her idea is to raise the chickens and then sell them, and thus receive the biggest profit when they are sold. This is the first time that she has a loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very satisfied with the terms that she is being offered. Elsa Virginia wants this business to help give some economic support to her home. In the future she would like to offer her family a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Assuate Trinta

texts.pt:
Assuate Trinta Namuetho nasceu na Província de Nampula, norte de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade viúvo e pai de 2 filhos de 15 e 8 anos de idade e todos vão a escola. Fez nível médio, parou quando entrou no serviço militar Obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Nampula para Boane em 1985 cumprindo o serviço militar, mais tarde preferiu integrar se no ministério do interior como agente da policia. Conta cerca de 18 anos a trabalhar neste ministério como adjunto superintendente, onde tem um salário de 14.755.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve um empréstimo no Banco Millenium Bim, mas decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu primo que já é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes e outros) para reabilitar a sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais crédito para aumentar na aquisição de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Assuate Trinta Namuetho was born in the province of Nampula, north of Mozambique. He is 42 years old, a widower, and has 2 children, 15 and 8 years old, who attend school. He finished some school, but stopped when he had to complete his obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his children, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. He left Nampula for Boane in 1985 to complete his military service, and later joined the Ministry of the Interior as a police officer. He's been working for the ministry about 18 years as an adjunct superintendent, and earns 14,755 meticals a month. He uses his salary to cover household expenses and is able to save some in a savings account. He received a loan from the Banco Millenium Bim, but decided not to continue there. He learned about Hluvuku from his cousin, who is already a client. This is his first loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, joists, etc.) to refurbish his home. He is committed to paying his loan on time in order to be eligible for others in the future. He would like to request additional loans so he can purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Tusa Kimu Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Nulu S. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children aged 32 to 15 years, and also takes care of two orphans.

Nulu has been a poultry farmer in Buloba for twenty-four years, making sufficient profits to help support her family and pay school fees for her children. Her trustworthiness has won her many customers who buy both broilers and eggs from her home.

Nulu would like to expand her farm to enable her to continue paying school fees for her children and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more feed and chicks for her business expansion. A very hardworking and friendly lady is what best describes Nulu.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed for business expansion

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. Tiene 45 años por lo que su actividad económica es brindar sus servicios en una tenería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfredo inicio este negocio por cuenta propia pues siempre puso mucho empeño y sacrificio ya que este trabajo no es fácil y los diferentes procesos que realiza todos los días, pero este medio de trabajo es el que lo ayuda a salir adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar cromo, sulfato de sodio, cloruro sódico entre otros productos. El desea tener su propio negocio, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo Antonio is a hardworking man who has shown himself to be an excellent client. He is 45 years old and his economic activity is providing services in a tannery. He has been working in this business for more than 15 years. Alfredo started in this line of work on his own, and he always puts a lot of effort and sacrifice into his work. This type of work is not easy, as there are many different processes that he carries out each day, but this type of work is what helps him to get ahead. The loan is for working capital to buy chromium, sodium sulfate, sodium chloride and other products. He wishes to have his own business, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jeremias Pedro

texts.pt:
Jeremias Pedro B. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 20, 17, 15, 09 e 06 anos de idade, destes os 4 mais novos vão a escola. Fez 7ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Boane após sua desmobilização no serviço militar em 1987, e vinha a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Trabalha na empresa de segurança ha mais de 11 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.817.00mt e 5.000.00mt por mês do seu rendimento do negócio, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (pintos, ração e vitaminas) para fortificar a seu negócio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com o seu negócio e adquirir uma viatura para ajudar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jeremias Pedro B. was born in Manjacaze District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married and the father of 5 children, ages 20,17, 15, 9 and 6. The four youngest children go to school. Jeremias finished seventh grade but did not continue because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone other than his children. He left Manjacaze to go to Boane after his discharge from the military in 1987, and he came in search of a job and better living conditions. For more than eleven years he has worked for a security company. He has no employees and earns a salary of 4,817 meticais, plus another 5,000 meticais per month from his own business. He uses this money for household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank account. Jeremias has never had loans from other banks.
