He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais, which he will use to buy chicks, feed and vitamins to improve his business. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to continue with his business and to buy a vehicle to help with his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chicken raising (chicks, feed and vitamins)

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yadira es madre de dos hijos, de edad de 46 años, es una mujer emprendedora, su esposo se dedica a la construcción. Su negocio es la venta de comida por pedidos en un centro comercial Managua, pues ante trabajaba ala dueña del comedor, pero cerro y la línea de cliente me quedo a mí, lo que fue para ella un buen comienzo en la inversión. Ya que sus dos hijos están estudiando y son muchos gastos. 
con este préstamo va a construir otro cuarto al fondo del patio anexado al que hizo con el préstamo anterior comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar,  de gran ayuda no gasta en mano de obra ya que es su mismo esposo es quien construye y se ahorra mucho dinero. Entre sus planes es seguir mejorando el menú cada día para lograr la captación de mas clientes.
texts.en:
Yadira is a mother of two children. She is 46 years old. She is an enterprising woman. Her husband works in construction. Her business is selling food to order in a mall in Managua. Before she worked for the owner of the dining hall, but it closed and the customers stayed with her, which was a good beginning for her investment. Her two children are in school and there are a lot of expenses. With this loan, she is going to build a room in the back next to the patio, attached to the one she built with the previous loan. She will buy: stones, sand, cement, and metal rods to start. A big help is that she doesn't spend on labor since her own husband does the building and that saves a lot of money. Among her plans is to keep improving the menu every day to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: stones, sand, cement, and metal rods. She will begin to build a room.

loans.name: Maria Bellaluz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Bellaluz M. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que esta en muy mal estado y quiere repararlo antes de que se llegue la temporada de lluvias.
Porque tiene tres hijos pequeños y no quiere que se le enfermen. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo de limpieza de una casa en la vecina ciudad. 
Ya que su esposo el señor Fernando Martinez se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el sueldo que recibe como policía escolar de la ciudad
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Fernando Martinez esposo del señora Maria Bellaluz.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Bellaluz M. has already taken four previous loans with FVP, all of which were repaid on time. She is requesting a loan to weatherproof the roof of her house because it is in bad condition and needs to be repaired before the rainy season arrives. Maria has three small children and does not want them get sick. She plans to repay the loan using the income she earns cleaning houses in the neighboring city. Her husband, Sr. Fernando Martinez, takes care of the family expenses with the salary he receives working for the city as a school police officer.

The person who appears in the photo is Sr. Fernando Martinez, the husband of Sra. Maria Bellaluz.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S., 43, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Cerilo S., a janitor, they are blessed with two children. By managing her own variety store while maintaining a clothing store for the past few years, Susana makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

A regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, Susana regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the continued success of her businesses, Susana is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan to buy products to replenish her inventories in both stores. She dreams that her enterprises will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also hopes to have her own house and lot through all of her hard work.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products to replenish the inventories in both stores

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S.  is currently in the business of selling first class dresses, trousers, and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to import more bedsheets from Khartoum to sell in Juba.  Aida is 31 years old and is married; her husband is a head teacher. She has two children who both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Import more bedsheets from Khartoum to sell in Juba

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana tiene 29 años de edad, Reside en San Miguel, vive Junto al esposo (Mardoqueo) y sus dos hijos Francisco y Cándida de 10y 12 respectivos, los cuales estudian, Ana vende y cultiva granos básicos (maíz).
Ella junto con el esposo cultivan Maíz  hace 10 años, luego la cosecha la almacenan para todo el año y lo comercializan con los vecinos y personas cercanas a la zona. Ana solicita un préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas como son abono y fertilizantes, para el cultivo de maíz, esto le permitirá  fertilizar el cultivo para obtener una buena cosecha.
Los objetivos son cumplir con las obligaciones del préstamo para seguir trabajando, aumentar el área de terreno cultivado, para aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio, así contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel with her husband and their two children Francisco, 10, and Cándida, 12. The children are in school and Ana works cultivating and selling corn. Ana and her husband have been growing corn for ten years. They store their harvest and sell it over the whole year to their neighbors and those who live nearby. Ana is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure and fertilizers, for growing corn. This will enable her to fertilize her crops and obtain a better yield. Ana’s goals are to fulfill her loan obligations and continue working. She would like to increase the area under cultivation to improve the profitability of the business and contribute to bettering the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden D. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Eden is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eden owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products and fruit. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina B. is a 65-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buying and selling dried fish and a general store business. She lives in Brgy. Malbago, Madredijos, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dried fish and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Catalina is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Catalina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda S. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Emelda is married and has two school-aged children. Emelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cell phone electronic loads for different networks in the local community. Emelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Emelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to invest in renovating the business.

Emelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional electronic loads to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro R. is from the town of Banga. He is 53 years old. Alejandro is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandro raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alejandro works hard to support his family financially.

Alejandro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and to pay for the rental of farming equipment. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and to rent farm equipment

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
"Gilda A. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Maligaya, Brgy. Magara, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:   buying & selling "pawid" made of nipa,  buying & selling fish and a general store businesses.  Her husband Ferdinand A., who is 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are 3 to 20 years old. 

Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children and fulfill her plans of buying a photocopying machine. 

Gilda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar has been a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for a few years and lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Margarita, they have two children. 
He’s in the business of buying and selling grains like corn and beans; he has built a good customer base that is distributed around the city. He is an honest and entrepreneurial person with excellent work ethics. 
As a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, Cesar has no late payments; in addition, he has excellent commercial references. 
He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunities he’s had and looks forward to keep on growing his business.
texts.en:
Cesar has been a client of Fundacion Paraguaya for a few years and lives in Ciudad del Este with his wife Margarita, they have two children. 
He’s in the business of buying and selling grains like corn and beans; he has built a good customer base that is distributed around the city. He is an honest and entrepreneurial person with excellent work ethics. 
As a client of Fundacion Paraguaya, Cesar has no late payments; in addition, he has excellent commercial references. 
He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunities he’s had and looks forward to keep on growing his business.

loans.use: Corn, beans and other grains

loans.name: Muñequitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama “Muñequitas”,  se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, está conformado por 12 integrantes.En el grupo se encuentra la Sra. María Judith J.,   de 48 años de edad. La clienta tiene una papelería desde 1 año; nos platica que antes de abrir su negocio trabajaba en una biblioteca; ella sólo estudió la secundaria pero eso no le ha impedido cumplir el sueño de cualquier madre, el poder brindarle o sus hijos la  oportunidad de salir adelante, su máxima ilusión es que su hijo tenga una carrera universitaria, ya que en la localidad donde viven es común que los jóvenes se dediquen a las labores mineras, a la elaboración de tabique o al campo. Con el crédito que la institución le ha otorgado va a surtir su papelería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en: This group is called “Muñequitas” ["Little Dolls"] and is located in the state of Mexico.  The group has 12 members, including Ms. María Judith J., who is 48 years old.  She has run a paper goods store for one year. She explains that before opening her business, she worked in a library.  María only studied through secondary school, but this has not prevented her from achieving her dream of being a mother with the ability to offer her children the opportunity to get ahead.  Her greatest dream is that her son will get a university education, as in the area where they live, it is common that young people become miners, brick makers, or work in the fields.  With the loan offered to her by CrediComun and Kiva, she is going to stock her paper store so she can increase her earnings and therefore strengthen her business.

loans.use: to stock her paper goods store

loans.name: Alicia De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Alicia de Jesus M. tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el barrio los Jasminez de la comunidad de Trojes El Paraiso. Alicia se dedica a la fabricacion de dulces, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. tiene muchos clientes que le compran su producto. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dulce de rapadura, este dulce se pone escaso y cuesta comprar y a veces se pone mas caro de lo normal por eso es que desea tener guardado para no quedarse sin materia prima.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs Alicia de Jesus M. is 61 years old.  She lives in the Los Jasminez neighborhood in the community of Trojes El Paraíso.  Alicia makes sweets.  She has been in this business for several years and has many customers who buy her products.  She will use her loan to buy 'dulce de rapadura' (a sweet product made from sugar cane juice).  This product is becoming scarce and costs a lot to buy.  Sometimes it is more expensive than normal which is why she would like to have some put to one side so that she doesn't end up without raw material.

The profits from Alicia's business are needed to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To buy 'dulce de rapadura'

loans.name: Fermin Edilman

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a dos hijos menores de edad en la localidad de La Clake, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos del distrito de Reque, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un par de bueyes con los que suele ofrecer servicio de yunta a los agricultores de la zona. El es bastante conocido entre los agricultores del lugar y de zonas aledañas. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el solventa la economía de su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Fermín desea incursionar en el negocio de venta de leche, por lo que desea adquirir una vaca la cual pienza utilizar para este fin, por ello ha querido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. 

El es bastante conocido en la zona por su honradez y carácter servicial. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fermín is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two small children in La Clake, a rural area located a few minutes from Reque, located twenty minutes from Chiclayo city.

He has a pair of oxen with which he offers plowing services to farmers in the area. He is rather well-known among the famers in the area and in neighboring villages. In addition, he owns a small store located in his home. With the income he receives from these activities he supports is family economically and tries to help them get ahead.

Fermín wishes to have a business selling milk, so he wants to buy a cow in order to accomplish this goal. He has asked Edpyme Alternative for a 2000 nuevos soles loan.

He is well-known in the area for his honor and character for services. His greatest goal is to continue growing as a businessman to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Buy a cow in order to have a business selling milk

loans.name: Ileana Jeanneth

texts.es: Ileana Jeanneth tiene 26 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que inicio con este medio de vida con la ayuda de su Mama que le enviaba dinero para que ella pudiera comprar la variedad de productos que ofrecía sido muy importante para ella en ofrecer a sus clientes lo que siempre le han solicitado. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, adornos, toallas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Ileana Jeanneth is 26 years old. This young woman has a general store. It has been more than 2 years since she started her business. In the beginning her mother used to send her money in order to purchase a variety of products to resell. It has been very important for her have the items that her clients what they request. The loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, decorations, and towels, among other items.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Macario Dario

texts.es:
Macario Dario S. P. tiene 25 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Macario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar unos terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas del 12 de Octubre en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Macario Dario S. P. is 25 and he lives with his common-law wife and son in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.

The members of the V.R.C. La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde communal bank (Hope is Never Lost) are from the community or Recinto el Placer, about 2 hours from the office in Chillanes.  Most of the members of this group work in agriculture.

Macario is a farmer and plants corn and beans.  He buys and sells in the Sunday market in Chillanes canton.

He is requesting a loan for buy seed, fertilizer, and compost and the loan will help him financially to supply what he needs.  He has to deal with infestations and disease and fluctuations in the weather.  His dream is to buy some fields to continue planting.

He likes to celebrate the fiesta on October 12th is his community.

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: Alfredo Javier

texts.es:
Alfredo Javier M. Z. tiene 40 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Alfredo Javier se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz cacao, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos estudien.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte.
texts.en:
Alfredo Javier M. Z. is 40, married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 3 children.
The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra ["Our Land"] are located in the San Luis de Zapotal region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice.
Alfredo Javier works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, soy and rice. He purchases his products in Ecua-Agro and sells them in the same location.
He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and rice, and for buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to improve his home and for his children to study.
He enjoys playing a lot of sports.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage, et d’amitiés. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, des poissons fumés, du lait, des habillements, des articles divers de boutique et sont                                                                                                                                                      à leur neuvième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments alimentaires, des poissons fumés, du lait, des habillements et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                           DOUNAMBA C. compte acheter 40kg de poissons fumés avec les grossistes. Elle effectue quotidiennement ses ventes sur place à domicile et au marché de Marka-Coungo, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouman group, all married, are 43 years old on average with 3 children and live in traditional extended households in the town of Marka-Coungo in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through familial, neighbourhood, and social relations. They sell food condiments, smoked fish, milk, clothing, and various store items, and are on their ninth solidarity (group) loan, which will be used to buy these items.
Dounamba C., one of the group members, intends to buy 40 kg of smoked fish from wholesalers. She makes her sales every day at her home and at the market in Marka-Coungo, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.
She foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA, some of which will be used to pay the loan costs and to take care of the family's health, food, and schooling costs, with the remainder being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel S. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. He is 27 years old. Joel is married and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 42000 PHP when he harvest his raised crops.

In 2008, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Joel is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to sell to her customers

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He's been farming for four years. He is involved in the business of producing milk, which he sells to a local dairy collection center. He is 33 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 7 years, both of whom attend school.

He has requested a loan of 78,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to supply milk to the local market. He says that his major challenge has been poor road network in the area which increases the cost of maintaining a motorcycle. He says that if capital will be available in the future, he would like to venture into milk processing business e.g yogurt, cheese and butter.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Edwin Oscar

texts.es: El sr. Edwin, vive la zona del cementerio, vive en casa de un familiar trabaja en la  línea de  minibuses de sacaba  trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia a compartir con ellos eso es lo que mas le gusta al Sr. Edwin compartir con su familia, el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción del  domicilio ya que su familia vive hace varios años en esa casa , tiene dos hijos en colegio uno de ellos este año sale bachiller muy orgulloso de sus hijos, su esposa vende  api con pasteles en las noches frente al templo de la zona, su sueño de don Edwin  es juntar dinero para la compra de un terreno y así tener su propia casa y brindar mejor comodidad a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Edwin lives in the cemetery zone.  He lives with relatives and works in the minibus line.  He works Monday through Saturday and on Sundays he spends time with his family, his favorite thing to do.  He will use the loan for home renovations since he has lived with his family for several years in this house.  He has two children that are attending school and one of them will graduate high school this year.   He is very proud of his children.  His wife sells api [a beverage made from corn] with pastries at night in front of the church in their area.  His dream is to put together enough money to buy a piece of land and to have his own house to make his family more comfortable.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person and is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home renovations.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros D. is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Milagros has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Milagros is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP from  NWTF, which she will use to buy seasonings such as onions, garlic, etc. to sell.  Milagros has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonings such as onions and garlic to sell

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is 43 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Chona runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Ma. Chona has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina V. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Magdalina is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Magdalina owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Magdalina has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Magdalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 36, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband she is raising three daughters, all of whom study at school. In order to meet their needs, the family breeds cattle. They make additional money by selling dairy products. In this way Damira earns 5,500 soms per month. With the profits from her loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding; a part of the loan will also be used to pay for her daughter’s graduation party. In the near future Damira plans to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and pay for her daughter's graduation party.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Una mujer D. amplia trayectoria es Albina, D. 63 años, que disfruta D. la compañía D. su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 50 años se dedica a los bordados D. trajes típicos D. su región, su amplia experiencia en el arte es gracias a la enseñanza D. su madre, del mismo modo también le enseño a cultivar la tierra y el cuidado D. los animales. Es así que día a día trabaja sola en su misma casa, pero hay momentos que necesita contratar la mano D. obra D. personas que la ayudan en  su producción, ya que su taller D. bordaduría es conocida por su zona y tiene prestigio y eso la favorece para tener siempre clientela fija. Considera que su trabajo es rentable ya que sus clientes están dispuestos a pagar el precio, porque lo consideran justo por la calidad y acabado que entrega. Adicionalmente a esto también se dedica a la agricultura y cada 6 meses regresa a sus campos para cosechar. Manifiesta que siempre estará dedicada a su trabajo, es por esta razón que se ha propuesto aumentar la producción D. tejidos, pues tiene más pedidos D. bordados y desea cumplirlos a tiempo. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y bajo la modalidad D. créditos grupales a través D. su banco comunal, le agrada reunirse con su grupo y compartir experiencias, por tanto considera que es equipo sólido que trabaja con unidad. Con ese mismo empeño ha decidido que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. más materiales para sus bordados como hilos D. diversos colores y tela.
texts.en: Albina is a woman with a significant background in her activity. She is 63 years old and lives happily with her husband in her own house. For more than 50 years she has been engaging in embroidery, trimming the typical dresses of her region: she owes the wiD. experience she has in this art to her mother, who also taught her how to till the land and to breed animals. Thus she works alone day by day in her own house, but there are times when she needs to pay for workhands to help her in her production: her embroidery workshop is renowned and considered prestigious in her area, something that favors her by granting her recurring customers. She thinks her job is profitable because her customers are willing to pay what she asks, considering it to be fair seeing the quality and finish she offers. On top of this she also engages in agriculture, and every 6 months she returns to her lands to harvest. She says she will always engage in her job, and for this reason she has put her mind to increasing the knitting production, as she has more embroidery requests and wants to satisfy them on time. This is her thirds loan with MFP through the group loans of her communal bank. She likes meeting up with her group and share experiences, and for this reason she believes her team to be sound and to be working in unity. Showing the same determination, she has decided she will invest the loan in the purchase of more materials for her embroidery, such as fabric and threads in different colors.

loans.use: To buy fabric and threads in different colors.

loans.name: 1 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thuý is 42 years old and is married with three children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Thuý has operated a food stall where she sells vegetables. One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

Thuý is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell and to invest in her business. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With the profit from her loan, Thuý hopes that her business will do well, her children will have a good life, and she will be able to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Santos Delfina

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su familia, su esposo y tres hijos D. 14, 12 y 10 años D. edad, ella se dedica a atender un negocio en su casa donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, trabaja junto a su esposo y sus hijos atendiendo a los clientes desD. las 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente necesita invertir en su negocio, surtiéndolo D. mercadería como arroz, azúcar, condimentos, boquitas y bebidas, para realizar dicha inversión solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto y contribuya a crecer en el comercio.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, manteniendo D. todo lo necesario para los clientes, ya que al satisfacerles sus demandas lograra una mayor afluencia y mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her family, her husband and their three children, aged 14, 12, and 10. She manages a business from her house, offering essential products. She works together with her husband and children in attending their clients, from 7am to 6pm.

She needs to invest in her business by supplying it with products, such as rice, sugar, condiments, snacks, and drinks. In order to make such an investment she requests a loan. It will cover the expenses and it will contribute to the business' growth.

Her objective s to increase her business, adding anything their clients need. Satisfying their demands will increase their affluence and their sales.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, condiments, snacks, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Las Palomas está conformado por Juana, Tomasa, Leseyda, Oscar Danilo, Adán Emilio, Blanca, Emiliana, Marcia, Maria y Sonia. Sonia es la coordinadora del banco se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 1 año que tiene este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan gran variedad de productos. Sale todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, ha sido una mujer muy luchadora a sus 23 años le ha proporcionado a su familia el alimento diario. El crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, perfumes, pintura de uñas, cremas, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en: The community bank "Las Palomas" (The Doves) is made up of Juana, Tomasa, Leseyda, Oscar Danilo, Adán Emilio, Blanca, Emiliana, Marcia, Maria and Sonia. Sonia is the coordinator of the bank. She has run a business selling cosmetics for over a year. Most of her customers request a great variety of products, so she works every day from 8am to 7pm. At 23 she is a born fighter, putting food on the table for her family on a daily basis. This loan is to purchase lipsticks, powder, perfume, nail polish, creams and treatments.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, powder, perfume, nail polish, creams and treatments

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is a single mother of four children aged between twenty-two years old and three years old whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. She runs a restaurant in a residential area in Kitengela. She has been in this business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the challenge she has is financial constraints. 

Josephine is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy food items and renovate the business premises to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big hotel where she will be making an income of Kes 90,000 per month. She describes herself as visionary.

loans.use: to buy food items and pay for renovations.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronildo, who is a farmer, and the mother of two children, both of whom are in high school. Together with her husband, Marilyn manages her household. She also operates an ornamental plant business and works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. Marilyn grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and she also grows a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors, and nearby community members.  Marilyn earns a minimum of 300 PHP daily.

Marilyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs to help continue operating her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Marilyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden inputs

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés tiene 55 años su negocio es una pulpería. Lo inicio con ahorros propios, está ubicado en si vivienda en donde llegan la mayoría de sus clientes amigos, vecinos y familiares, en donde ofrece granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, pan, detergente, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénicos, cerrillos y cigarrillos. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de    productos para su negocio. Sueña con realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Ines is 55 years old and she has a grocery store business. She started out with her own savings and she has her business installed in her house. The majority of her clients are friends, neighbors, and family members. She is able to offer them basic grains, sweets, juices, breads, detergents, soups, canned goods, bathroom tissue, matches, and cigarettes. She requests a loan to purchase products for her store. Her dream is to carry out home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, juices, bread, detergents, soups, canned goods, bathroom tissue, matches, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José se dedica a la venta de refrescos y frijoles cosidos. Tiene más de 3 años con su negocio, por lo que disfruta de tener un ingreso diario. Su negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a los ingresos del hogar. Es una persona muy tranquila y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para poder sobrevivir. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, bolsas, frutas, azúcar, hielo entre otros productos necesarios. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día de una manera muy humilde y luchadora.
texts.en:
Maria José sells soft drinks and cooked beans. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, and she enjoys having a daily income. She started her business with the aim of helping with household expenses. She is a very calm person and enjoys having this way of life in order to survive.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy beans, bags, fruit, sugar, and ice among other things she needs. In the way of a humble warrior she dreams of increasing her daily income.

loans.use: to buy beans, bags, fruit, sugar, and ice among other things

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 31-year-old man who is married and has three sons and two daughters. He lives in Biet Lahia, which is located in the Gaza Strip, in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.

Mosa wants to replace his old home furniture with new furniture such as beds for his children and seating for the living room in order to provide better living conditions for his family. He does not have enough money to pay for the furniture, so he needs to take out a loan from FATEN. When he gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the new furniture. Mosa was photographed at the FATEN branch.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see requested includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.  He was able to increase his income with increased milk production. He has also used his savings in Faulu Kenya to boost his business.  
He was able to improve his standard of living. Now, he hopes to improve his retail shop business. Hence, he has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to add a stock of soap, sugar, salt and rice in his shop.

loans.use: to add a stock of soap, sugar, salt, and rice for his retail shop

loans.name: Doi

texts.en:
Doi is a 57-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Since 2009, Doi has supported his family by running a general store in front of his house. He sells a large range of products from household items to personal use products. 

He would like a loan to buy new products, such as many kinds of cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in his store, to better meet his customers' needs. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new products, such as cakes, green tea, milk and beverages to sell in his store.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet tiene 26 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive en compañía de William, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Usibamba, el trabajo continuo es su lema. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano prepara los alimentos que venderá en la escuela de su localidad. Donde hace 2 años abrió un pequeño negocio, en el cual vende golosinas, bebidas y comida casera a los alumnos y profesores que cada refrigerio visitan a Yanet. Cuenta que, fue difícil para ella, obtener el permiso para vender dentro de la institución, “pero nada es difícil si eres constante”, afirma. Al mismo tiempo y como mujer del campo; se dedica a la siembra de avena en terrenos de su comunidad, donde todos los fines de semana cuidan y fertiliza los campos para que den buena cosecha; que después venderá en la feria que se realiza, los días viernes en la ciudad de Chupaca. Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.  Yanet de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de golosinas para su negocio, además de semilla de avena para comenzar su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Yanet is 26 and a hard working woman. She lives with her husband of 10 years, William. They have three children, Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos. They care for their family in their own home, located in the Usibamba locality. 

“Constant work,” is their motto. Beginning very early every morning, she prepares food that she will sell at the nearby school. Two years ago she opened a small business selling candy, drinks, and homemade food to the students and teachers that visit Yanet every snack time. She says that it was hard for her to get permission to sell inside the school, but nothing is difficult if you are persistent, she adds. At the same time and as a woman of the countryside, she plants oats in the land by her community. Every weekend they care for and fertilize the field so that they have a good harvest. Afterwards, she will sell in the market that takes place on Fridays in the city of Chupaca. 

Now she wishes to work more diligently to improve her income. She belongs to the solidarity group “Usibamba,” and this is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to gain the support of all you to accomplish her goals. She commits to being punctual in her loan payments. With your support, Yanet will invest the money requested in the purchase of sweets for her business, in addition to oatmeal seeds to begin planning the field.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her sweets store and to purchase oat seeds.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is widowed with five children. She is 61 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. Delia is a dressmaker and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase assorted fabric for her dressmaking business. Delia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  Delia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is the mother of a 2 year-old daughter. Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes, while she supports him by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She loves doing sewing work and has learned this art from her mother. Due to the good quality of her work, she receives a good number of orders every month.
She is very supportive in nature and has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for the further improvement of her husband’s shoe-making business because he has a large order to fulfill.
With the loan investment, he will purchase shoe laces, leather and other raw materials in larger quantity.  That will allow him to complete the larger orders on time and earn him more profits.
He is very experienced and has been operating the business for the past many years. Robina is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his profits.
Robina is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as shoe laces, leather for shoe making business

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона уже четыре года занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. У нее имеются условия для разведения скота. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж занимается растениеводством. У них четверо детей. Мастона берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Mastona has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  She breeds cattle at home.  Mastona has the right conditions for breeding livestock.  She is 35 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in agriculture.  Mastona is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alisahab

texts.en: Alisahab's business is preparing products from iron. He is 56 years old and lives with his family. In the future, he plans to open another production shop to expand his business. He wants to obtain this loan to make repairs at home. Because of the bad condition of his house, it is cold in the winter. He hopes you will help him with his needs.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old, married to George. They have one child.

She has been in the plastic container selling business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of kes 10,000.  She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She plans to use the funds to buy more plastic items for sale.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items for sale.

loans.name: Bladimiro

texts.es:
Bladimiro nació en la ciudad de Sicuani de la provincia del Canchis del departamento del Cusco y tiene 25 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la tiene dos hijos.  Actualmente, Bladimiro vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas.    
 
Bladimiro se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien.  Bladimiro requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro y para comprar algunos cuyes. 

Bladimiro es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Bladimiro was born in the city of Sicuani, in the province of Canchis, department of Cusco. He is 25 years old. He has a common-law wife with whom he has two children. Currently, Bladimiro lives in the historic city of Cusco, where he pursues his economic activities. 
 
Bladimiro's work is providing taxi services, and he also raises small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. He has raised small animals for several years, and it is going very well for him. Bladimiro needs the loan to carry out maintenance on his car and to buy some guinea pigs.

Bladimiro is a member of the “Pillao” communal bank. The group is made up of 13 members who live in the province of Cusco, in the district of San Jerónimo.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his car and to buy some guinea pigs.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa operates a grocery shop in Mbem near Abura. She is married and has 2 children. Yaa has been operating her shop for 3 years. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children and paying for their school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a  rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

She operates a beauty salon from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy braids, cosmetics and hair oils. 

Her major business challenge is electricity and defaulters. Her aspiration is to build a house and also own a fully stocked salon.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of weaves, braids and hair oils

loans.name: Ndiamboufall Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée depuis le 21 septembre 2012 et regroupe 20 membres très solidaires et dynamiques avec comme activités principales le commerce et l'agriculture. 
Absatou la responsable du groupe est mariée, âgée de 30 ans.Elle fait le petit commerce d'arachide et d'huile de palme et la culture de mil, de maïs. Elle a une expérience d'environ 10 ans dans ce domaine et ses activités s'articulent autour du marché de son village.Elle est debout à droite habillée en marron et a levé haut la main gauche.
Elle compte acheter deux fûts d’arachides de 28500 francs l'un et de l'huile de palme pour une valeur de 20000 francs.
Elle connait bien la vente d'huile de palme et d'arachide et les gens du village sont très intéressées par ses produits.
Avec ses bénéfices elle compte épargner pour atteindre une autonomie et recycler le reste pour maximiser ses profits.
texts.en:
The group was created on 21 September 2012 and is composed of 20 members, who are close with each other and dynamic. Their main activities include commerce and agriculture. 

Absatou, the leader of the group, is married and 30 years old. She sells palm oil and grows millet, corn, and groundnuts. She has an experience of about ten years in this area and her business is conducted mostly in the village market. 

She hopes to buy two containers of groundnuts for 28,500 francs each. She is a good seller of groundnuts and the people of the village are very interested in her products. 

With her earnings, Absatou hopes to save in order to be able to support herself and will use the rest to maximize her profits.

loans.use: Achat d'huile de palme et achat d'arachides

loans.name: Hussien's Group

texts.en:
Hussien is a member of this group from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has one child.His family depends on his income for their living. Hussien started this business four years ago with little money and few polls that he rent for construction. As his family expenses increased, so did the responsibility and burden to increase his income. 
He is requesting this youth loan to purchase supporting polls and renovate his workplace, so he would be able to compete and attract more customers and meet their needs. With this loan he is confident that he will increase his income and support his family's needs. 
The story of Hussien and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .

loans.use: A portion of Hussien's Group $ 3,000 loan is to purchase ceiling wooden supporting polls and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tiway wants to buy 3 the  cowshed

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin is a resident of Spitamen, a small village type town near Khujand. Before August 2003, Erkin was engaged in trade of essential commodities in the Spitamen Food market, had a small assortment, and his actives were insignificant. He has a wife and two daughters. The food market was far away from the street where he lives and he always thought that it would be good idea to open a shop in his own neighborhood. He invested all his profit into this idea. At the beginning Erkin’s shop consisted only of one table, where all his goods were placed. His shop is known for low prices and always-fresh goods. He constantly worked on expansion of his assortment and the quality of the sold goods. He brings the goods from the big market in the city. Now he wants to build additional shelves in his shop and will use his loan for that. He wants to achieve a day when buyers can find all necessary things in his shop.

loans.use: Retail trade of essential commodities

loans.name: Daysi Carolina

texts.en:
I have had a small shop selling cosmetics and beauty products for three years. At this time I need to purchase supplies to meet current demand. With the money I make I am able to help my family.

Tranlated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de "Cosmeticos" desde hace 3 años lo tengo. ahora necesito comprar mercaderia ya que mis clientas me estan solicitando mas productos para estos meses. Con los ingresos de estos productos ayudo a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Ms Graciela is 42 years old and married. She lives with her 39-year-old husband who works at an agency called Paraguay Turismo, both contributing to the family's income. They have two children, one 8 years old and the other 12, who attend a public elementary school in the city.

For more than 10 years Graciela has owned a bakery. She inherited the business from her parents and maintained the excellent quality for many years. Because of this, she can compete with the market, which is every day more competitive in this area. The demand for her bakery items has increased, and to keep up with production demands, Graciela asks for a loan of 600 dollars to purchase an electric mixer.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Graciela tiene 42 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo de 39 años quien trabaja como empleado de una Empresa llamada Paraguay Turismo y ambos aportan con los ingresos familiares. Tienen dos hijos, uno de 8 años y el otro de 12 años, ambos en la cursan la primaria en una escuela pública de la ciudad.

Graciela es dueña de una panadería hace más de 10 años, el negocio lo heredó de sus padres, comenta que el producto mantiene una excelente calidad desde hace varios años, gracias a eso puede competir en el mercado, que cada vez es más competitivo en este rubro. La demanda de sus panificados han aumentado y para mantener un ritmo adecuado de producción, Graciela necesita adquirir una amasadora eléctrica cuyo costo es de $ 600 y por lo cual ella hoy está solicitando el crédito.

loans.use: To purchase an electric mixer

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs.Sok V. is a 48 year old housewife. Her husband works on their plot of farmland, growing bananas and other crops. They are applying for this $500 in order to purchase a cow to pull the plough to work the land. Doing this by hand has become too arduous.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to work in her farm

loans.name: I Wayan Landep

texts.id:
I Wayan Landep as a farmer is not nailed to one farming commodity. Before rice planting is due, he is using the time to plant hot peppers. The 1 ha (10,000 square meters) field is not his, he rented it by result division system. According to I Wayan Landep the hot pepper plants would be ready for harvest after 4 months. From his previous experience, in one week he could pick 400 kg hot peppers. Production results usually are picked up by the distributor at Rp3000 (33 US cents)/kg. When calculated nett profit per harvest could reach Rp400,000 (about US$44). I Wayan Landep has 5 helpers. Capital of Rp6,000,000 (about US$675) from Dinari would be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and labor expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Wayan Landep sebagai seorang petani tidak hanya terpaku pada satu komoditi pertanian.Pada saat tanaman padi belum turun taman ia memanfaatkan untuk menaman tanaman cabe.Lahan seluas 1 ha ini memang bukan kepunyaannya ia menyewa dengan sistem bagi hasil.Menurut I Wayan Landep tanaman cabenya baru siap dipanen setelah berumur 4 bulan. Dari pengalaman sebelumnya dalam satu minggu bisa dipetik 400 Kg cabe . Hasil produksinya biasanya diambil oleh pengepul dengan harga per-Kg Rp. 3.000.- Kalau di hitung keuntungan bersih per panen sampai Rp.400.000.- I Wayan Landep mempekerjakan 5 orang tenaga . Dana Rp. 6.000.000,- dari Dinari dipakainya untuk membeli bibit tanaman , membeli Pupuk , Obat-obatan dan ongkos tenaga kerja.

loans.use:
To buy hot pepper best seeds and fertilizers

Membeli bibit cabai jenis unggul dan pupuk

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. B. Thy (aged 25) got married in 2003 and has two daughters. She runs a business weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 2000 and began her own silk production that very year. She did not complete secondary school, while her husband, who rears cows, did not complete primary school. As her daughters are stll toddlers, they stay at home.

This $100 loan is Mrs B.'s first MAXIMA loan. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Angella's Group

texts.en: Angella is 36 years old. She is a widow with six children. She sells new clothes to earn a living. She intends to use the gained profits to pay school fees for the orphans and also buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Perlas De German Busch Group

texts.es:
"Pearls of Germán Busch" is the name of the community association that brings together 15 women, who have been working for 2 years and a half years, at improving their lives, and mostly to secure the future of their children.

Various activities are performed by this group, such as: new and used clothing sales, some food stations, crafts, etc. These are typically what characterize the activities performed by these women, who either own their own posts or participate in traveling fairs and markets in the city of El Alto so they can help sustain their families.

Currently, they need capital in order to meet the demands of the folk art fairs in the city of La Paz, El Alto and in some provinces of the Department, where they travel to offer their crafts/products. This is the only way they can hope to meet their obligations as heads of households.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Perlas de Germán Busch, ese es el denominativo de la asociación comunal que reune a 15 mujeres que hace 2 años y medio trabajan en pos de mejorar sus vidas, y principalmente asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Diversas actividades las caracterizan. El comercio de ropa, nueva y/o usada, algunos puestos de comida, y algunas artesanías caracterizan las actividades de estas señoras, que ya sea en puestos propios o deambulando por ferias, plazas y mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, intentan llevar a sus hogares el sustento diario. Actualmente precisan de capital para hacer frente a la demanda que existirá principalmente en las entradas folklóricas que se realizaran tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, El Alto y en algunas provincias del Departamento, donde ellas vijan para ofrecer sus productos, solo de esta manera podrán responder a las tantas obligaciones que les depara ser jefas de familia.

loans.use: They need capital in order to meet the demands of the folk art fairs in the city of La Paz, El Alto and in some provinces of the Department, where they travel to offer their crafts/products.  This is the only way they can hope to meet their obligations as heads of households.  (Actualmente precisan de capital para hacer frente a la demanda que existirá principalmente en las entradas folklóricas que se realizaran tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, El Alto y en algunas provincias del Departamento, donde ellas vijan para ofrecer sus productos, solo de esta manera podrán responder a las tantas obligaciones que les depara ser jefas de familia.)

loans.name: Nafees' Group

texts.en:
I am Nafees B. and I live in a one-room, mud-brick house with my family here in Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. I have three kids: two boys and one girl, all aged between one and five years old.

My husband is a butcher and sells meat. He wants to buy a few additional cattle for this purpose.

My group members are in need of loans also. Zubaida M. is borrowing for her family’s shoes business. Kaneez B. trades bamboo. Sughran B. sells bangels. Shahbaz B. makes and sells carpets.

loans.use: Expand butcher shop

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana considers herself to be a hard-working and responsible person. She's married to Luis Terrazas Nunez, 32, and has 2 children, Luis Fernando, 8, and Victor Manuel, 6, both in elementary school. She started the business because she wanted to help with household expenses. Her husband's salary doesn't always cover their expenses and they wanted to be able to better provide for their children. She also very much enjoys sewing. She began on February 14, 2000 when she got her first sewing machine, after following a friend's advice to take a course in sewing skills. She was able to get the sewing machine thanks to a "Tanda" (an informal group in which members can borrow and lend money) that she joined. From there, she began doing work for neighbors and, little by little, her customer base grew and business has been strong.

Susana is applying for a US$300 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, so that she can buy materials that will allow her to fill the orders that her customers have placed for things such as bedspreads, quilts, pillows, towel sets, etc. and so that she can provide good service and complete the orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Susana R. se considera una persona muy trabajadora y responsable esta casada con el Sr. Luis Terrazas Núñez de 32 años, tiene 2 hijos Luis Fernando de 8 años y Víctor Manuel de 6 años estudiantes de primaria. Inició el negocio por el deseo de ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que a veces no alcanzaba con su sueldo de su marido y querían darle lo mejor a sus hijos, además de que a ella le gusta mucho la costura. Comencé el 14 de Febrero de 2000 cuando le regalaron su primera maquina de coser a raíz de que una amiga la convenció de que ingresara a un curso de corte y confección y de manualidades y siguió su consejo. La máquina la pudo adquirir gracias a que entro a una “Tanda” de dinero, y fue así como empezó haciendo trabajos entre los vecinos y poco a poco fue creciendo el número de clientes y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir materiales que le permitan elaborar los trabajos que tiene encargados por sus clientes tales como, colchas, edredones, almohadas, juegos de baño, etc. y así poder darles un buen servicio cumpliendo a tiempo con dichos pedidos.

loans.use: Buy stock for sewing business.

loans.name: Noelia Dilena

texts.en:
One of the principle things that every human being has the right to is a place to live with dignity. Conscience of that, Noelia M. has worked very hard to be able to offer her little children the conditions necessary to be able to live in her home in the city of Villanueva in Chinandega.

With this motive the need for repair of yearly weather damage to her home is very evident. She has decided to reconstruct her home, and has already begun. She is working through Ceprodel to obtain a loan that would allow her to buy the materials for construction in order to carry out this job. This way she will be able to maintain her family and never need help from her mother.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Una de las principales cosas que todo ser humano tiene derecho es a una vivienda digna donde habitar. Consciente de esto, la señora Noelia M. con mucho esfuerzo labora para brindarles a sus pequeños hijos las condiciones necesarias para poder vivir en su casa de habitación en el sector de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es por este motivo que al ver la necesidad que ha atravesado su casa por haber sido lastimada por los fenómenos físicos de la naturaleza, ella ha decidido reconstruir su vivienda habiendo iniciado en parte esta labor. Para ello busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para así llevar a cabo esta labor y de este modo mantener a sus hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su mamá.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
M. Muhabbat is 47 years old. Muhabbat is the loving mother of two adorable sons. She is raising the children alone.

Not having the marital or moral support, Muhabbat decided to become an entrepreneur. For more than 15 years, she has been selling footwear. Only this business allows Muhabbat to support her family.

Now she requests a loan in the amount of $300 US as she is planning to expand her business in order to purchase more footwear and have a greater variety of goods. This way, she will earn more. From the profit of her business, she is planning to support her son in entering the university. Muhabbat promises to repay the loan in 4 months. Let’s support this brave and energetic woman.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Fairness Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fairrness. Its members include: Kadiatu K., who sells local produce/market food and Fatmata B., who sells articles. They both are asking for a loan of Le 2,000,000.00 to help them improve their businesses. These ladies have received previous loans from SMT and those loans have helped them a lot in increasing the sizes of their businesses and improving their family livelihoods. However, they still need more money to help them keep their businesses growing.

Kadiatu, who is the leader of this group, is now 48. She was born in Sanda but now lives wilth her husband in Makeni, together with their 4 children. Kadiatu`s husband is currently unemployed, thus she is the sole contributor to the family`s well-being. Kadiatu has been in the local produce business for over 25 years now.

loans.use: Buy more local produce to add onto their existing stock.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang T., 40, was married to her husband in 2004. She has three daughters from a previous marriage. All of her daughters have full-time employment in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Keang has been selling Khmer cakes (sticky rice sweet cakes) since 2005. She buys them at the market for resale in front of her house. Her husband works as a driver. The main income for the family is from her daughters' salaries. They each travel to work by motor taxi, and so Keang is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work

loans.name: Fatma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Fatma H. is 26 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 9 and 6 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Fatma H. is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Shumbana, Tatu, Miza, and Fatma S..

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira tiene 60 años y está acompañada desde hace aproximadamente 35 años con el señor Segundo Gaona, con quien tiene dos hijos, Carlos y Miryan, los dos ya mayores de edad.

Doña Elvira se dedica a la venta ambulante hace ya mas o menos 20 años lo que siempre le sirvió para sustentar a su familia.

Los créditos que la Fundación le otorga los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como manteles, colchas, fundas, ropas para criaturas y personas adultas etc.

Los próximos créditos los quiere invertir en la compra de más mercaderías acorde al cambio de estación, o sea ropas y mercaderías que sean para verano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira is 60 years old and has been married for 35 years to Mr. Segundo Gaona. They have two children together, Carlos and Miryan, both of whom are adults.

Mrs. Elvira has worked as a street vendor for about 20 years and it has always helped her support her family.
