The loans that the Foundation has granted her have been invested in the purchase of merchandise such as blankets, bedspreads, and clothing for children and adults.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise, according to the changing seasons, which will be clothing and merchandise for summer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets, bedspreads, sheets, and clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of A. J. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 20 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her first two sons are involved in furniture polishing work. The other two are free and don’t do anything. Her daughters stay at home and help her in her household work. Nasreen baji’s husband is a fruit seller, having experience in this for the past 15 years. Nasreen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy fresh flowers for her flower selling business. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy spare vehicle parts for her spare parts shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja  como guarda de seguridad y aporta  a los gastos de su familia, tiene tres hijos dos mayores de edad que se encuentran en Costa Rica trabajando para ayudar a sus padres y uno de 18 años de edad,  que esta estudiando la Sra. Dominga lleva un ciclo de ochos créditos en Afodenic lo cuales han sido de gran beneficios ya que ha podido hacer mejora a su casa. Su negocio es la venta de tortilla, frijoles molidos lo cual inicio con dinero propio, desde hace siete años, con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para embaldosar la sala de su casa y levantar la pared del porche. A largo plazo es poder captar otros clientes como restaurantes y poder mejorar el margen de ganancia
texts.en:
Dominga is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in the capital city Managua. Her husband works as a security guard and helps with the household expenses. They have three adult children that are working in Costa Rica to help their parents, and one 18 year old that is a student. Dominga has obtained eight loans through Afodenic which have been of great use, since she has been able to improve her house. Her business is selling tortillas and ground bean, which she started seven years ago. With this loan she would like to buy construction materials to tile her living room and put up wall on her porch. In the long term she would like to gain more clients, such as restaurants, to be able to improver her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhase of construction materials to tile her living room and put up a porch wall

loans.name: Virgen De La Natividad Group

texts.en:
The Virgen D. la Natividad Village Bank is located in the Ñahunpuquio community in Huancavelica Department, Peru. The community is located in a primarily agricultural area with many hectares of crops. The main activities in the area are farming, raising livestock, and commerce.

Otilia is married and has four adult children, who still live with her. She has a store where she sells fruits, vegetables, and many other items. She will use her loan to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store and expand the business.

Elisa Huamán is married. She sells potatoes in the markets each week. She does not have much investment capital, so she sells in small quantities. She would like to buy sweets and start selling juice from her home.

Raquel R. is married, runs a gas station, and sells dry goods. She likes group bank meetings because it gives her a chance to chat with her fellow group members. She is more sociable now, and has learned to save money. She wants to use her savings to have a hot chocolate party for all the children in her village.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow El Bancomunal Virgen D. la Natividad esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Ñahunpuquio en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona agrícola ganadera, donD. los sombríos se expanden por hectáreas. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Otilia, es casada y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores que aun viven con ella, tiene una tienda donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos entre frutas y verduras, con su préstamo desea surtir su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Elisa Huamán, es casada, se dedica a la venta D. papa en las ferias que se realizan semanalmente, no tiene mucho capital por eso venD. en poca cantidad, le gustaría comprar golosinas y abrir una juguería en su casa.

Raquel R., es casada, tiene un grifo y venD. abarrotes, le gusta las reuniones D. su bancomunal porque pueD. conversar con sus compañeras, ahora es mas sociable y esta aprendiendo a ahorrar pues quiere realizar una chocolatada para todos los niños D. su pueblo.

loans.use: To buy more produce, sweets, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mr. Heang P. was born in 1954 and he now lives in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Thy Mary, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Since their field is far from an irrigation system, Mr. Heang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water his field and fertilizer to make his crop more productive. Mr. Heang P. has four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Obaa

texts.en:
Obaa Y. is 56 years old. She is married with six children and lives in Koforidua, in the Ashanti region of Ghana, with her family. Currently one of her children is in senior high school and the rest are learning trades such as hairdressing. She sells fruit (mostly bananas) and cooking utensils in the neighborhood. She sells the bananas to travelers on the main road in her community.  She balances her stock of cooking utensils on her head and moves around to sell them. 

In addition to this, she has added plastic bowls to her inventory. By selling a variety of products, she can manage when demand for one product drops. 

She will use the loan to restock her inventory so her business can move forward.  She hopes to earn more income to support her children. Obaa belongs to a group called ‘Yesu edinkunim’ which means Christ Is Victorious.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of bananas, cooking utensils and plastic bowls.

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Wipala” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de dos  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, ubicada  en la Av. Bolivia – ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con quince miembros, estos  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría, por ejemplo venden medias, accesorios para el cabello, ropa interior, materia escolar, también venden verduras. La asociación Wipala precisa de créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Wipala" group has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than two years. This group is part of the Villa Adela branch, located on Bolivia Avenue in the city of El Alto. Today this group has 15 members who have shown that they are well organized with respect to their repayments and group activities. The members of this group have a variety of businesses. Most of them are merchants. For example, they sell socks, hair accessories, clothing, school supplies as well as vegetables. The Wipala group is asking for this loan to buy products in greater quantities in order to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need to buy large quantities of products

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan T. is a 54 year old man living in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassan has owned a school van for two years and is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to do maintenance work on his van and pay his daughter's wedding expenses. 

This is his third loan cycle and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him purchase a school van. When he began his business he had difficulty building a network and finding students. He decided to create his business to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on purchasing another van.

loans.use: Hassan will use the loan for maintenance work on the van and pay his daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Greetings from Drocella M. in Kigali, Rwanda!  Twelve years ago, Drocella opened a butcher shop in the capital city of Kigali in Rwanda.  She has since taken out and successfully repaid six loans from Vision Finance Company.  She is now seeking her seventh loan so that she may continue to expand her business.  The loan she is requesting is worth 500,000 Rwandan Francs and she will repay it on a monthly basis over an 8-month period.  

Drocella has one employee at her butchery who helps her keep the shop open from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm every day.  She has grown to the extent that she can now earn nearly 240,000 Rwandan Francs each month (or almost 500 USD).  She is 43 years old, widowed, and has four children.  With the profits from her business, Drocella pays school fees.  She is hoping that if this loan enables her profits to increase she will be able to build her own home.

loans.use: To buy meat for her butchery

loans.name: Aigafou

texts.en: Aigafou V., 36, is married with four children.  She is just starting in the pancake business. She sells to the school and villagers, seven days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 tala (~$50 US).  SPBD loans are Aigafou’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bags of flour and sugar, baking soda, vegetable oil, oven and frying pan

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 33-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. He has been working as a fisherman for eleven years. He fishes and then sells the fish to fish shops. Hicham requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a fishing net.

This is Hicham’s second loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his work, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided to start his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean A. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old, married, and has two school-age children. Mary Jean operates a family member's fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell such as "guso" or sea weeds. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy additional products to sell such as "guso" or sea weeds

loans.name: Mukum

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мукум  Муллоев имеет 30 летний стаж работы в сфере животноводческой деятельности и переработки молока. В этом бизнесе ему помогают жена и дети Мукума. Дополнительно доход в его семью приносит работа Мукума садовником и продажа молока соседям.
Мукум запрашивает кредит в размере 1600 сомни для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Mukum M. has 30 years of experience in the animal husbandry field and milk processing. His wife and children help him with the business. Mukum’s work as a gardener and sales of milk to his neighbors bring in additional income to his family. Mukum is requesting a loan in the sum of 1600 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo A. is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through senior high school. Kwadwo sells wood at Yanta near Elmina. He started this business in the year 2004. His wife is a teacher. Kwadwo is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Kwadwo will use the loan to purchase more wood for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwadwo will then build a new house and save the rest.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for sale.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom Y., 43, is a single mother living in Battambang Province. She earns a living by raising pigs for sale. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop.

Chhom Y. has four children; two of them are single and the other two are working (one is a vegetable seller and one works in construction).

Presently, Chhom Y. faces difficulty with transportation in that she always hires a taxi when she needs transportation. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like a $700 loan in order to buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs, as well as to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs, as well as to buy a piglet to raise

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old. She is married to Rosaldo, a construction worker in their village in the rural area of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. The couple is thankful having been blessed with three children: Precious, age 9, Aubrey, age 8, and four-year-old Erich. Two of them attend elementary school and the youngest is at the preparatory level.

Joan manages a general store business as her way of helping her husband in providing for the needs of their family and also in sending their children to school. Due to insufficient business capital, Joan is now seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She would like to take out a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000, which she will use for the development of her store.

She believes that patience and hard work are the key factors of having a progressive living. She hopes that lenders will lend her the amount that she is requesting so that she will be able to make her business profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is thirty – three years old. He is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. George is a trader. He trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. He hawks and treks to sell in other communities. George procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. He has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es: Magdalena D. Jesús R. D.
texts.en: Magdalena D. Jesús R. D.

loans.use: To supply her store

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao C. lives in Trapaing Pong Toek village in Takeo province. She is employed in a development association in the local district. She is 41 years old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Mao C. is applying a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hire laborer to work on the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living.

loans.use: Is applying a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and hire laborer to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Sarita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarita  está conformado por Rosa del Carmen G., María José C. G. y Anielka Jahoska M. L., ellas son de Nindiri. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora G. de veintinueve años de edad, quien vende cosméticos y joyas de plata y oro.

Mientras G. vende cosméticos y M. tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellas necesitan el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Sarita Group is comprised of Rosa del Carmen G., María José C. G. and Anielka Jahoska M. L.. They are from Nindiri. Mrs. G. is the coordinator of the group. She is 29, and she sells cosmetics and gold and silver jewelry. María José C. G. sells cosmetics. Anielka Jahoska M. L. has a small mini-market. They need a loan to be able to buy raw materials for each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and silver and gold jewelry

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en:
Mamur M. is 37 years old. He is married with four children. Mamur has opted to make his life in his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children. Today Mamur wishes to increase the number of his cattle. He would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home. That’s why he is requesting a loan of $750 USD. Extend your solidarity to Mamur so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 30 years old. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Cecilia is a trader. She trades in stationery materials. She hawks to sell in her community and she treks to sell. Cecilia buys goods such as notebooks, diaries, pens, etc. from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stationery in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
To earn a living, Janet sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for four years and hopes to expand her business in future by owning a boutique.

Janet is 32 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband works with the government.

This is the festive season for sales and Janet hopes to make more profits. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna H. is from the city of Maquilao Tagub City. She is 41 years old. Lorna is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Los Tunales Group

texts.es:
Llamada así esta alcancía comunal por el cultivo D. tuna en la zona llamado San Bartolomé y TornaM. es allí donD. se extrae además la cochinilla que es empleado para la coloración D. prendas textiles, sus doce integrantes son personas responsables, microempresarias quienes se dedican en vender frutas, golosinas, comida.

Yanet es madre soltera y tiene 48 años D. edad, la necesidad D. criar a sus hijos la impulsó a vender frutas en su casa que está ubicada en la carretera central, levantándose muy temprano para comprar la mercadería en el mercado mayorista D. frutas, aprovecha expender tuna, melocotones, manzana y mandarinas a los ómnibus, camiones y autos que visitan la sierra central; también venD. gasolina y petróleo a los autos que circulan en la zona.  D. igual modo en las mañanas se encarga D. cuidar los tubos D. agua D. su comunidad. El primer crédito que recibió compró gaseosas, kekes, galletas, utilizando las ganancias en adquirir una vitrina para sus golosinas, una refrigeradora e insumos. Como podemos apreciar en la fotografía el negocio D. Yanet ha ido mejorando con el tiempo, con ello paga los gastos D. su familia, dio la carrera D. farmacia a su hija, y sigue apoyando en la actualidad a su última hija quien estudia computación e informática, costea los medicamentos para su enfermedad (osteoporosis), así mismo construyó un baño D. material noble. El préstamo que necesita es para invertir una parte en gaseosas, golosinas y la otra apoyará en los trámites D. titulación D. su hija egresada. 

María es conviviente, tiene dos hijos D. 20 y 7 años venD. dulces en su casa así comparte en los gastos del hogar con su esposo quien es cobrador D. micro y por ello a veces no siempre tiene trabajo. Los préstamos que recibió lo invirtió en mercadería para adquirir gaseosas, galletas, detergentes los ingresos que obtiene son regulares. La comunidad también le dio a María un trabajo eventual para que se encargue D. soltar el agua en las mañanas. El préstamo que requiere es para comprar galletas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is named for the prickly pear cacti that grow in the districts of San Bartolomé and TornaM.. From this area comes cochineal (an insect that lives off the prickly pear cactus) extract that is used for dyeing textiles. The twelve members of this group are responsible micro-entrepreneurs who engage in selling fruit, candy, and food.

Yanet is a 48 year old single mother. The need to support her children prompted her to sell fruit from her home, which is located along the main highway. She wakes up early to buy her merchandise in bulk at the wholesale fruit market. She offers prickly pears, peaches, apples, and tangerines to people who are traveling to the mountains by bus, truck, or car. Yanet also sells gasoline and oil for cars that pass through the area. In addition, in the mornings, she is in charge of maintaining the water pipes for her community. Her first loan was used to purchase sodas, pound cakes, and cookies. She used her earnings to buy a display case for storing candy, a refrigerator, and supplies for her business. The group photograph was taken at Yanet’s business, so we can see that she has been improving over time. Yanet has been able to pay for her family’s expenses and help one of her daughters earn her pharmacy degree. She is currently supporting her youngest daughter who is studying information technology, paying for her own osteoporosis medication, and constructing a bathroom with solid materials. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase soft drinks and candy. Part of the proceeds will also be used to pay for her daughter’s college registration fees.

María is in a common law marriage and has two children, ages 20 and 7. She sells candy from home and also shares the household expenses with her husband, who works as a small-time debt collector. However, there are times when he does not have work. The loans she has received have been used to buy soft drinks, cookies, and detergents. Her earnings have been steady. The community has given María the responsibility of releasing the water in the mornings. Her loan will be used to purchase cookies and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has owned a cleaning company since 1993. He got this idea after seeing a need for such services in the region.

He is 50 years old and married with three children.  He provides cleaners for companies and houses. He works upon the request of the customers. 

Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a special machine that absorbs water and cleans the floors.

loans.use: purchase a special machine

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia M. Z. de 30 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Irma desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Ana ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia M. Z. is 30 years old and resides in the Municipality of Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her four-year-old son, whom attends school. Ana owns a store that sells perishable products and common household items. This business has allowed her to earn an extra income which contributes just as much as the earnings of her husband in the timely payments towards their house, their food, and other necessary expenses that they have in order to lead a dignified life. As such, she wishes to be able to add more products to her shop. This is why she has sought out a loan, with which she plans to purchase rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other necessary items to make her store a well-stocked one. This is very important for Ana because she is well-established in her area and she wants to be able to have everything that she needs to satisfy her customers and hopefully gain new ones that prefer to shop at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable products.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana del Socorro began selling fruits and vegetables at 8 years old with her mother in the local Masaya market.  When Ana was 23 years old she started her own fruit and vegetable business independent of her mother as she had begun a family of her own.

Ana is an excellent client of ADIM, she originally began borrowing through group loans and later graduated to the level where she could borrow with individual credit.  She will use this loan to buy products where the prices have increased; for example the cost has risen for  a bag of sweet peppers, tomatoes, pipián amongst many others.
texts.en:
Ana del Socorro began selling fruits and vegetables at 8 years old with her mother in the local Masaya market. When Ana was 23 years old she started her own fruit and vegetable business independent of her mother as she had begun a family of her own. Ana is an excellent client of ADIM, she originally began borrowing through group loans and later graduated to the level where she could borrow with individual credit. She will use this loan to buy products where the prices have increased; for example the cost has risen for a bag of sweet peppers, tomatoes, pipián amongst many others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables like peppers, tomtoes, pumpkin.

loans.name: Luísa Calisto

texts.pt:
Luisa Calisto H. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade casada e maê de 2 filhos de 10 e 4 anos de idade, o mais velho é que vai a escola. Fez apenas 5  classes, naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas pretende dar continuidade na Alfabetização de adultos. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, tem ajudado no sustento de seus irmãos em material escolar e assistência médica.

Nunca sai da cidade, apenas viaja e volta um ou dois dias depois quando vai a compras. Iniciou a actividade comercial em 1987 ainda muito jovem devido as dificuldades que a sua família enfrentava na vida. Actualmente é dona do seu próprio negoceia, faz cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia e não possui nenhum empregado, as vezes têm tido ajuda do seu marido que trabalha como jardineiro numa empresa de produção e venda de banana. O seu rendimento em media é de 4.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para casuais despesas que possam surgir.

Ja teve empréstimo na cooperativa de crédito PROCREDIT, e dividiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, óleo, amendoim, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a sua actividade comercial, mas tem como sonho construir uma residência condigna para a sua família.
texts.en:
Luisa Calisto H. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 10 and 4 years old. The 10 year old attends school. Luisa only studied through 5th grade and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources, but she would like to continue studying in adult literacy classes. She lives in her own home with her family and has helped to support her siblings with school materials and medical care. Luisa never left Boane, she only leaves for one or two day shopping trips. She began working in 1987, when she was still very young, because of the difficult life that her family was facing. She now owns her own business, works around 12 hours a day, and doesn't have any other employees. Her husband, who works as a gardener for a company that grows and sells bananas, sometimes helps her with the business. Luisa earns 4500.00 Meticales per month on average. She uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money at home each month for any additional expenditures that might arise. Luisa had taken out loans before with the PROCREDIT credit cooperative, but she decided not to continue for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 10,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (rice, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs and other items) in order to increase her merchandise. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards her business activities. Her dream is to build a decent home for her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking oil, rice and other items

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Mayra Rafaela tiene  51 años de edad, actualmente es madre soltera y tiene solamente un hijo, de una edad de 25 años que vive aparte. La señora tiene un negocio de mercadería en general, ella ofrece los productos y distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente por encargos. La señora comenzó su negocio hace 30 años, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, sin embargo poco a poco fue ahorrando lo suficiente para viajar al mercado oriental de Managua y comprar ropa, fue hasta hace 3 años que empezó a traer electrodomésticos por encargo. El crédito será invertido en la compra más mercadería para aprovechar las festividades de semana santa que se acercan. Ella sueña que su negocio siga creciendo para algún día poder dejarles a sus nietos un negocio bien establecido y que no dependan de un trabajo para sobrevivir sino del negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra Rafaela is 51 years old. She is a single mother and has just one son who is 25 years old and lives on his own. Mayra has a business selling general merchandise. She offers products and travels to distribute them, generally through orders. Mayra started her business 30 years ago. She began selling fruits and vegetables. However, little by little, she began saving enough to travel to the oriental market in Managua and buy clothing. It was 3 years ago that she began to sell household appliances by order. The loan will be invested in purchasing more merchandise in order to take advantage of the festivities around Holy Week that are nearing. Mayra dreams that her business will continue growing so that one day she will be able to leave her grandchildren with a well-established business and that they will not need to depend on a job other than this business to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 24 años, es un joven laborioso y correcto, casado con Shirley de 23 años, con quien tiene un niño, y juntos viven en casa de los padres de su esposa. Desde hace 4 años,  Wilder  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arveja, papa, asimismo tiene gusto por la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, en tanto su esposa se dedica en la crianza de cuyes, siendo estos seleccionados por jaulas e instaladas en el patio de su vivienda. De esa manera, ambos cubren los gastos familiares, para cada uno de ellos, lo más difícil es combatir con las plagas que atacan sus campos de cultivo y aquellas que afectan la salud de sus animales. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, por lo que ha tenido una mejora económica, lo que le asegura poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es por eso, que con la experiencia y solvencia que tiene en la agricultura, piensa continuar ahorrando, para que en el futuro pueda extender su siembra en búsqueda de una mejor productividad. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y manifiesta que gracias a la buena inversión de estos créditos puedo progresar en su negocio, así como la buena organización de su grupo comunal. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de fertilizantes y una botella de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Wilder, 24, is an upstanding, hard-working young man. He’s married to Shirley, 23, and they have a son; they all live together in his wife’s parents’ house. For the past 4 years, Wilder has farmed corn, peas and potatoes; he also enjoys raising cattle, sheep and pigs. His wife raises guinea-pigs that are sorted into cages in their yard. In this way, they both contribute to meeting household expenses. The greatest difficulty is fighting against pests that attack his farmlands and those that affect the health of his animals. This activity is quite profitable and his economic condition has improved which assures his being able to provide a better quality of life for his children. Thus, with the experience and solvency he has in farming, he plans to continue saving so that he can expand his plantings in the future, seeking better productivity. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he states that, thanks to the judicious investment of these funds and his communal bank’s good organization, his business was able to grow. He will use the requested 600 new soles to buy a sack of pea seed, two sacks of fertilizer and a bottle of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Success Group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, 20, and 30 years old. Kebbeh was only able to attend school through 6th grade.

For 17 years, Kebbeh has been selling pepper and vegetables at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia. She says she sells her goods in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning. One of the challenges she faces is that there are many competitors in the market.
Kebbeh plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 61,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pepper and vegetables to sell. Her goal is to improve the quality of her children’s lives.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase pepper and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nyame Asem Group

texts.en:
Sara is twenty-four years old. She is married and has two children who are one and seven years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a book publisher.

Sara is a hard-working and trustworthy young woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in cosmetics. Sara has been trading for four years now and wants the loan to procure cosmetics such as body spray, perfumes, powder, pomades, etc., in bulk. She buys from nearby towns. She hopes to provide quality education for her children. 

Sara is the leader of a nine-member trust bank group called ‘Nyame Asem’, 'God’s word'. The group is made up of trustworthy members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They are requesting the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Leyser Alexander

texts.es: Leyser Alexander tiene la actividad económica de brindar el servicio de cantos religiosos. Inicio hace más de 8 años por lo que desde muy joven le gustaba este medio de vida, pues siempre está dispuesto a mejorar y sacar adelante a su familia. Cuando creció no tuvo oportunidad de trabajar y tuvo que practicar lo que su papa le enseño, que es brindar este servicio, el además le ayuda a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela pues le interesa que sean unos profesionales. El financiamiento es brindarle reparaciones a su unidad de transporte y comprar otros instrumentos. El desea seguir prosperando para mejorar sus condiciones y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leyser Alexander works offering his services in religious song. He began this more than 8 years ago, because he has liked this life from a young age. When he grew up, he did not have the opportunity to work, and he had to practice what his father taught him, which was this service. He also helps his children with their homework at school and would like them to get careers. This loan is to get repairs on his method of transportation and purchase other instruments. He hopes to keep prospering in order to improve his family’s conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud M. is a 26-year-old young man from Tulkarem, a city in northern Palestine. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee who lives with his family. His brothers started working recently.

Mahmoud's family is a decent family. His father paid for his children's education and ended up with debt. Therefore, Mahmoud decided to help his father pay off the debt. Since Mahmoud's work salary doesn't help him to handle the debt, he decided to take a loan from FATEN to help his father.

Mahmoud has been working for five years now and is known for his good manners. Mahmoud appears in the photograph above.

loans.use: Pay off family debt

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya K. is a 45-year-old married woman with a daughter and son. They live in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. 
Her husband works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. started selling milk a year ago. She already owns one cow and is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy another young cow for milk to sell in the local area. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in demand for milk. Nepal people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly. She wishes to spend her income for her children's’ education.

loans.use: to buy a second cow for milk to sell

loans.name: Emerita Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Emerita del Carmen A. es madre soltera y reside con sus hijos en el Barrio Oriental de Danli, El Paraiso. 

El negocio de Doña Emerita es la confección de cameras, cortinas, edredones, cubre colchones, y otras manualidades. Doña Emerita tiene varios años  de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ganándose a su clientela por su experiencia y calidad en la confección de cameras y demás accesorios para el hogar.

Doña Emerita utilizara el prestamo para la compra de materia prima y seguir confeccionando sus cameras. Con las ganancias que le ha generado su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar la educación de sus hijos con carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Emerita del Carmen A. is a single mother who lives in Barrio Oriental, Danli, El Paraíso with her children. She makes bed linens like: comforters, mattress covers, bedspreads, box spring skirts and other crafts. She has been in this line of work for several years having won over many regular customers thanks to her experience and the quality of her bed linens and other household items she makes. Emerita will use the loan to buy raw materials to continue making her items. Profits from her business have made it possible for her to support her family and help her children study university careers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make bed linens.

loans.name: Hasbagana

texts.en:
Hasbagana M. is 38-years-old and lives with his wife and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a hairdresser in her district and the elder two children attend a district middle school while the youngest child goes to a kindergarten.

Hasbagana owns a successful microbus taxi service which he began in 1996. Now he hires a driver who transports people to the western part of Ulaanbaatar city while Hasbagana manages rural transportation using his own van. He is known as a reliable, friendly driver who takes great care of his passengers. For the future, he wishes to continue paying for his children’s education and would eventually like to build his own home.

Hasbagana is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his microbus so that he can keep it in good running condition.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his microbus

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza I. is a common law wife who lives in Prk. Lunas, Barangay Kawit, Medellin, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: General Store, Food Vending and Livestock Vending businesses. Her common law husband Serafio Mondejar, who is 53 years old, works as a electrician to earn his living.  She has six children who are between 18 and 33 years old. 

Esperanza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Esperanza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $360, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Esperanza I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 40 years old and was married to A. W. twelve years ago. She is the mother of seven children, two sons and five daughters. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints. She and her family live in a small city called Kasur which is located near Lahore, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry.

Parveen’s husband makes shoes. He receives orders from different shoe shops and factories and fulfills orders on time to earn money. Parveen is a housewife, but she also supports her husband in his business by making shoes. She learned this skill from him, and now she has become an expert in this art. Parveen’s elder son and daughter also help their father in his business.

Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband because he obtained a large order, and to fulfill it on time he requires more raw materials. With the loan he will buy such things as nails, shoe polish and leather in larger quantities, thus enabling him to fulfill the larger order and to maintain a good reputation by it.

Parveen is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her third loan cycle. In previous years she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings. Parveen hopes that fulfillment of this order will make them huge profits and that their financial conditions will be far improved.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's shoemaking business

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um T., 46, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells groceries for an income of $3.30 per day. Her husband is employed at a private company, earning an income of $5 per day.  

T. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Concern Women #2 Group

texts.en:
Ruth B., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Concern Women #2. She is 33 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a sophomore college student.

For two years, Ruth has been selling radio batteries, sugar, milk, rice, etc. in Rehab Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more batteries, sugar, milk, rice etc. Ruth describes herself as a respectful woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more radio batteries, sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Ashura A. is in her early sixties and is widowed with two children. Six years ago she began selling firewood. She also sells coconuts which are used for making cooking oil. Her business is open daily between 7 am and 8 pm and earns Ashura a stable profit. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  Ashura aims to increase her business capital with this loan.  Her dream is to one day buy land. 

Ashura will share this loan with her loan group Ununio, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the picture, Ashura can be seen seated, second from the right wearing a blue top and red bottom.

loans.use: To increase the business's capital

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old talented lady who supports her family financially from her embroidery business. She learned this art from her mother in her early age and now she is an expert in her field. She receives regular orders from her neighborhood clients and does well by completing them on time. 

She is a resident of a mid-sized city, Kasur, which is famous for its sweetmeat in Pakistan. She is married to A. A. who is a cobbler by profession. He makes shoes on order for different shoe factories. Those factories provide him raw materials for making shoes but in this way he only earns the laboring cost, which is not enough to meet the expenses of his family. That is why he has decided to buy the raw materials for himself and start to sell the finished products to these factories. In this way he can make more money and improve the financial situation of his family. 

Therefore, Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. He will invest the loan in purchasing raw materials such as nails, leather, shoe polish, etc. in bulk that will enable him to make shoes in larger quantity to sell to the factories. 

Farzana is hopeful that by utilizing the loan money, her husband’s income will be increased and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her large family of 8 children.   Both of her sons do labor and her daughters stay at home. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she had maintained her good behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe making business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar se dedica desde hace cuatro años a trabajar como carpintero, pese a su edad el ya conoce muy bien acerca de la actividad de carpintería y ya realiza trabajos en contrato para personas particulares, para lo cual necesita capital para la compra de materia prima para construir puertas y ventanas, en su casa vive con su esposa y su hija de un año, el solo mantiene el hogar, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, uno de sus deseos es el de comprarse un terreno para hacer construir su casita y tu taller de carpintería.
texts.en: Sr. Edgar has been working as a carpenter for four years.  Despite his age, he has already become very knowledgeable about the carpentry business.  His jobs are performed on contract for people he knows.  For this reason, he needs capital to buy materials for making doors and windows.  He lives at home with his wife and one year old daughter.  Edgar is the only one supporting the household.  He is a hard worker and a very responsible young man.  One of his wishes is to buy a plot of land where he can build a house and set up a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Delia M

texts.en:
Delia M V. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 38 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Denys Raul

texts.es:
Denys tiene  22 años de edad, es soltero y vive  en casa de sus padres la cual se encuentra ubicada en  el distrito de Eten, un distrito comercial que se encuentra situado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo 
Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las principales calles de su distrito y en las zonas aledañas. Trabaja durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

El continuo uso ha hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo destinado para reparar y darle mantenimiento a su unidad motorizada, asi como compra de accesorios adicionales. Con este préstamo el podrá tener una mejor unidad de transporte, evitando posibles problemas futuros de averías.
texts.en:
Denys is 22 years old.  He is single and lives in his parents' house which is located in Eten district, a commercial district which is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Denys provides a cargo and passenger transport service in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting people or goods).  He provides this service in the main streets of his district and in neighboring areas.  He works all day and the profits that he makes from this activity help him to cover his personal expenses and support his family financially.

The continual use of his vehicle has meant that it is starting to suffer from some mechanical problems which need repairing urgently in order to guarantee the vehicle remain in good working order.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to repair and service his vehicle as well as buy additional accessories.  This loan will enable him to have a better vehicle and avoid possible future problems with breakdowns.

loans.use: To fix his 'mototaxi' to guarantee it remains in good working order

loans.name: Renato Geovanny

texts.es:
Renato Geovanny O. M. tiene 32 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con su hijo, vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos en la.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Renato Geovanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria en Ventanas..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder tener un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte como el indor futbol.
texts.en:
Renato Geovanny O. M. is 32 years old.  He lives in Unión Libre in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos province with his partner and child.  He likes sports, such as indoor football.

The members of V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE live around Cachel y Grande, which is part of the canton of Ventanas.  This group is dedicated to labor-intensive agricultural work, such as the cultivation of corn, rice, and beans.

Renato Geovanny grows corn, rice, beans.  He buys his supplies at the Agro Karlyta and sells his products in the market in Ventanas..

He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to grown corn, rice, and beans.  The loan will help him to meet his economic needs.  Farmers like him face challenges like blight, disease, and weather problems.

His dream is to be able to own land.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Felix Ruperto

texts.es:
Felix Ruperto R. R., tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Felix Ruperto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Farma - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un buen trabajo.

Le gusta hacer amigos y ser responsable.
texts.en:
Felix Ruperto R. R., age 34, is single and lives alone in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has no children. 

The members of the V.R.C. Ciudadela Los Angeles are located in the Los Angeles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice.

Felix Ruperto works in agriculture sowing corn. He purchases his products in Farma-Agro and sells in the same location.

He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have a good job.

He enjoys making friends and being responsible.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités de petits commerces dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de couvre lits, pagnes wax, cubes jumbo et  de légumes (choux pommés, tomates fraîches, carottes, piments, aubergines et la laitue). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 8ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Oumou Diabaté est une grande vendeuse de légumes de toutes sortes au marché Château de Ségou. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 sacs de choux pommés. Elle se ravitaille en légumes avec les forains de Koutiala au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour ambition d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso / Kiva.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkadi group are married, live mainly in monogamous households, and are 38 years old on average with 5 children. They all live in the Hamdallaye area of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali), and know each other through familial, marriage, and business relations - they all run small businesses at the Château market in Ségou.
The group members buy and sell bedspreads, pagnes wax (a type of brightly-printed cloth), Jumbo boullion cubes, and vegetables (cabbage, fresh tomatoes, carrots, peppers, eggplant, and lettuce).
With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), and are on their 8th solidarity (group) loan cycle. 
Ms. Oumou Diabaté, one of the group members, is a well-known seller of all types of vegetables at the Château market in Ségou.
She intends to use her loan to buy 20 bags of cabbage. She gets her vegetable supplies from the Koutiala stallkeepers at the grand market in Ségou. She re-sells her goods in cash and on credit at home and at the Château market to a clientele composed primarily of women.
With this loan, Ms. Oumou hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of certain household expenses.
She aspires to buy a plot of land for housing through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso/Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cabbage

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, a married woman living in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a rice-selling business. Her husband Joel, 43, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 18 and 19 years old, one already with their own family, the other attending school.

Marivic joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion. Marivic is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man living with one parent and six siblings. He is from Lebanon.  He works as an electrician on a freelance basis upon clients' requests. Despite his young age, he works hard to be able to help his father with the family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools needed. In that way, he will be able to take on more projects and expand his business operation.  He is hoping to increase his earnings. In the future, he wants to open up his own electric shop.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing new tools.

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Katty de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su taller elaboracion de cama a base de madera. anteriormente la ayudaba su ex esposo pero ahora se dedica al 100%.

Ahora ella tiene tres personas que la ayudan en la fabricación de camas. Trabaja diariamente de 9:00 am a 8:00 pm. Lo que le afecta en el trabajo es la competencia ya que la mayoría son hombres y en ocasiones hay escases de la madera.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  parrillas, tablones, cabeceras para la fabricación de las camas. Lo que más anhela que su negocio crezca y mejorar su vivienda para así darle lo mejor a sus hijos en lo que más necesite.
texts.en:
Katty is 28 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a workshop where she makes wooden beds.  Previously, her ex-husband used to help her but now she works in the business 100%.

Katty has three people who help her to make her beds.  She works from 9.00am to 8.00pm every day.  What affects her in her work is the competition since most of them are men and also sometimes there are shortages of wood.

Katty would like to use her loan to buy metal grills, planks and headboards for making her beds.  What she most desires is for her business to grow and to improve her home so that she can provide her children with the best as regards what they most need.

loans.use: to buy planks, metal grills and headboards for making beds

loans.name: Yanina Deysi

texts.es: Yanina tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia en el distrito de Reque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es rural y no cuenta con el servicio básico de agua potable, solo cuenta con energía eléctrica. El agua para su consumo viene de un pozo. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como pavos y gallinas y el engorde de toros. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cria los animales y  estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con sus ingresos, Yanina puede ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como agricultor, con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Desea ampliar su negocio e invertir en la compra de más animales mayores como cerdos y toros. Tambien desea poner un techo a sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales del sol. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yanina, 28, is married and has a son.  She lives in her own house with her family in Reque District in northern Peru.  The zone where she lives is rural and does not have the basic service of potable water; it only has electricity.  Water for her consumption comes from a well.

She raises livestock like turkeys, chickens and cattle.  She has ten years experience in this line of work.  She raises the animals and as they reach good levels of growth she sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where she lives.  Yanina uses her income to help her husband, who is a farmer, support the family.

She wants to expand the business and invest in the purchase of more large animals like pigs and bulls.  She also wants to roof her corrals to better protect the animals from the sun.  Because of this, she’s thought it wise to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more cattle and repair her corrals.

loans.name: Otiza

texts.en:
Otiza V. is from the village of Songco, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Otiza is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Otiza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap, spices & biscuits in the local community. Otiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Otiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Otiza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack foods & instant noodles. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Otiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods & instant noodles.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 56 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Concepcion is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years. She earns additional income from vulcanizing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from the village of Bugo, Balite, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like suman, rice cakes and longganisa in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, meat and spices. This will be the first loan that Rosalina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, meat and spices

location.town: Bugo, Balite, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making popsicles and also piglets

loans.name: 5 Phú  Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cấp has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Cấp is 66 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 7.1.5 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. Cấp lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cấp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cấp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cấp hopes for her children to find a good job  and to remodel her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre a impulsado el desarrollo de su familia, a sus 37 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, en la actualidad esta es su principal fuente de ingreso, donde toda su familia vela cada día por los terrenos de cultivo que fertiliza. Aunque las labores del campo signifiquen un trabajo duro y arduo afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor porque le permite tener siempre disponible el alimento para su familia, aun así en tiempos difíciles el cultivo de hortalizas es lo más rentable que le genera, aunque también cultiva papa. Es por esta razón que  intensifica sus cultivos en producir mayor cantidad de  estos productos porque le ofrecen un buen precio por estos productos en el mercado de su localidad. En adelante desea adquirir más extensiones de terreno donde pueda seguir produciendo más papa y hortalizas. Es su octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP de las cuales considera que fueron años de trabajo eficiente con su grupo solidario a pesar de las dificultades que atravesaron como equipo y le sirvió para fortalecerse y seguir trabajando de manera solidaria. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de guano de ave de corral para fertilizar la siembra de papa.
texts.en: Clorinda is a hardworking woman who has always driven the family's development. At her 37 years of age, she lives with her husband and their 3 children in a house of their own. Since her childhood she has worked in agriculture, and today it is her primary source of income. Her entire family works daily on the fertilizing their cultivation fields. Although agricultural work is hard and arduous work she says that she very much enjoys it because it helps her to always have food for her family, although there are still some difficult times. The harvesting of vegetables is the most profitable although she also cultivates potatoes. For this reason she intensifies her efforts to produce a greater yield of these products. She earns a good profit with these products in her community market. In the future she wants to acquire further extensions to her land where she will continue to produce potatoes and vegetables. It is the eighth time that she has a loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she considers that the years with her communal bank were efficiently invested despite the difficulties they faced as a group. It helped her to gain strength and to keep working in a unified manner. With the funds that she requests she will invest in the purchase of poultry manure to fertilizer her potato cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase poultry manure.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos (uno independiente).  Sabina no tiene grado D. instrucción.
DesD. hace nueve años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, medias  y ropa interior.
Con su nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cien docenas D. medias D. todo tamaño y otras prendas D. vestir.
