Nos cuenta que sus productos los compran en Desaguadero, Bolivia y lo venD. en el mercado D. Yunguyo.  Su esposo trabaja en la chacra y eventualmente tiene trabajos como albañil.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Sabina es a member of the “Niño Jesús D. Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 53 years old, married and has three children (one independent).  Sabina never went to school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 9 years.  Her previous loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She sells clothing, stockings and underwear.

She will use the new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy 100 dozen stockings in all sizes and some other articles of clothing.  She tells us that she buys her products in Desaguadero, Bolivia and sells them in the Yunguyo market.  Her husband is a farmer and sometimes gets bricklaying jobs.

Her dream is to improve the business to thus improve her income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the companionship and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 100 dozen stockings in assorted sizes and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 50 years old, married to Juliana. They are blessed with four children ages twenty two, nineteen, fourteen and six. He has been farming for two years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to cater for his family needs.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a member of KADET staff. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children up to university level and purchase a piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup car for transportation which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old and married with three children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

Vilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is a father of two children who are 15 and 8 years old. He has been in farming for 10 years in his home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya, producing beans and bananas, which go to the local market. He currently employs three farmhands. 

Fabian has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him pay his farm hands to cultivate a larger banana plantation. He says he has decided to expand his banana farming because of the returns it makes, which helps him educate his children. 

Fabian is glad Juhudi provides farmers with loans but advocates for more services and lower interest rates. He sees lack of finances as the major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To help pay his farm hands

loans.name: Maria  De La  Luz

texts.es: La Sra. María es una persona que trabaja  todo el día para salir adelante,  ya que es sola con su hijo, y  esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado ya que le vamos a apoyar con el proyecto que tiene el  cual  consiste  en construir las bardas traseras de su casa  la cual adquirió con esfuerzo, agradece  el apoyo brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto  ya  que   ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad   de    brindarles  un mejor   patrimonio  a  su  familia  ofreciéndoles  mayor  seguridad.
texts.en: María is a person who works all day to get ahead, since she is alone with her son. She is very happy to have found us [the Field Partner], since we are going to support her with the project she has. This consists of constructing the protective walls behind her house, which she acquired through great effort. She is grateful for the support provided to her to carry out her project, since she sees in the loan the opportunity to provide a better legacy to her family, offering them greater security.

loans.use: to build a protective wall.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years old, married to Jacqueline, and together they have one child. He is a scrap-metal dealer in Mathare North. Most of his customers are low-income earners. He has been in the business for the past six years. He receives a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the amount to buy more scrap metal to stock his business. Anticipated profits will be used to expand his business and improve his living standard. He hopes to own a hardware store and to be financially stable. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of scrap metal for the business

loans.name: Betty S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 7,400,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy items or invest in projects that their salaries alone cannot afford. At the end of each month, using their monthly salaries, these teachers repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Betty. A native of Damawulo, the 57-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 36 years now. Betty is married and has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Betty has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida is married.  She has given birth to 3 children, all of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  Fehmida is a housewife and stays at her home and does her household responsibilities.  Her husband has a business making car seat covers, which is called Poshish in the local Urdu language.  He is an expert in this work and makes beautiful seat covers,  which has a good demand among his customers. 

Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy leather, thread and foam to make seat covers of better quality and increase his sales.  Fehmida is confident that this investment will be a productive one for him and he will be able to make more profits. 

Note: In the photo, one of the members has a spice selling business, that is why they are holding spices packs.

loans.use: to buy materials to make car seat covers

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Jesús  tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera. Ella tiene 3 hijos, con las edades de 9, 20 y 22 años. Su hija mayor está casada y vive en su propio hogar. Doña Jesús vive en San Pedro Sula con sus dos hijos menores.  

 Doña Jesús es comerciante ambulante y vende ropa usada y adornos para el hogar. Ella también lo hace por encargo. Inicio su negocio motivada por la necesidad de conseguir ingresos que le permitieran cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos (alimentación, vestuario y educación). 

El capital semilla que ha invertido en su negocio, lo ha obtenido de personas prestamistas cuyos intereses son extremadamente altos. Manifiesta que ha sido muy difícil su situación económica, ya que como madre soltera no ha tenido el apoyo del padre de sus hijos.

Doña Jesús comenta que es su primera experiencia con financiamiento en una institución formal como ODEF. 
Piensa invertir su préstamo en surtir más su negocio con la compra de ropa, carteras y adornos,  ya que a veces tiene dificultades para suplir la demanda de algunos clientes que le solicitan mercadería de la cual ella no dispone. 

Su meta a futuro es aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 42, is a single mother.  She has three children; ages 9, 20, and 22.  Her oldest daughter is married and lives in her own home.  Jesús lives in San Pedro Sula with her two minor children.

Jesús is an itinerant merchant.  She sells used clothes and decorations for the home.  She also does this by order.  She was motivated to start the business by the necessity of getting income that would allow her to cover her children’s basic necessities (food, clothing, and education).

She got the seed money that she has invested in her business from lenders whose interest was extremely high.  She states that her financial situation has been very difficult.  As a single mother she has not had the support of the father of her children.

Jesús comments that this is her first loan experience with a formal institution like ODEF.  She plans on using her loan to better stock her business.  She will buy clothes, wallets, and decorations.  At times she has difficulties meeting the demand of some customers who request merchandise that she does not have.

Her goal for the future is to increase sales and to get greater income in order to improve her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to better stock her store by purchasing clothes, wallets, and decorations.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Aiza has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell.

Aiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Aiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Primicia” se formó gracias al deseo de superación del nivel de vida de sus miembros. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de progresar en la vida. Su principal motivación ha sido darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
Zunilda es una de esas mujeres, ella tiene un local de venta de bebidas, gracias a este negocio y sumado a su amabilidad y buen trato a los clientes, ella puede ayudar a su familia. Comenta que ya se ha formado una clientela que siempre va hasta su local y que gracias a eso ella puede seguir creciendo y agrandar su negocio. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo y tener un local bien amplio y surtido.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de cervezas, sidras y vino, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, pues se acercan las fiestas y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
The Primicia Communal Bank was formed, thanks to its members’ wish to overcome their conditions of life. They are very hardworking and enterprising women who want to get ahead and succeed in life. Their principal motivation has been to provide a better future for their children.

Zunilda is one of those women. She has a shop selling drinks. Thanks to this business and her friendliness and good customer service, she has been able to help her family. She says that the clientele who always come to her place has been growing and thanks to that, she is able to continue  expanding her business. One of her goals is to grow even further and to have a spacious and well stocked shop. She is requesting a loan from the Fundación and Kiva in order to buy beer, cider and wine, with which she will be able to supply her shop since the holiday season is fast approaching and she wants to be prepared

loans.use: to buy beer, cider and wine.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 22 years old, single and lives in a rented house with electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling CDs (movies, music and blank) to local residents. Her main challenge is a highly variable income, but she dreams of someday owning a video library. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy more CDs to sell. She joined Yehu as a way to access loans and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more CDs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Fatu. Fatu is a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 4,000,000.00 in order to invest in her businesses. 

Fatu sells cloths – “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloths) and “Bamakos” (cloths made in Mali). She also sells household items like dishes, plastic bowls, etc. She has been doing business for twenty years now. Born in Makeni city, the forty-seven-year-old wife and mother of three children has applied for this loan in order to buy gara lapper making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, etc. in order to produce a large quantities of gara cloths for sale. She will also use part of the loan to buy a bale of Bamako cloths, dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, etc. She will also buy a bale of Bamako cloths, dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to add to her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 39 years, is a single mother of one child. She has been doing tailoring for five years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is her first loan term with KADET Ltd .She will use the funds to buy textiles to make clothes for sale. Mary hopes to start a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cooded rice and serves it with meat and fish stew at Abuenu. Efua is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling cooded rice for 10 years. She supports her husband to feed their children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients for the preparation of the cooded rice for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Jessica Carolina

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con su negocio de venta de comidas cuando se dio cuenta que en el sitio de trabajo de su cónyuge, laboran varias personas que no van desayunando de su casa por cuestión de tiempo.  Trabaja diariamente, prepara los desayunos y los reparte muy temprano en la mañana.  Es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de marquetas de hielo.  Tiene 3 hijos y estudian en la escuela fiscal que está cerca de su casa, la cual es fiscal.  Desea que en un futuro, su clientela se incremente mucho más, para poder mejorar sus ingresos.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de abarrotes y ollas para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.

loans.use: Compra de abarrotes y utensilios

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is married with five children and three go to school.  She has no additional family members . She operates a restaurant and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy flour,bunches of green bananas,beans,cooking oil.  She works from the market on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of building rental houses.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy flour,bunches of green bananas,beans,cooking oil.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is a very young woman, with 33 years old, she considers by herself as an entrepreneur, intelligent and hard working woman. Gerardo is Elvia\'s husband and he is working in a private company. Even with his job, his salary is not enough to cover up the family expenses, for that reason Elvia started her own business. She has 2 years of experience and works selling products made with ceramic, every day her clients are increasing because she has petty good pleasure and humor. With a beautiful son she wants to offer him a better quality of life.

Elvia requires a loan of $250 USD to purchase of products made with ceramic and she plans to return the loan in a term of 3 months. Elvia requests of your support and she thanks your generosity

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Elvia es una mujer muy joven, con 33 años de edad se concederá ella misma como una mujer emprendedora, inteligente y trabajadora. Gerardo es el esposo de Elvia y es un empleado de una empresa privada. A pesar de su trabajo no gana el suficiente dinero para cubrir los gastos de su familia por lo que Elvia inicio su propio negocio. Ella tiene 2 años de experiencia se dedica a vender productos hechos con cerámica y cada día sus clientes aumentan debido a su buen gusto y humor. Con un hermoso hijo ella desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.

Elvia requiere de un préstamo de $250 USD para la compra de productos hechos con cerámica y planea regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 meses. Elvia pide de tu apoyo y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase of products made with ceramic

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is involved in produce sales. She buys and sells farm produce to neighbouring communities and markets. The community she resides in is near the Capital City, Accra. She is a graduate of the Teach Lending prgramm of Kraban Support Foundation. She requires a loan of $925 to improve her business.

loans.use: Working CAPITAL

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 50 years old and her husband is 49. Hong has cardiac disease and An, her husband, is mentally retarded. Hong’s first child, Thuy stopped going to school and has to work as a day laborer but Thuy only earns enough money for her own living. Hong’s second child is going to the university and their third child is in grade 8. Additionally, they must support their mother.

They have a little land, about 2000 square meters, to plant rice and about 2000 square meters to plant cassava. The income from this land is not enough for their family so their income is low at $7.5/person/month, but the expense of tuition is high.

Hong’s selling duck eggs in the evening is important for increasing their income by about $1/person/month. She wants to borrow $75 for her selling and to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava.

loans.use: selling duck eggs and to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ms Angela is 59 years old and married. She lives in her own house with her husband who is an auto repairman and works independently from his own shop. They have three children, all old enough to work independently and contribute to the family's income.

Angela owns a localized eatery in the municipal market of Paraguari. She has 26 years of experience in this field, and her business is one of the oldest at the market. Her business goes very well. However, the infrastructure of her home is deteriorating. She hopes that by fixing her home she can improve its appearance and physical space. For this, she asks for a loan of 275 dollars to invest in the renovation of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ángela tiene 59 años D. edad, es casada, vive en una casa propia con su esposo, el es chapista D. autos y trabaja D. forma independiente en su propio taller. Tienen 3 hijos, todos ya mayores que trabajan D. forma independiente y aportan con los ingresos D. la familia.

Ángela es dueña D. un comedor ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Paraguarí; cuenta con 26 años D. antigüedad en el ramo y es uno D. los negocios más antiguos del mercado. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pero la infraestructura D. su local está muy deteriorada por lo que ella desea mejorarlo para tener así una mejor apariencia y espacio físico; para ello, necesita un crédito D. $ 275 que lo invertirá en la mejora del local.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: I sell garlic and ginger in my local vegetable market and my husband sells coconuts on his cart. We earn just enough to support our family. Moreover, for a long time I have wanted to expand the business by building my own vegetable shop, where my children can assist me. I need $250 to buy a large amount of  vegetables so that I can generate good profits and provide enough food and clothing for my family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Abieuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieuwa E. is 45 years old, is married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She started this business in 1996. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell. She has been a LAPO member for eight years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina has been working incredibly hard as a “feriante” for the past 8 years. Every single morning, she takes a wide variety of products from the city to the rural countryside of Ayacucho, Perú to sell. Because there are no stores outside the city limits of Ayacucho, the people living there rely on weekly markets for all the food items and other goods they cannot produce themselves. Bernardina has capitalized on this market and everyday she travels to a different location to set up her stand and sell to the communities. She loads her giant wicker basket with fresh fruits and vegetables. She and her husband even bake bread in a rented oven near their home, which she also loads up to sell in the country. 

This type of job is extremely strenuous and tiring. Bernardina wakes up every morning at 4 a.m. and sometimes doesn’t return home until after 8 p.m. However strenuous her vocation, it is necessary, as she is supporting her entire family of 5 children and her husband with her meager income. Years before, Bernardina’s husband also had a job and worked very hard. However, he fell gravely ill and is now unable to perform manual labor. Thus, Bernardina bears the family’s economic burden on her own. She is highly motivated though. She has been saving diligently in order to reach the goal of educating all five of her children in obtaining a university degree. Without the economic help Bernardina has received through her village bank and the support of her family, realization of her dreams would be nearly impossible. Bernardina is requesting a loan of $350. With this money, she will be able to buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables as well as bake larger quantities of bread.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables as well as bake larger quantities of bread

loans.name: Elinah's Group

texts.en: Elinah is 30 years old and is married with 6 children. She has a small retail shop. She intends to build a house from the profits made from the business.

loans.use: To purchase more juice(quencher) and increase her stock

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is a 42-year-old mother of 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region. Dilbar has 10 years of experience in the cattle business. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow for getting more milk and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nabaziza D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nalongo L.. She is currently in the business of making and selling snacks and is requesting a loan to expand business. Nalongo is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 4 children ranging from age 14 to 19 and her children go to school. Each week, Nalongo makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy food warmers.

Nalongo is joined in her small group by Sepiranza N., Margret B., Berna N., and Irene S.. Sepiranza N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to buy bigger saucepans. Margret B. is currently operating a stone quarrying business and wants a loan to add to her business. Berna N. operates a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes. Irene S. is currently in the business of running a drug shop and clinic and is requesting a loan to purchase a microscope.

loans.use: To purchase more baking flour, cooking oil and frying pans

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.en:
The community bank “Nazareno” has recently completed one four-month loan cycle. The bank now has seventeen members. All of the associates are happy with the community bank. They feel that they have the support they need and enjoy the regular group meetings.

Through the community bank these associates receive training on a variety of subjects. During their first cycle associates learned the importance of savings and how to manage a loan. They also mentioned learning the importance of responsibility and punctuality.

The members of “Nazareno” have a variety of business. Many sell basic food staples from their homes or small stores. Another associate owns a tailor shop. Still others own printing shops or restaurants.

The associates need loans of different sizes. Some need 400, 800, or 800 soles reaching a total of 7200 soles in loans from the communal bank. All associates plan to use their loans to increase the amount of merchandise available to sell.

Their dreams are to continue improving their business and moving forward in life. They hope that their children have more opportunities then they had.

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise available to sell.

loans.name: Jamaica Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Ireen L. is an average young Kenyan woman; she is married and has four children of her own, as well as one child left by her late sister.

Ireen started her tailoring business two years ago, after completing a tailoring course in the town of Bungoma. Before venturing into the tailoring business, Ireen used to work for her aunt for a commission in Bungoma Municipality market, from which she accumulated the savings to start her own business. She initially started with one sewing machine, but she has worked hard to expand her business; she currently has two sewing machines, and she would like to purchase another sewing machine to allow her to train women who would like to be tailors also.

With the little profit that she makes from her business, she is still able to provide food, clothing, and shelter for her children. With the help of her loan, Ireen will be able to purchase another sewing machine and also buy some material to make clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials to make clothing

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian is 42 years old and a mother with three children. She has a beauty salon and has been operating it for 8 years now. Christian feels that her community has helped her a lot, and therefore to give back to society she has taken on 11 young women who are learning the trade from her. She wants to use the loan to buy hair products like perm creams, activators, artificial hair for braiding, hair food, rollers, hair pins, etc. to expand her operations. She is a member of the group called Holy Cross. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. In the picture, Christian is in a brown dress, and she is with five of the young women who are learning the trade.

loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Janet S. is a single mother of three little girls. She operates a door-to-door clothes sales business and works from 8am to 5pm daily. She has operated this business since 2007 and earns a monthly income of $120.00. With this loan from Kiva, Janet hopes to employ another worker so she can expand her market reach and increase her sales. She also hopes to pay for her children's school fees with some of the proceeds.

Janet is the leader of the Tanzanite group. With her are six other entrepreneurs who will share this loan to help their businesses. These members hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan, and thus guarantee full payback.

loans.use: To employ a worker and raise sales.

loans.name: Laiheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Laiheak C., 36, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Horn, 41, live on an island in the Mekong River near Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Three of their children are in the local school.

Mrs. Laiheak has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a reseller nearby, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sam-at was a silk weaver himself but has recently gone into carpentry. Laiheak is requesting a loan of 200 USD to purchase materials to construct a roof and walls of her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to complete her house

loans.name: Olima

texts.en:
Olima Z. is 43 years old. She is a widow with five children. When her husband passed away, she was left without any steady income. Supporting this large family on her own was very difficult. Struggling against the difficult life, Olima learned to process dried fruits and clingstone apricots 9 years ago. The business went along successfully after it started.

Thanks to this activity she has been able to open a grocery store near her house where her daughter sells foodstuffs. Her elder son left for Russia two years ago to try to earn some money. Every month he sends his mother on average US$ 200.

Today Olima is requesting a loan of 2900 Somoni (850 USD) with a term of 8 months. She hopes to use the loan to purchase more dried fruits due to great demand from her customers. Olima and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits for processing and sale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras se formó con varias integrantes del comité Mujeres Luchadoras del barrio María Blanca de Yka´a el cual se disolvió por diversos motivos, las mismas conformaron el nuevo grupo a causa de que quisieron seguir aprovechando el programa del comité para seguir creciendo personal, laboral y comunitariamente. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 16 integrantes y se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa.

1. - Angela A. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata.

2. - Oliva Insfran invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar, fideo.

3. - Analia C. invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar, fideo.

4. - Myrian Estela M. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales.

5. - Luisa Fernandez invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short.

6. - Sonia L. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos

7. - Otilia P. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos

8. - María Selva M. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short.

9. - Angelina C. invertirá en la compra de químicos para la realización de productos de limpieza.

10. - Alejandra C. invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas, carbón, panificados, arroz, azúcar.

11. - Antonia D. invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos.

12. - Porfiria V. invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales

13. - Cinthia Ávalos invertirá en la compra de hierbas medicinales y manzanas, peras, mandarinas, naranjas, bananas.

14. - Maida Jacinta R. invertirá en la compra químicos para la realización de productos de limpieza.

15. - Idalina A. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, discos para empanadas, tomates, lechuga, servilletas, mayonesa, mostaza, etc.

16. - Digna Bordón invertirá en la compra de carbón.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group was formed by various members of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" group from the María Blanca de Yka'a neighborhood when it broke up for several different reasons. The women formed the new group because they wanted to continue to take advantage of the group's program to continue growing personally, through business and as a community. Now the group is made up of 16 members and they are currently in the second cycle of the program.

1. - Ángela A. will purchase silver jewelry. 2. - Oliva Insfran will buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice, sugar and pasta. 3. - Analia C. will also invest in meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice, sugar and pasta. 4. - Myrian Estela M. will purchase medicinal herbs. 5. - Luisa F. will buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts. 6. - Sonia L. will buy fabric and thread. 7. - Otilia P. invertirá will also buy fabric and thread. 8. - María Selva M. plans to also buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and shorts. 9. - Angelina C. will invest in chemicals with which she will make cleaning products. 10. - Alejandra C. will purchase meat, vegetables, cooking oil, beer, charcoal, baked goods, rice and sugar. 11. - Antonia D. will buy fabric and thread. 12. - Porfiria Velázquez will purchase herbal medicines. 13. - Cinthia Ávalos will buy herbal medicines, apples, pears, mandarins, oranges and bananas. 14. - Maida Jacinta R. will invest in chemicals that she will use to make cleaning products. 15. - Idalina A. will purchase soft drinks, pastry to make empanadas, tomatoes, lettuce, napkins, mayonnaise and mustard. 16. - Digna Bordón will buy charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in as area named Walton in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 4 years. She is the mother of two young sons who aren't old enough to attend school.

Saima baji’s husband has a food business for 10 years. He runs a small hotel in the community and everybody comes to him to buy food. He sells Punjabi foods (Halwa Poudi and Nan Channa). Saima baji is a housewife and helps her husband make food to sell in the shop. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah. Now she is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, flour, lentils, and spices for her husband’s food business.

Saima baji's loan group includes several other members. Irshad baji requests a loan to buy leather for her shoe-making business. Gulshan baji requests a loan to buy a rubbing machine, which makes floors smooth. Jamila baji requests a loan to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: La señora Juana Maria A. B. tiene la edad de 28 años,  habita en el sector de los cocos ubicado en la Concepción, junto a su esposo  , el trabaja como transportista para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa , ella se desempeña como niñera en la embajada Americana desde hace tres años, esta señora quiere mejorar su vivienda ya que no tiene la división de los cuartos y también quiere poner piso en la parte de sala ; por lo cual ella solicita la cantidad de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas para mejorar su vivienda .Y cumplir con su sueños ya que tiene una hija de ocho años y quiere que la pequeña tenga su cuarto aparte al igual que ella .
texts.en:
Juana Maria A. B. is 28 years old, she lives in Los Cocos suburb in Concepcion, together with her husband. He works in transport to help with the household expenses and she's worked as a nanny at the American embassy for the last three years. This lady wants to improve her home as it's not divided into rooms and she also wants to lay a floor in the living room. For this she is requesting a loan of $5000 cordobas to improve her home. This will let her achieve her ambitions as she has an eight-year old daughter and she wants her to have her own bedroom separate from Juana's.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse construction materials to divide her home into rooms, and to lay a floor

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Rose has been in this business for a long time.  Rose is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his equipment.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ropa para su comercializarlos en las ferias de Pilcuyo e Ilave.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar casacas al mayor, dada la época de lluvia,  y los comercializará en las ferias. Con las ganancias ella ayuda en la educación superior de sus hijos y en el sustento diario de su hogar. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida por los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a member of the “United Stars of Titicaca” Community Bank in the town of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She has finished only a quarter of her secondary education. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her business is buying and selling clothes. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to acquire clothes to market in the fairs in Pilcuyo and Ilave. With this loan of 500 soles, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly installments. The loan will be used to buy jackets at wholesale, given the time of the rain, and will market them in the fairs. With the earnings, she helps pay for the higher education of her children and for the daily sustenance of her family. She is very thankful for the loans offered by Manuela Ramos for their development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy jackets at wholesale, given the time of the rain, and will market them in the fairs. With the earnings, she helps pay for the higher education of her children and for the daily sustenance of her family.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахимжон Тангриев 1968 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Жена домохозяйка, помогает по уходу за скотом. Дома и на даче есть коровы и бычки. На дачу ездит жена и ухаживает за скотом. Когда необходимо посылают детей отвозить корм или еще за чем либо. Сам Рахимжон кроме откорма скота и работает фермером в колхозе, но зарплату получает не деньгами а продуктами. С Микроинвест сотрудничает  около года. В дальнейшем планирует расширить свой коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Rahimjon T. is married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker and helps to care for livestock. They have cows and bulls at home and at the dacha (farmhouse). The wife travels to the dacha and takes care of the livestock there. When necessary, they send the children to bring livestock feed or to run other errands. Besides raising livestock, Rahimjon works as a farmer at a collective farm, but receives salary in food products, not money. He has been working with MicroInvest for about a year. He plans to expand his business in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Aid

texts.en:
Aid is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in Southern Lebanon with his wife. Aid owns a bakery. He makes "mankoucheh," which looks like a folded pizza and is most often topped with zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it at anytime of the day but, somehow, it tastes better in the morning. 

Aid has requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase raw material for his work. This is the first time that Aid has requested a loan.

Aid is distinguished in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. His clients are people from his area. Aid chose his business because he always wanted to open a bakery and has experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Aid will use the loan to purchase raw material for his work.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 54-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Naser has been selling home products for four years. Naser requested a loan of US $1500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Naser has requested a loan.

Naser is speciA. in his work because he sells a big variety of items. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Naser decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on starting a new business which will sell CDs.

loans.use: To purchase home products for resale

loans.name: Subira In Mpaka Group

texts.en:
Halima has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for resale and expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.

Halima is 45 years old, widowed, and has four children: ages 31, 30, 25 and 20. She also cares for one additional dependent.

Halima will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanahaji and Dalila. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale and expand her business

loans.name: Siguikame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguikame est constitué de cinq  femmes (dont trois mariées et deux  célibataires) qui ont en moyenne  de 34 ans  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3 ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, pagnes wax, fruits, habillements pour enfants, charbon de bois etc. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous les  deux prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  20 sacs charbon de bois , 15 pièces de pagnes  wax, 20 régimes de bananes, 10 paniers de mangues et 20 complets d’habillements  pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues, la plupart au comptant, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille   et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Siguikame ambitionnent d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation  et  d’autres  d’ouvrir leur propre boutique à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The group Siguikame is composed of five women (three who are married and two who are not). They average 34 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani I, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, including selling fabrics, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fruit, children's clothing, charcoal, etc. The group members are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and are on their third solidarity loan. Both preceding loans were settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 15 bolts of Wax pagnes, 20 bunches of bananas, 10 baskets of mangoes, and 20 outfits for children. Supplies are gotten at the marketplace of Bamako, from Médine in Sikasso City, and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at different marketplaces of Sikasso, within families, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 19,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business. Certain women of the group have the ambition to buy a plot of land on which to live, and the others, to open their own shop in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S. is 36 years old and lives in Phnom Penh city. To earn a living, she has been selling sugar cane juice and beverages in front of the garment factory since 2004. She is able to make US$5 profit per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes US$3 every day. This couple has two young children who attend school. Mao S. would like to take out a loan to purchase more beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Liên Lê Thị (1207021008) is a 38-year-old femaL. living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Liên owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a restaurant. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Liên has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Liên joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Liên is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Irma Beatriz Martínez Palacios

texts.es: Irma Beatriz M. P. vive en el departamento de San Vicente ubicado en el oriente del país. Irma tiene tan solo 24 años de edad  vive con su hija Luz de 7 años que actualmente se encuentra cursando kínder, el esposo de Irma trabaja en Estados Unidos y aporta a la familia 200$ mensuales. Irma se dedica a la venta de frutas como mango, papaya, guayaba entre otras, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de Zacatecoluca; Irma posee buenas ventas ya que distribuye sus productos a clientes fijos en el transcurso de la semana. Irma solicita un crédito por que desea aumentar su inventario para poder comercializar su frutas al por mayor donde le permitirá obtener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Beatriz M. P. lives in the department of San Vicente in the east of El Salvador. She is only 24 years old and lives with her 7-year-old daughter Luz, who currently attends kindergarten. Irma's husband works in the United States and supports the family with $200 a month. Irma makes a living selling fruits, such as mangoes, papayas, guavas, among others. Her business is located in the Zacatecoluca market, and she has good sales because she distributes her products to a fixed clientele over the course of the week. Irma is requesting a loan because she wishes to increase her inventory in order to sell her fruits at wholesale, which will give her better earnings margins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of fruits

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
S. Abdurahim is married with three children.  He works in the agriculture and livestock industry. His strength in work is cultivating livestock. Abdurahim has always been dedicated to managing his crops through fumigation and care to obtain a good harvest. Now Abdurahim needs to invest in his livestock business by purchasing cows to raise and to obtain milk for sustenance and to sell. For this reason he seeks support from IMON International by asking for a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business. With your help Abdurahim can get ahead in his business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn L. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Merlyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 9500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou D. est une jeune femme célibataire de 30 ans. Elle vend des fruits de saison tels que mangues, mandarine, orange et pastèque. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d’aider à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a single 30 year old young woman. She sells seasonal fruits such as mangoes, mandarins, oranges and watermelons. This business allows her to provide for herself and to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seasonal fruit sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Tanganyika borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 9 and 4 years old.

Maria has owned a maize business for 5 years, she works  12 hours a day and  she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maria`s first loan  from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Maria hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Chata's Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 46 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de parentés et font comme activités génératrices de revenus le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre et sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent d’acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, des chaussures pour hommes et femmes et des pièces de bazin, qui seront vendus à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans les activités et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group of Djiguisseme Association are married women who, on average, are 46 years old and have four children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Fana in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. They are neighbors or family members to each other and run small convenience stores with diversified articles. Four years ago these women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use their loan to buy large quantities of food condiments, shoes for men and women, and pieces of basin (a composite cloth made of linen and cotton). They sell their articles to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs (US$89) each per month. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and spent part of it to provide for their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Our client is Roxana.  She is part of a comunal bank consisting 11 neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Cusco.

She is 36 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She sells beauty products and clothing. With the loan, she will buy more products and clothing to sell.

Roxana appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: beauty products and clothing

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es: María Rosario S. S. de 32 años de edad, reside en Sacacoyo en el departamento de La Libertad. Para María ha sido muy difícil sacar a su familia adelante, ella es madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad, a quien María como mucho sacrificios ha logrado darle un techo seguro. María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, lo que ofrece casa por casa  de manera ambulante, pero su principal desempeño es el que hace como fotógrafa a domicilio, para todo tipo de evento. Ella solicita un crédito para invertir en accesorios para su cámara y así lograr mejores resultados en sus fotografías deseadas.
texts.en:
María Rosario S. S., 32 years old, lives in Sacacoyo in the department of La Libertad. For María, it has been hard to bring up her family, as she is a single mother of two small children. María has sacrificed a lot to provide them with a secure home.

María works selling catalog beauty products door-to-door. However, her main business is as a photographer in people’s homes. She takes photographs at all types of events. María is asking for a loan to invest in accessories for her camera, and in this way achieve better results in her photographs.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Camera accessories

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana. Felicia works hard to provide for the family. She is a trader of palm oil.  She buys the prepared oil from sellers in nearby communities and then sells it at the local market, and to retailers and food vendors in her community. Felicia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy palm oil in greater amounts.

loans.use: To buy palm oil.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. When he turned 18 he bought a small van to make a living by transporting goods. His business flourished and after a while he purchased a larger van to be able to accommodate the demand.

Today, Abbas is requesting $1,100 in order to fix his van and perform needed maintenance.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen P. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old. Carmen is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Carmen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Endanilia

texts.en: Endanilia C. is from the village of Sinian. Endanilia is 61 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Endanilia and her husband are engaged in fishing and farming. She is also engaged in selling hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant) in the local community. She has been engaged in her businesses for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Endanilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Endanilia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling footwear

loans.name: Without Money Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Without Money group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva.

Memuna C. is the leader of the group. Memuna was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is fifty-five years old. She is married and has 4 children. Memuna’s husband is a farmer and her children attend schools. Two of her children are in secondary school and 2 are in primary school. Memuna sell dishes, rubber bowls, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale quantities.

loans.use: Buy dishes, rubber bowls, palm-oil, rice etc. in wholesale quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Odilio

texts.es:
Odilio Venegas G. es un señor de  59 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde muy joven don Odilio se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya 40 años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Odilio desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢664,000 (seiscientos sesenta y cuatro  mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero.

Don Odilio es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Odilio Venegas G. is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Costa Rican community of General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón, which is located in Valle del General. The main economic activities are livestock breeding, farming, and trade with the last one having grown significantly through the creation of new job opportunities.

Don Odilio has been raising cattle since he was a young man as part of his family duties. He says that he has 40 years of experience in this field and is therefore knowledgeable in everything required to take care of the animals and can adequately instruct others how to do the same. He is very proud of what he has accomplished and has gradually progressed over time.

He is requesting a micro-loan of 664,000 CRC in order to buy more calves so that he can grow his business. Don Odilio wants to become a successful micro-entrepreneur and help his family move forward. This is one of the things that motivate him to strive and work with great care.

Don Odilio is a member of the Producers Association of El General, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also thanks these types of organizations that facilitate credit so that he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en:
Funmilayo owns a beauty salon. She styles hair and sells hair extensions and other accessories to her customers. She started this business fifteen years ago and is happy with the growth her business is experiencing now.

Funmilayo used her last Kiva loan she obtained through LAPO micro-finance to purchase more hair extensions, hair cream and accessories. This she said has improved her business.

Funmilayo is hardworking and hopes for more business expansion. She is asking for a loan of NGN 150,000 to again purchase more hair extensions, creams and accessories to sell. She says a very big thank you to Kiva lenders.

37-year-old Funmilayo is married with three children, her eldest being 10 years old and doing well in school. Her husband is an automobile engineer and they lives in Lagos State.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, creams and accessories to sell

loans.name: Jardines De Paz Group

texts.es:
Milagro del Socorro P. José, Felipa de los Ángeles Vivas y Alba Luz P. son tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que conforman al grupo Jardines de Paz. La coordinadora de este agrupación es la señora P. José de 56 años quien en 2003 invirtió sus ahorros en ropa y calzado. Ella es ese tiempo compro pequeñas cantidades actualmente con los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo y puede adquirir mayor mercadería.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Alba Luz P. quien en empleó su liquidación en el comercio de ropa interior y Felipa V. la cual en 2006 decidió poner su propio negocio que es una tortillería y rellenitas esta en un comienzo era poca la producción hoy en día seis medios de maíz diarios.
texts.en:
Milagro del Socorro P. José, Felipa de los Ángeles Vivas y Alba Luz P. are three hardworking and enterprising women who make up the group Jardines de Paz. The coordinator for this group is Mrs.P. José who is 56 years old and who invested her savings in the purchase of clothing and shoes in 2003. At the time, she purchased a small quantity but currently, thanks to loans, her business has been growing and she has been purchasing more merchandise. Her fellow group members are Alba Luz P. , who works selling undergarments, and Felipa V. who started her own business in 2006 selling corn-base food like tortillas and "rellenitas". She prepared a small quantity in the beginning but now uses a much greater quantity of corn daily.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa K. is a villager in Si Sla village in TaK. province and she was born in 1983. She is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land to grow rice for supporting her family's living. In the rice field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil, is far from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mrs. Channa K. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for farming. Her husband, Mr. Sothearot Kuch, is a laborer. She is a mother of two children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for farming

loans.name: God's Children Group

texts.en:
Browne P. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Children. He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is three years old.  Browne is currently a high school student.

For two years, Browne has been selling shoes at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia, Liberia. He says he sells the shoes “in a clean environment and at a low price,” which keeps customers returning. One of the challenges he faces is that there are many competitors in the market.

Browne plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more shoes. His goal is to expand his business and to live a healthy life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Browne is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase additional footware.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion’s 41-year-old husband, Rogelio, is a fisherman, and they have 5 children who are between 13-28 years old. Three of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores while the other two children are working in order to help the family.

Visitacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in pig fattening and fish vending businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Visitacion is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund the operations of her fish vending and pig fattening businesses which had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 5th loan the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use on her pig fattening and fish vending businesses. Visitacion is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy K. is a 28 year old married woman who lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectare of land to cultivate rice.  She also breeds pigs for selling to support her family. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. They have three children; two attend school and the youngest is a one year old. Chanthy decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.  Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Yarn

texts.en: Yarn K. Arn, 28, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Arn and her husband help each other in the taxi business from their province to the City. They are able to earn an income of USD 5 each per day. K. Arn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to repair the car.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to repair their car

loans.name: Christopher

texts.es: Christopher es un joven emprendedor, tiene 23 años, él vive a lado de su padre en su casa propia. Gracias a los cuidados de su padre, desde muy pequeño logró salir adelante y actualmente está dedicado al ámbito militar, pero sus ganas de apoyar a su padre y ser mejor han hecho que él decida trabajar independientemente, desde entonces vende zapatillas por pedido. Cristopher compra su mercadería al por mayor a un precio cómodo y posteriormente las vende por unidad a sus clientes. En un futuro él espera consolidar su negocio haciéndolo más amplia, pero sabe que aún le falta mucho camino por recorrer, mientras tanto seguirá poniéndole todo el empeño necesario para poder hacerlos realidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará al por mayor de zapatillas, para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Christopher, 23, is a young entrepreneur. He lives with his father in their own home. Thanks to his father’s care he got ahead in life from a very young age. He is currently in the military but his desire to help his father and be a better person led him to decide to work independently. Since then, he has sold sandals on order. Christopher buys his merchandise at wholesale at a good price and then resells it at retail to his customers. In the future he’d like to consolidate his business by enlarging it. However, he knows he still has a long road to travel. In the meantime, he will continue to put in whatever effort is needed to make his dreams become reality. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion. He will use the requested funds to buy sandals at wholesale in order to fill his pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals at wholesale.

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en:
Seepa T. is 63 and married with 8 children between 17 and 35. She owns a taro and banana plantation and has 4 years of experience in this business. Seepa needs a loan of WST$2500 to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Seepa joined SPBD in 2007. This is her 7th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Seepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa T. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, western Mongolia, in their own house. Her husband works in a local bakery industry and the elder daughter works as a cleaner while the younger two children attend a local high school. 

Yanjmaa operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. She started her business in 2008 with a small car. After a few successful years in business, she has gained much experience and a good reputation among her customers. Yanjmaa works very hard to provide for her family and to pay her children's tuition fees. She says, “My only wish is to support my children’s education and have them become good people."

 Yanjmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for her automobile.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her car

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in the historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. 
Suraiya lives in a three room brick house with her family near cantt area. She is a 34 year old lady and mother of two sons: fifteen year old Bilawal, who reads in the 10th standard and eleven year old Salman who is studying in 3rd standard. Her husband sells ready-made garments on order and supplies them to Lahore’s famous shopping malls like PACE & LIBERTY etc. 

Suraiya lives in a combined family system where her brother in law also lives. He works in a factory on a monthly wage. Suraiya makes decoration pieces on order and supplies them to different gift shops and decoration stores. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan amount will help him to buy ready-made garments in large quantities and to fulfill larger orders on time. She is very hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business by making an investment in his business. He has 18 years of experience in this field and knows the ups and downs very well. 

Suraiya is a new loan user of Asasah. She has not previously borrowed from any MFI ever and wants to build a long-term relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: Towards the purchase of ready-made garments to fulfill larger orders on time.

loans.name: Tural

texts.ru:
Tural A. 25 let. On jenat i imeyet dochku 3 let kotoroya xodit v detskiy sadik. Tural i yeqo semya jivut v Fizuli regione.

Tural uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey produktov. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy imel svoy maqazit po prodaje produktov dnevnoqo upotrebleniya. Tural seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Tural A. is twenty-five years old. He's married and has one daughter of three, who goes to kindergarten. They live in the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Four years ago he began selling food products; a business which he learned from his father, who had owned a store. Tural is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy more goods and expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 33 years old. Lina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lina buys and sells vegetables in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Lina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lina from ASKI.
