She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fatima Juliao

texts.pt:
Fátima Julião N. nasceu no Distrito de Inhassoro, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos que freqüentam a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuo devido a dificuldades financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Saiu de Inhassoro para Maputo com o seu esposo. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa nova e usada ha mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00 a 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum no xitique semanal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Ja teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt,9.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt e foi para a mesma actividade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para continuar com a melhoria de seu negocio.
texts.en:
Fátima Julião N. was born in the District of Inhassoro, Province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique.  She is the mother of two children who attend school.  She only finished fifth grade, and didn't continue due to her parents' financial difficulties.  She lives in her own house with her family and has no other dependents.

She left Inhassoro for Maputo with her husband.  She has had her own business selling new and used clothing for more than ten years; she has no employees and manages to earn an income of about 4,000 to 5,000 MT per month, which she uses for household expenses and still manages to set some aside every week in the xitique (traditional rotational savings system).

Fátima has already had loans from other banks.  She got to know about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution.  This is her fifth loan — at a value of 10,000 MT — with which she plans to purchase bundles of clothing to increase the quantity of her merchandise.  The previous loans were for 5,000 MT, 7,000 MT, 9,000 MT, and 10,000 MT, and were used for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will repay without any problem and will ask for a new loan in order to continue with the improvement of her business.

loans.use: purchase bundles of clothing

loans.name: Sugeida Concepcion

texts.es:
Sugeida tiene 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su familia administrando juntos el negocio desde hace ya 5 años, trabajando de lunes a domingo; este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para la familia es por eso que todos colaboran para atender a los clientes.
Ella quiere invertir en la tienda y para eso solicita un préstamo para el fortalecimiento de este y mejorar la atención a los clientes, su compra será en productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite) ya que son los más demandados por las personas que le consumen.
Desea crear un buen historial de crédito ya que espera desarrollar su negocio con esta ayuda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sugeida, 27, sells staple grains.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in the Usulután department, with her family.  She and her family have been running this business together for 5 years, working every day.  This business is the source of income for her family, and for this reason they all pitch in to serve the customers.  

She wants to invest in the store, and to do this she is requesting a loan to strengthen the business and improve the service provided to their customers.  She will purchase basic consumer goods (rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil) that are most in demand by her customers.  She wants to create a good credit history, since she hopes to develop her business with this support and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods (rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil)

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chorn B. (pictured above) who is 47 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Pov who is 42, have been married since 1992. They have three children, two sons and one daughter, and all of whom are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chorn is a chef. His wife is a farmer who grows jasmine. Chorn is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. He will also use a part of the loan to help fund his wife’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to help fund his wife’s farming business.

loans.name: Norma Iris

texts.es:
La sra. Norma C. es comerciante y actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotaría, actividad en la que cuenta con 4 cuatro años de experiencia, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “Iris”. 
Doña Norma a sabido ganarse su clientela por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, además de la venta de abarrotaría también vende ropa, zapatos y carteras lo que le genera un ingreso extra, estas ventas las realiza al crédito y de contado.
También cuenta con el apoyo económico por parte de su esposo que se encuentra viviendo en USA, quien le envía remesas.
Doña Norma es casada y es madre de tres hijos, en la actualidad uno de ellos cursa sus estudios primarios, otro sus estudios secundarios y el hijo mayor esta a punto de graduarse de la Universidad.
doña Norma utilizara el credito para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, desea salir adelante con su negocio y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma C. is a merchant currently selling groceries.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  Her store is called “Iris.”

Norma has secured her customers thanks to the kind way she treats them.  Besides her grocery sales she also sells clothing, shoes and purses which generate extra income.  These sales are both cash and credit.  Her husband also contributes to economic support since he is living in the United States and sends back monthly contributions.

Norma is married and has three children.  One of them is in elementary school, another in secondary school and the oldest is about to graduate from university.

Norma will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock the store.  She wants to get ahead with the business in order to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, noodles, pills, candles, light bulbs, soups, pastas, toothpaste, toilet paper, chilies, spices, salt, soap, shavers, sardines, beverages, juices.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey P. is a 40-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. Chey P. is married to Khoum Kna, also 40 years old. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have seven children. Six of the children are married and one is single. Due to the coming harvesting season, Chey P. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. She will then sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Chhem(Kem)

texts.en:
Chhem S., 31 years old, is married and devoted to her three children who are students in the local public school. She is married to 35-year-old Sara Vuth who helps support the family by running a motor taxi.

Chhem currently earns an income by selling vegetable that she buys from other local farmers in the busy market in the province of Kompong Cham. She is also a rice farmer. Chhem plants her crop on the farmland that she got from her grandmother, but now it is not growing well because her farm has no watering system.

Chhem would like a loan to buy a pump for irrigation. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

Note: Chhem S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, D. 51 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en L. vida. L. tienda D. abarrotes D. María es una D. las más concurridas D. su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y L. amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea L. preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desD. muy temprano, ya que saben que es L. primera en abrirse.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 8 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, ya que tiene que atender D. corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal D. su barrio. Este el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas provisiones para su tienda D. abarrotes y así incrementará su stock D. productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 51 very kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house and what she wishes for herself is to excel in life. Her grocery store is one of the most crowded in the neighborhood; her charisma and kindness with the customers, have maD. it the favourite one by her neighbors who know they can make their purchases already early in the morning, as they know she is the first one to open.
What she likes about her job is talking with neighbors about things that happen in the neighborhood. She has been in the business for eight years and she believes that the hardest part of it is having to spend all day insiD. her store, since she must be always available if she does not want the business to decrease.  For the future, she would like to see her business growing and becoming the main one in the neighborhood. This is her tenth loan from MFP and she is aware that if she pays according to schedule, she will be able to access more easily to the next one and without complications for her community bank, which is strongly supported by all the members. With this money she will purchase supplies for her grocery store in order to increase the stock of products.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to respond to the increasing demand
